Reviews.Title: “A little expensive for what it offered”
Reviews.Author: RenataLG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, the staff is really friendly, the room was huge!!! But the internet access was not that easy, and its speed was too low. The furniture was a little old and rhe control of the temperature wasn't that simple as well. Anyway, it's a very goos hotel, but I think it was a little too expensive, considering breakfast was not included, and costed 18€ per person per day!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable price, excellent service, very friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: Karismasul
Reviews.Content: I found on offer for an Privilege Suite and I must admit that I was a bit skeptical, since I had never stayed at a Mercure Hotel before. However, it was an extremely nice experience: The staff were so friendly and sweet, the room was excellent (we had a huuuge bed), according to my mom (who is an expert when it comes to cleanness) it was very clean, room service was nice (not to pricey) parking was easy and breakfast was great too. And you got Unter den Linden just around the corner and Brandenburger Tor just a short walk away... I have already recommended it to my friends and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fantastic room and delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Joanna W
Reviews.Content: Even though we were deeply disappointed by Berlin as loud and unpleasant city, where you have to have cash in your pocket, cause credit cards are not everywhere accepted, and everything has it's price (even taking photograph of monuments costs 2 euro (SIC!)), the Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie was an extraordinary experience. The room was spacious and smart design with separated corner for the child bed, so both parents and the child had their private space. TV offer included also non-German channels (which is not a standard in Gernam hotels unfortunately), bathroom was nice and very clean, toilet separated from the bath, which is very convenient for family. The coffee maker in the room (capsul type) made us fast and tasty coffee in the morning. Breakfast in the hotel was a delicious experience. The food was very fresh, served beautifully, very tasty. The choice of food was huge, starting from delicious German specialities, through the standard English breakfast, also including healthy choices as well as products for alergic and vegetarians. Last but not least the service was very nice. Hotel employees speak very good English (which is also not a standard in Germany), they were very polite and helpful. I will always be recommending this hotel, and if I will visit Berlin again, I will definitely choose Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie as my place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It would be great if all hotels were run this way.”
Reviews.Author: TheBodach
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of nights here. Check-in was smooth. Rooms are big and modern and fresh. The windows open for cool air. The room is quality - 50% larger than the norm. The price of the room and breakfast was exceptional - very good value. The breakfast spread was also very good. They do not do a lot of hot - but the range of bread, cereal, cheese, fruit, juices etc. was more than I could stuff into my cheek pouches. Alcohol prices were high - that reflected central Berlin prices. Internet access pricing was very poor. They were wanting up to £7 per day. That is not acceptable. Free access only in the lobby is poor service. This is the only criticism I can level at the hotel. If they sort that, I will come back for my holidays year after year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Four-Star Hotel in Central Berlin (Mitte)”
Reviews.Author: Mark111746
Reviews.Content: I spent last week in Berlin visiting with my brother (who lives in Budapest). Each of us took a room at the Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie. The hotel was reasonably priced, centrally located, and provided exceptional service. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and responsive. The hotel rooms were large and attractively furnished. My brother's room (222) was a smoking room and had a balcony. (All rooms are non-smoking except those on the second floor.) My room (616) was near the elevator on the sixth floor, but was very quiet for restful sleep. Both rooms overlooked different and attractive courtyards. The breakfast buffet (included in the price of the room) was extraordinary, with a large variety of hot and cold foods of high quality. The common areas of the hotel (the breakfast room, bar and lobby) were decorated attractively with modern furnishings. There was a computer in the lobby for the personal and business use of the guests. The hotel location in Mitte was within walking distance of all the areas I had wanted to see (such as Museuminsel, the Reichstag, the Brandenberg Gate, the Tiergarten, Potsdammer Platz and the Philharmonie, the Jewish Museum and the New Synagog, Nicolaiviertel and Alexanderplatzplatz). There were great restaurants near the hotel, and one of the best chocolate stores in Europe (Fassbender & Rausch) just a short walk away. The rate for the hotel was extremely reasonable. I will unquestionably stay at this hotel whenever I return to Berlin. One minor criticism: while there was free wireless access (as well as the one wireline computer for guest use) in the hotel lobby, the quality of the wireless connection in the room (for which there was a charge) was not very good. (Shortly after trying the room wireless connection, I cancelled my order for a full refund.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Donal133
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in. The room was brilliant,the service was excellent and very friendly. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: williams_joshua
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, only about 15 min. walk to many shops and restaurants as well we had no problem walking around the area late at night. The room itself was excellent, it had a great bathroom, bed, and featured a nice little coffee making system. The breakfast in the mornings was also above standard for many of the hotels throughout Germany. The only downside we found was having to pay for internet access in the room, this becomes an issue if you just want to log on for a moment and check for a restaurant or museum and you end up paying for just a few minutes of use. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome was extremely lacking- a pity for an overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Galway_Lady
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good overall. Location was great, very central, and I really liked being near to 'Checkpoint Charlie'. I had a suite in the hotel, which was nicely appointed, and quiet. As someone who trains people in customer service, I really place a lot of my value on my 'first impressions'... I think many hotels do not place enough emphasis on this!! My first impression? I was asked what was my surname, how did I spell it and pointed towards a lift. Definitely not a good impression!! Please please be aware that the people on the reception are the all important first impression for the guest. In that respect only, did I feel that the hotel disappointed. I pointed this out when the hotel contacted me about writing a review...and was assured it would not happen again?! On balance, I would encourage management in this hotel to be far more cognisant of the importance of first impressions, and to ensure that an overall good hotel is not let down by this all important first encounter.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location & room”
Reviews.Author: Tanya_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the last place we had stayed in during our trip. The hotel was in good location, right next to metro, Charlie checkpoint & the shops!! The room we had was very big. Enough space to fit another double bed. The room faced the main road so could open the large windows overlooking the road. The shower was fab also. Will definitely recommend this place for anyone & if I was to go again then I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Very happy customer.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Melanie L
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice large room for the three of us, great bathroom, comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: Bogdan B
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 days, 3 days attending a conference and 3 day enjoying Berlin, 20 years after my first visit. Because of the length of the trip I was worried a bit about the hotel, but all reviews were consistently good. My experience confirmed the good rating. Very spacious and well designed rooms, extra clean, nice bathroom with separate toilet room, and above all the most quiet room I've ever stayed in. I didn't have my laptop with me so internet access was not an issue. The breakfast was not included in the room price so I preferred having it in the many excellent coffee shops around the corner. The location is one of the best, on a quiet street but in the heart of the city. Charlie Point is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “great week-end in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Olivier C
Reviews.Content: great week-end in this hotel! big and clean room, well located, breakfast ok ! I would choose this hotel if I had to go back in berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Good place, great upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Jordi F
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for business during 3 days. The Summit I was assisting was at just 15 minutes walking from the Hotel. In fact, the hotel is very well located to visit the most important sites of Berlin if you are in a business trip and you have not very much time to do sightseeing. When I arrived, all rooms in the category I booked were already occupied and I recieved an spectacular upgrading. My room was big, with two floors, the biggest windows I've ever seen and very silent and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: stephanie d
Reviews.Content: chose this hotel for a cheeky weekend with my friend and it was perfect! the location was great as soooo much is just walking distance. The venue is lovely as well and easy to find. As it is a well known hotel it's easy for taxi drivers. We had a upgrade on arrival (awesome). Everything was very clean. The best part of our stay though had to be the staff. Then gentlemen on reception helped us chose a club to go to, they also booked our taxi. Also when we moaned about there being no kebab shops on our first night coming home (we are british- cant help ourselves!) the next night we came in the staff had arranged a little picnic with fruit and sweets as they knew we'd be hungry - WOW customer service indeed! Also in the rooms are a coffee machine with lots to choose from and the TV has loads of music channels so you can bop along while you are getting ready. what more do you need??? we had a great time us 2 girls but I have also recommended the place to my parents as it is a great all round venue at a fantastic price

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Odette C
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! Good location, nice & clean rooms, good breakfast very attentive staff. Special thanks to Martin from the Front Office. He was very helpfull and polite. I would return to this nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly & attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: GSBD
Reviews.Content: The moment you enter from the door you are made to feel the most important to them. Very friendly and attentive staff at the reception, even going out of their way to assist. What very much impressed me and my collagues were the way your questions were being handled and the assistance to detail being offered by the reception staff, taking time to google for directions and even requesting you to come over to their side of the reception to show you what information they have resourced out of the computer to answer your queries. The Breakfast was average but decent, and what made the difference is the serive staff, greeting you politely and ensuring you are fine with, even offering the coffee to be broughtto your table despite the self service coffee machine being available. The rooms were great in size, very comfortable, clean, except that despite providing a coffee machine free of charge, not water was being provided, neither did it mention that the water in the normal taps are suitable for the purpose, Neverthless, would recommed and will certainly go back on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Wilhelmus
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel at a good location in Berlin. The rooms are clean, staff is friendly and the price was reasonable. We travelled with a baby and the staff was very accommodating. They helped cleaning bottles, hot water, etc. The hotel bar is small but with a few people can have a great atmosphere. The breakfast buffet looks decent but is too expensive in my opinion. There are small cafes nearby where you can grab a coffee and a croisant for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “OK location, reasonable prices, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Yavor
Reviews.Content: well, the title says it all. The location could have been more central so that's why I do not rate it excellent

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: JackGMiami
Reviews.Content: decent rates, good breakfast (better tahn regular european standards) ample room, many channels to watch, sauna, etc attentive staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice property and location for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Stephen H
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location next to checkpoint charlie and easy access to Berlin public transportation. Received a free upgrade to a suite and had a two floor room and two bathrooms. Wonderful modern design which nice features and a great coffee maker for both espresso and americano. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was clean, comfortable, and quite. Cons: Only complaint was a shortfall on my part, I failed to inquire on the cost of the breakfeast buffet not sure that it was or wasn't included. The buffet was perfectly good but not what I would say great. Problem was found out at checkout it was 17 euros! Everything else in the hotel was great, but the surprise at checkout wasn't, but I should have asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great value central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesal64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie hotel for one night. The room was large, well equipped and spotless. Right next to Checkpoint Charlie, and only a fifteen minute walk from the Brandenburg gate. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: cr1msnm00n
Reviews.Content: Booked the Mercure because last stay in Berlin during Berlinale was a disaster. Was very pleasantly surprised. Clean, modern, spacious, great facilities (which I didn't have time to sample), wonderfully courteous and professional staff, fabulous buffet breakfast and the room was superb - spacious and more than adequate for the needs of one person - great coffee machine in the room btw.

Reviews.Title: “"see you next year again in Fruita Logistica "”
Reviews.Author: irfankeskin
Reviews.Content: Every year we tried another hotel during Fruita Logistica Fair..so happy that this problem is now over with Mercure Check Point...large room..clean bathroom..wonderfull breakfast..nice location.. helpfull staff...however, small Bar at the lobby and not enough skilled Bar men and no mini bar in the spacious hotel room !!!..but it bis not a big problem... we will come back again...

Reviews.Title: “Just one (big) problem”
Reviews.Author: stefanotorino
Reviews.Content: I had already written about this hotel. It could be the perfect place. But the management insists with music. There is music in the hall (you have to raise your voice to speak to the people at the check in desk) and music at all floors in the corridors, so loud that YOU CAN HEAR IT FROM INSIDE YOUR ROOM! Of couse there is music in the breakfast room, in the elevator... The rest is perfect, so if you like non-stop music you can definitely choose this clean, modern, convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All in the Detail - Berlin”
Reviews.Author: andrew001
Reviews.Content: Mercure is not my normal choice when travelling on Business but this hotel was just a short walk from my meeting so it made sense. What a good choice it turned out to be!! On arrival the reception team were very courteous and friendly. I booked a Superior Room and was provided with what in Europe was really a Suite. Seperate WC and shower rooms (no bath), large bedroom area that led into a seperate 'lounge/dressing room'. In the middle of the areas was a large desk which had a swivelling flat screen TV so it could be watched from either the Bed or the sofa. A coffee machine and mini bar built into the desk. Free WiFi is included with this room selection which was fast and easy to access. The hotel has a small Fitness room with a couple of machines and a nice Sauna area. Unusually the Sauna is available 24 hours a day. Be aware that this is a typical German sauna so FKK rules apply but great to be able to use the facility at midnight. A really nice touch is that on Tuesdays and Wednesdays the hotel provides complementary Massages if you book with Reception in the morning. It is only 20 minutes but a great service. The hotel does not have a 'restaurant' but does provide a range of Bar Meals at very resonable prices. 3 courses such as Soup, a Pasta Dish and Apple Strudel with a beer is about 20 Euro. There is a choice of about 6 main courses. This was really great as when I stayed the temperature was very cold and walking to eat was not what I wanted. Location is very close to the Check Point Charlie crossing, just a 2 minute walk and the hotel is a 20 minute taxi ride from Tegal Airport, again about 20 Euro. So all in all great service, good food, ability to relax in the sauna, comfortable bed in a good sized room in a central location. What more could you ask for??

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: DandyDLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it. On arriving we received an unexpected upgrade to a superior room which was a nice treat. An excellent breakfast is served and there is free wi fi in the reception area ( there is however a small charge if you want it in the room). If you don't have a computer with you there is one to use free of charge in reception for checking e mails and surfing. The hotel is very close to two underground stations, and there is a nice Italian on the corner which does fab pizzas. Due to having birthdays in the winter we often tend to take our city breaks around Jan time when find that there are fewer tourists around and the hotels often offer good deals ( like 3 nights for 2). It was pretty cold out though!!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: grntmb
Reviews.Content: This is our third year staying in this hotel the last week on January for a long standing conference. The staff is great! The rooms are large and are always ready after a long night flight and the restaurants surrounding the hotel are wonderful. The Stadt Mitte subway is a very short away and Frederich Strasse, a great shopping street is one block away. The breakfasts is an absolutely great hot and cold buffet complete with a new big espresso/hot chocolate maker was installed since last year. It's great,

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Murps84
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we had been informed that due to overbooking we were moved froma standard room to a "residenz room". It was really big, with a space for cooking to, extremely quiet and clean. The location of the hotel is good, using public transport you can reach every part of the city within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our winter city break”
Reviews.Author: PaulWuE
Reviews.Content: Not having been in Berlin since the '70s, it was a real treat to return and discover a completely different place--and our four-day stay at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie was a perfect choice. Located just off Friedrichstrasse on a very quiet side street, we could walk everywhere in the Mitte, and the U-bahn was just up the street for journeys further afield. A late-evening arrival from Schoenefeld caused no problem checking in, and our room was just what we needed with its warm, spacious, comfortable, smartly-appointed and welcoming feel. Very good breakfasts in the morning in a bright, well-organised, well-run and friendly room. I consider this hotel extremely good value and would recommend highly to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: cat-black
Reviews.Content: My feelings of this hotel are somewhat mixed. I stayed here whilst travelling around Europe. I took a taxi from the station to this hotel and upon arrival my first impressions were very favourable, then i checked in. The lady at the reception took my details and informed me that she required a 50 euro deposit for the mini bar, per room. We had a bit of a debate about this as this was not mentioned when i booked this hotel, then she told me that they did not have 2 rooms in the hotel and they would have to put me next door in the "apartments". Now please don't think i had a problem with the apartments, they are in fact lovely, spacious, nicely done and a large dressing room. absolutely superb. what I had a problem with was her attitude to me, staying that she was doing me a huge favour by upgrading me with no acknowledgement of the fact that the mistake was in fact theirs. Apart from this one receptionist i would stay here again as it is in a good location for sights and shopping as well a terrific restaurant on the corner.Also on the other corner you can pick up the open topped tour bus there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: nickokkalis
Reviews.Content: Use the hotel for 2 nights with a group of friends Very efficient german check in Rooms were very clean and spacious even for 3 people with a huge flat screen and a brilliant coffee making machine.We didnt take the breakfast as we thought it was too expensive for 12 euros pp but we had some at a fraction of the price right on the next block.Extremely convinent location virtually next door to check point charlie but out of the way on a quite street and 5 min walk to the Stadmitte metrostation.While it was on the "east berlin"side was still cental for all major sites all around the city(even if berlin hasnt got a really city center area but many)Very helpfull staff at any time of the day.Well recommended hotel for a weekend away with friends.

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: dmitry a
Reviews.Content: I allways stay in Mercure hotels when travaling in Europe because everytime everything is Ok. (Room, food, lacation and all other services)

Reviews.Title: “Great family room”
Reviews.Author: Lee R
Reviews.Content: Would certainly come here again. Had a spacious family room - good breakfast and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie”
Reviews.Author: JENKS_13
Reviews.Content: 12 of us went to Berlin last weekend Jan 13th 2012 to Jan 16th. We stayed at the Mercure ,Hotel Checkpoint Charlie and it was fantastic, the staff were so friendly and helpful. Lovely rooms, coffee machine, hairdryer, safe, everything you could need. Great shower room and separate from the wc. Rooms cleaned every day. Free use of pc including printer. Really can't fault it at all. Had an amazing time in Berlin, so much to see and do, Topography of Terrors, Jewish museum, Pergamon museum to name but a few. Great places to eat and everyone is so friendly and the city was very safe to walk around. Public transport was a breeze, worth getting the welcome card if staying 72 hours, means to can get to and from the arirport and travel all around by validating the card once. Went to Felix restaurant, (Uma restaurant) bar and nightclub on the Saturday and I would definitely recommend this, great night was had by all. I for one will definitely be going back to Berlin, still so much more to see. If you are considering it then all I can say is don't hesitate, book it and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again if in Berlin....”
Reviews.Author: Lesie_N
Reviews.Content: Hi Everybody, Just got back today from Berlin (from my solo trip). The hotel is perfect, the staff is amazing, the rooms were very big (for European standard). As somebody else mentioned the rooms were very hot, I agree but opening the window was fine. I loved how the toilet and shower were separated. My room was very quiet and the beds / blanket were amazing. The only thing I would like to mention is that the house keeping did not replace most things after used like the towels, toilet paper, missing shower cap, no shower gel or body cream etc.... The museum (Checkpoint Charlie) is right around the corner and I suggest you take a visit there. Also the Curryworst museum is almost right next door, (if u never tried a currywurst you def need to!) Overall I would rate this hotel 8 stars. I miss it already.....

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Hotel Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Daniel K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel just after New years & found the hotel excellent, from the spacious room, lovely breakfast buffet & politeness of the staff. Also being walking distance from Charlies checkpoint etc... Would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Hotel très bien situé, calme et spacieux”
Reviews.Author: PaulHello
Reviews.Content: Très bien situé, bon accueil, chambres (privilèges) très spacieuses - quasi une suite - petit déjeuner copieux et varié. Pas un bruit parasite. Personnel souriant et aimable. Ils se sont mis en quatre pour nous trouver un restaurant le soir de Noël.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - stay there!”
Reviews.Author: DanielTraveller73
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely clean hotel, really friendly staff, superb spacious room and lovely breakfasts. Faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: rachye
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good for its purpose. Clean, comfortable and close to main attractions. My only downside its that it was a bit too hot in the room.

Reviews.Title: “overated hotel...4 star = ticking boxes, not excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: ClareBear1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends over 2012 new years for 4 nights and I have to say, we were regrettably disappointed and wished we had booked a honest boutique hotel in Berlin. To put it simply this is why we rated our stay so poorly: 1) Upon arrival our hotel bathroom smelt of urine and we asked reception staff to kindly send someone up to clean the floor...it took 4 attempts to explain and even so, it was not understood and after a chambermaid visited, the smell still didn't pass as clean 2) the hotel and room was incredibly HOT all the time. I know it's the middle of winter, but sickly heat, to the extend we had to open our hotel windows all the time (even whilst sleeping) is ridiculous. We did not turn on our heating at all 3) Breakfast was 18 EURO each and really not value for money. By the time we arrived there was still an hour left for breakfast and it appeared like the food had ran out and were never re-filled. Given you can buy a decent breakfast for under 5 euro in Berlin. This is disgusting. 4) If the staff reception had to tell us something, instead of leaving a conventional message, they would stop our access to the hotel room by de-magnitising our cards, only to have to go to the hotel reception for some silly information that we already knew. I thought this was rather stupid. I wouldn't have even mentioned this if it hadn't happened 3 times! 5) Please don't call it a fitness centre and put large signs in reception, nor post on the website it has a gym. Call it a treadmill and cross trainer - full stop. 6) Internet wifi for the rooms never worked and after speaking with the m3connect directly (instead of the hotel staff helping), even they couldn't assist. Why outsource your customer service to an internet company is beyond me. The hotel staff were pretty much useless. Otherwise, the hotel rate was fine, location was fairly ok being so close to check point charlie and working distance to the shopping strip. I will never stay at another mercure or acor hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: C_Hedlund
Reviews.Content: Property is a short walk to Checkpoint Charlie and a decent walk to the Brandenburg Gate. Overall, the room was spacious and comfortable. I had a room overlooking the courtyard and did not any issues with street noise. Bar is tiny, but servicable.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel in a good location made our first visit to Berlin a good one!”
Reviews.Author: Mibley
Reviews.Content: Responsive & friendly service, comfortable & clean rooms, delicious breakfast feast, altogether a really enjoyable place to stay. We were able to walk to most of the sights we wanted to visit, and transport was easy otherwise. We were given a connecting room that turned our two family rooms into one large suite ( at no extra charge) which was briliant for our family of five. There was no problem with towels and toiletries, as mentioned by another reviewer. The icing on the cake was the offer of a complimentary massage on Tuesday evenings. Both my daughters and I booked in for the massage which was fantastic! We would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: mljstravel
Reviews.Content: Very large clean quiet room (for the standard tariff) and good buffet breakfast make this a good family hotel. It does only look like a few large blocks from the shopping areas of mitte, but that did often feel a little far in cold weather, and when baby in pram. Perhaps somewhere closer to the action worthwhile if you dont like walking too far. Staff initially not very friendly or helpful at first, especially at communicating when our room would be ready after a long international flight.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was quite good but i would like to mention some things that were quite inconsistent with the rating of the premises. To name just a few, the room was not being cleaned on a daily basis neither were the towels being replaced. The same applied to bathroom soaps and shampoos, which basically were only provided once for a 4 night stay. After filing the relevant complaints with the reception only an apology was provided but nothing was done to further support our stay and our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise”
Reviews.Author: AddAdrTA
Reviews.Content: As stated above, this stay was a very good surprise. I booked a family room at a very attractive price. The room turned out to be a suite with 2 very large rooms, a separate WC and a large bathroom with both an Italian shower and a bath tube. All modern & clean furnitures, comfortable seats and bedding. Wifi access was provided for free. Only minus were these damn blankets that you can find a lot in Germany and Nordic countries (one blanket per person). There was a bar in the hotel that had quite a success but I did not use it. Same for the breakfast that sounded quite nice. Check-in/Check-out were ok and quick. Location was quite convenient. Close to many attraction points. Though I don't know the regular rooms, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Knut V
Reviews.Content: We were well received and got an upgrade of our room without any extra charge, The room was facing the backyard so we could not hear the traffic outside at all. This is definately one of the best rooms we have ever had. Brakfast was very fine and the lack of in-house restaurant was no problem at all. There was at least 10 restaurants within 5 mitutes walk from the hotel. A very smart choice for your Berlin stay, Tora and Knut from Norway.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WanderersACT
Reviews.Content: We had three nights at the Mercure and were very happy. We would've rated it excellent had the room not been quite so hot. We opted for a superior room and had both a sitting area and bedroom - very spacious. The Mercure was within walking distance of most of the things we wanted to do as toursits and there was an excellent restaurant just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne Charlie”
Reviews.Author: luxuryaddict
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel very late at night but found the front desk clerk to be as fresh as a daisy and extremely helpful. There was a minor problem with our booking which resulted in our room being upgraded to a suite. This turned out to be a split-level apartment, nice and quiet and very clean. Heated floor in the bathroom was lovely especially after a day out in the cold walking miles around Berlin. We didn't eat in the hotel but found plenty of cafes within a short walking distance. The location couldn't be better, just a few yards from the U2 line which takes you all the way across the city. Brandenburg Tor was a 10 minute walk away and the pretty Christmas Market at Gendarme was even closer. I agree that the coffee maker was a bonus, great for first thing in the morning. Polite and helpful staff made a huge difference, they were all very friendly and efficient, speaking excellent English ( put your phrase book away - you won't need it). All this guff about internet & wi-fi connections? Relax and leave it alone, absorb the culture and enjoy the ride.

Reviews.Title: “Price and quality balanced”
Reviews.Author: Protravellers Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is quite good - two blocks from Checkpoint Charlie and metro station(s), Potsdam Platz is in walking distance and even Brandenburg Tor or Alexander Platz can be reached by foot. But in Berlin you need public transport, because the east and west "centers" still exist and the distance between those is quite long. For that purpose a group ticket for five five people is extra ordinary good choice,when you are travelling in a small group or with family. The ticket cost 15 euros per day and it offers unlimited use of public traffic in sectors A and B - 50 cents more and you can have also sector C included. The hotel is just between east and west. The rooms are quite big and well equipped. The breakfast table offers a wide range of possibities to have a good meal to start the day. The front desk staff is kind, they are willing to serve and they also can English well. There is also a small bar just next to lobby to have some drinks. The offering is quite limited, but it is understandable, because there is no visitors outside the hotel. The only thing to complain is the internet connection. In the lobby, there is a very limited area where you can connect wireless to internet free of charge. Otherwise you need to pay 9 euros for a day or less (5 or 3 euro), if you want have only a limited period for internet connection. Nine euros is about 10% of the room price which still includes unneccessary things like wired phone, tens of German/French/English speaking TV channels, coffee machine among other things that influence much more on the cost level than wireless internet connection. It is a pity that so many hotels are still trying to make their profit by an overpriced internet connection. Otherwise the hotel offers a good value for money and it also gives you a nice stay in this "different" big city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: JLDEB82
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel right in the centre of the city and within walking distance to many sites. All the staff were friendly. The room itself was bigger than my apartment back home! The free coffee maker in the room was definitely a bonus. The bed was super comfortable and the television offered many English language programs (mostly news stations). The breakfast was excellent. My only complaint regarding that was on my last day, I went down for breakfast at around 9:30 (when other days I was there at around 7:30) and they were out of many items. It did not seem as though they were replacing anything even though there were still many people coming into the breakfast room. Nonetheless, it was delicious! It was included in the room rate, but I do not know if it is included for everyone. Either way, there are many alternatives around the hotel, including Cafe Aroma down the street. My one major complaint: the "fitness room" consists of a treadmill (and only a treadmill!). I think this is misleading for those booking the hotel. However, on top of that, one requires a "security cord" in order to start the treadmill. The hotel only has one "security cord" and while I was there, a previous guest has allegedly taken it home with him/her, so the treadmill was completely out of use. It was suggested that I go to Holmes Place down the street and get a day pass. Mercure did not offer to pay for the day pass (which was 29 Euros!), which I think they should have since their website claims to offer something that they were then unable to do. Due to this, I would hesitate staying at this hotel again since fitness centres are something I look for when booking a hotel. Also, if you're going for a little shopping, beware of Geox down the street on Friedrichstrasse. The staff who work there are beyond rude and are verbally abusive to customers. Geox does not care about this.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous suite”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Fabulous stay at this hotel. Stayed for 4 nights, when we arrived to check in, we were booked into an amazing suite with a balcony!! (sadly it was November and too cold to make the most of it). Very clean, staff very efficient and spoke amazing English putting our German to shame. Great location just around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie. Walking distance to Friedrichstrasse, Unter den Linden, the Brandenburg Gate and the Museum Island, or else a 2 or 3 minute stroll to Stadmitte station. Would absolutely return and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterfulton
Reviews.Content: Visited for 5 nights. Splendid location ( a little hard to find on foot from Stadmitte underground), spotlessly clean, very friendly and helpful staff. A superb welcome, lovely facilities and great service. well located for many of the central points and easy to connect by train. Make sure you get a Berlin Card for travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Erin M
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel in a great location. Staff are extremley friendly and helpful! Would recommend staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mercure - Check Point Charlie - Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Gil R
Reviews.Content: This was the second year running that we stayed at the Mercure - Check Point Charlie for a 3 night city break in Berlin. The hotel is excellent and in a very good location for walking around the sights of Berlin. The room was excellent - it was very spacious and very clean - nice bathroom and separate toilet, good wardrobe space. Even though there were 3 of us sharing, we didn't feel at all cramped. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only criticisim we had this year was that over the weekend we were staying, the hotel was extremely busy (presumably because of the Christmas markets) and at breakfast time there were not enough staff to show people to a table (resulting in a queue) and to re-fill the food and drink containers. Berlin is a brilliant city and we will definitely go back again both to the city and to The Mecure Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “100% great”
Reviews.Author: David186377
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Berlin having stayed at this excellent hotel. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were impressed by the Mecure. The staff were most welcoming and delivered exceptional service (something that we did not encounter elswhere in the City). The apartment rooms were clean, spacious and above all comfortable; the bar a great place for a few beers and the meeting room conducive to work. If I was to be critical it would be on two counts - wirless internet was unreliable (kept going on and off) and breakfast on Saturday was a little chaotic. It is also worth noting that the hotel is well located, close to the Underground network. If I was to return to Berlin (and that is a big if - as I did not find the city that impressive) I would not hesitateand book the Mercure.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure Hotel - Check Point Charlie Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Debra B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful 4 day trip to Berlin. The hotel was excellent - very close to the old check point charlie and was a fantastic location for touring Berlin. All of the sight seeing buses we just around the corner. The room was fantastic, really bi and the staff were very helpful and friendly. I would definatley stay there again. The bed was so comfy, we wanted to bring it home! Excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at an attractive price”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent three nights at this hotel and were generally very satisfied. I booked a 'Privilege' room, but I'm not sure if this is what we got. The room assigned was on the first floor overlooking the main entrance. What was unique about the room is that it was on three levels. A lower level where a toilet and wardrobes were located, a sleeping level with TV and refrigerator and a upper level where the main bathroom (plus toilet) and the 'office' area were located. If I'm one hundred percent honest the sleeping area was a bit cramped. For example I could only walk sideways between the end of the bed and windows and I am not a particularly large person! The room rate I paid included breakfast and I must say the choice was extensive. If I have one gripe it is that the room was too warm at night despite our turning the radiators off. Opening the windows wasn't really an option because of the noise from the street. The hotel has air conditioning, but I was advised that this is turned off in the winter.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ouderkerk aan de Amstel, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good-priced hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Diederik_G
Reviews.Content: Nice big and clean room, great breakfast, very helpfull staff, liked the sauna. Only small 'cons': room a little warm, only one elevator available at our part of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Venus000
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Berlin (Nov 2011) and stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend. We arrived late on Friday night (around midnight) and were told our room was upgraded because it was the last one available (hooray for us!) Hotel location; PERFECT - very near to lovely area of town, 5 mins walk to U-bahn and super easy to get around. Plus there are some fantastic restaurants nearby - Cha Cha (asian fusion) and another Italian place at Checkpoint Charlie which is also around the corner. Staff were lovely and friendly - always. Hotel corridors were very quiet even though the hotel was full (we noticed at breakfast). Breakfast - excellent, large range of fruit, veg, eggs, omelette, cheeses, warm drinks, cold drinks, even pancakes and about 7 different honies to choose from! Room was lovely and large, could have done with a bit more decoration, maybe a picture on the wall, ok, but who cares?! Also read a previous review that said it looked like all furniture was bought in IKEA - i agree but again, who cares?! All sofas, beds, chairs, tables are all extremely comfortable and also easy on the eye. (And it was extremely clean.. spotless, with complimentary soap, shower gel, shampoo and moisturiser) Internet being expensive is a load of rubbish - yes if you want to use internet in your room for 6 hours it's 5 euros - but since when is that expensive?? And downstairs the internet and WIFI is free, so take your laptop / ipad / tablet downstairs and soak up the atmosphere of this great hotel. If we go back to Berlin we will definitely be staying here and no where else.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, spacious & well located”
Reviews.Author: nyjafo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for eight nights in November 2011. The room was quite large, spotlessly clean and with a balcony that overlooked a courtyard garden. The hotel is located within a short walk of either the Koch Strasse U6 line or the Stadtmitte U6 and U2 lines. The staff is friendly and attentive. One small downside is that the room could use better sound insulation, as noise from closing doors in the hallway or sounds from adjacent rooms can disturb your sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jpugliese
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an extremely convenient base for exploring the city. It provides for very easy to access local trasportation and ease get to the main city attractions. Rooms are quite large and very comfortable. There are great options for dining and nightlife close by. One of the only downsides is that for the room rate wifi and breakfast should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure hotel Checkpoint Charlie - a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Gee-in-the-Peg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in mid- September, 2011. The hotel is located in the Mitte district, in the former East Berlin side of the wall, very close to the old Berlin Wall and the actual checkpoint used when crossing over from the Allied Sector. The location was good, a bit off the beaten path of shops of Friedrichstrasse street (about 2 short blocks away), and the busy tourist corner of Checkpoint Charlie, which made for quiet nights. The hotel rooms are very large, nicely outfitted with large (king sized) bed, sitting chairs and small side table, desk/counter with flat screen TV (3 English language channels, all news stations), and coffee maker with single cup coffee brewing machine with some selection of different coffees (very small cups and strong European coffee). Pillows were very soft feather pillows. Bed covers consist of a bottom sheet and a duvet (down comforter) enclosed in another sheet. Heating system was quiet. The staff were very friendly. Hotel rooms are very clean, and very solid and quiet - didn't hear any noise at all, except one morning when the hallway (elevator type) music was blasting at 6am. The breakfast buffet is outstanding with a wide assortment of cold and hot foods, and good coffee served by the staff. But it is not cheap (13 Euros), so be sure to eat lots and well to justify the price. One morning when I was rushed I only had a cup of coffee and toast, and it was still 13 Euros! (my fault, should have known to go down the street to the subway and have a coffee for 1 Euro and a pastry for 1.50). There are a couple of restaurants right down the street as well. The food is limited to breakfast at the hotel. The hotel is a short walk to the Checkpoint Charlie subway (or U-Bahn) - about two short blocks. Another subway station, where two subway lines intersect, is about 4 short blocks away. Both are in relatively easy walking distance, but the Checkpoint Charlie station was our favorite as it was close by and less confusing than the other (StadMitte, which has the two lines, but separated by about a half block). There is not much of a bar - just a few tables. There is only one elevator (at least in my part of the building) but it is quite spacious and not in heavy use. Desk staff were very helpful in providing directions, calling taxi's, etc. although some staff did not know much about the touristy things (e.g. walking tours, where to rent bikes, etc.). There is an internet computer and printer available for guests to use, beside the front desk. Free WiFi is available in the small lobby and in the breakfast room. Slow, but serviceable connection. Extra fee for the same slowish internet in the rooms, so I just took my laptop with me to the lobby in the evening and to the breakfast area in the morning. I regularly drank water from the bathroom tap, and filled my water bottle daily with no issues (stomach not upset or anything). I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it. Berlin is an easy city to get around in, with the U-Bahn and S-Bahn covering most of the key areas. If you like to walk you easily can walk from the Mercure hotel at Checkpoint Charlie, North to the Gendarmenmarkt (Old churches, & buildings & restaurants), past the fancy shops on the Franzosische Strasse, to the Humbolt University libraries and churches/synagogue, to the Museum Island (Museums, Galleries and restaurants), etc. This covers much of the touristy area. The hotel is only a few blocks away from the "Topography of Terror" exhibition, and the Holocaust Memorial - both free admission, and excellent learning experiences. A short subway ride can get you to the AlexanderPlatz where there are more sights and food options. Also a short and easy subway ride to the PotsDamer Platz where there are plenty of shops, restaurants and malls. And lots of people. Others have said this is not a 4 star hotel, but I would say it is close to a 4 star in terms of service, room size and amenities and breakfast. I was not disappointed with it. One other thing - the rate I received was approx $155 per night, but as the weekend arrived the rates jumped to $275 per night, so I moved hotels for the last night to a much simpler and cheaper hotel (Etap Hotel Alexanderplatz) about 10 blocks from Alexanderplatz, ($60 per night), which was fine and clean but very spartan (I felt like I was staying in an Ikea display room!). Very good value if you only want to sleep in your room, although it did have a flat screen TV with Satellite service and more English channels.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but no four star”
Reviews.Author: sircampalot1
Reviews.Content: Location? Check! Right near Checkpoint Charlie and 2 mins to the Mitte Ubahn stop. Personnel? Check! Friendly and efficient. This is where the checks stop. The room furniture seems to have been purchased at Ikea. My one pillow was about a year too old. Wifi? Very expensive and keeps logging off. My breakfast buffet was not included, cost 18 Euro and was in no way worth that much. Lose a star, chop 40 euros off the price and then you've a got a hotel worth staying in. Right now, the price/quality equations simply doesn't add up.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: That's an excellent choice for tourism in Berlin! Great location, just few blocks away from the main spots and also metro stations. Our stay there would be flawless if weren't for the distraction on refilling the amenities on the room, including the courtesy bottle of Evian.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay”
Reviews.Author: Shims7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant. Max at the front desk was very helpful and assisted us so much with our enquiries. The boys at the bar were also great the two nights we had dinner there. The hotel is immaculate, great location (5 min walk from Stadmitte ubahn) and within walking distance of the city centre and sights. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MrsAW Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights at this hotel in a room overlooking the courtyard at the back of the hotel, which was very quiet. The location was good, easy to walk to all the points of interest in Berlin, with restaurants a few minutes walk away. Breakfast was good, and parking was easy, we parked one night on the street, free from 10pm til 9am, and one night in the hotel carpark. Overall, it was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SpirosK81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated less than 2 blocks away from Checkpoint Charlie and 3 blocks from the StadtMitte U-bahn station (thus conveniently located), the (double) room was *very* spacious (actually the second most spacious double-bed room I have ever been in) and the amenities and comfort were superb (there was even a TV speaker at the roof of the shower/WC)!! The area is safe even at night and there's super market and restaurants close-by. All in all, perfect!

Reviews.Title: “First class central hotel”
Reviews.Author: John856
Reviews.Content: Situated in the old eastern sector, this was ideally located for exploring Berlin. The hotel was clean, well equipped with friendly and helpful staff. As this was a combined business and family holiday the fact that breakfast was served over a long period was ideal.We had a privilege suite which was big and allowed everyone their "own " space, having two separate bedrooms. Public transport was a short walk away although we tended to walk to most places. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: margo d
Reviews.Content: a hudge room free upgrate), clean and chique, friendly staff, rich breakfast. near checkpoint charlie and all other things to see in a walk distance. we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel nex to Checkpoint Charlie”
Reviews.Author: ike-shibuya
Reviews.Content: A big room (2 bedrooms), very well suited for a family of four! Clean, functional hotel. Easy access to TXL.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, enjoyed privilege suite”
Reviews.Author: H_Marjatta_H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in April 2011. There were 4 of us: me, my husband our 1 year-old son and my father. We chose Privilege suite with 2 double beds. The suite was great for our purposes and the price was also OK, in my opinion. Everything there was great or at least OK, so nothing to complain,

Reviews.Title: “Monitoring Committee of Baltic Sea Region Programme”
Reviews.Author: Martti A
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel as convenient, quiet and clean one. The structure (construction & design) is rather complex. The only issue, which arose to me as a question mark, was, that I found my legs slightly bleeding from two itching points: I didn't find any reasonable explanations to this. The only one I mentioned to the receptionist was potential bugs (=bedbugs, Cimex lectularius). Anyway this experience was a totally new one for us (my wife and me), and lead when returning home to a total desinfection of our cloths and suitcases & toilet-bags.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and confort.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very good and quick service. Comfort and cleanness at the highest level. The perfect place for business men, everything comes without asking (e.g. wifi, taxi,...). High value for money. This is definitely one of my best stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “easytrvlr”
Reviews.Author: easytrvlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights late september 2011. Hotel was very clean and inviting. Rooms were large and very clean. Staff was friendly and helpfull. It is very centrally located for doing all of the touristy things. The rooms are also very quiet which is nice when you want to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, clean hotel, great location - will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Sopd
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous 3 night stay at the Mercure. I received a complimentary upgrade on check in to a great, spacious apartment. The hotel is quiet, extremely clean and has the most friendly, helpful staff. The location is perfect, a 2 minute walk to an underground train station and the hotel is right at checkpoint Charlie. Everything about my stay was perfect, I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly & knowledgeable staff who go above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: gpbenjamin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon for approximately 5 days in Aug 2011. Upon arriving there was a minor mixup and we were given a room with twin beds which we were disappointed about. After speaking to the concierge we were upgraded to an apartment accommodation (Residenz) which is a fantastic room with separate living and kitchen areas and a sun-lit balcony free of charge. The hotel It is very well located with only a few minutes walk from checkpoint charlie and other sites. The staff all spoke excellent English and were very knowledgeable and helpful whenever we asked for any assistance. On the day of our departure we slept in and then in our mad dash to the airport to catch our plan we accidentally left a suitbag with suits and dresses hanging in the cupboard. We got in contact with the hotel when we reached our next destination and they very promptly arranged for it to be sent on to us and all they asked of us was to cover the postage cost. I can not say enough good things about this hotel and will definitely stay there again next time I'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Zafera82
Reviews.Content: We were doing a "driving tour" of Germany and had our car with us and needed a place that had parking. When I looked it up Mercure Checkpoint Charlie had not only a parking garage but was also close to the metro and the sites. The reception was very friendly and informative. The garage was very safe and there was an elevator in the garage that goes to the hotel. We had an upgraded room which was very big and beautiful but it was on the top floor and it wasn't reachable by the elevators so you have to haul your bags up one flight of stairs which could be a problem for a few. The breakfast was amazing but you have ask for coffee about 4 times before you get any. It could've been the time of year we were there but I was kind of surprised by this since they are not full service waiters (the breakfast is buffet) and only have to seat people and serve coffee. Maybe it was just that time we were there? We didn't pay for internet since internet is free in the bar and reception area and it got great, fast service. We asked the reception on many times where things were in the city and they would give us maps and show us. The metro stops were close and Checkpoint Charlie is literally 5 minutes away. Berlin is a big, spread-out city so be ready to walk, no matter how close the hotel is to the city center. Berlin was a beautiful place and this hotel made it a nicer 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Bebita75
Reviews.Content: Good location, good bed and excellent breakfast. No noise day and night Big room

Reviews.Title: “Superb location with easy access to Berlin's U-bahn”
Reviews.Author: Ian D
Reviews.Content: Hotel just down round the corner from Checkpoint Charlie. Must have been less than 200 yards to the U-bahn station Stadmitte (U2, U6 lines). Staff very friendly and gave excellent service bar knowing where to eat in the local vicinity - did direct us to the Bombay (Indian) which was a long walk / U-bahn ride away up Freidrichstrasse (to the stop of the same name). Room was way big enough for two of us, excellent bathroom facilities. Stayed twice in one week (on way in and way out). On the "way out" stays arrival we were allocated a suite which was far too big but this is not a complaint and again staff were as helpful as possible. Breakfast was a bit expensive for what it was but there was load of choice. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - nice vibe & helpful service”
Reviews.Author: Snufflehound
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a couple of Mercure hotels over the years and yes they are a chain, and I do prefer to stay in individually-run hotels, but this Mercure is a corker! It's ideally located just one block away from Checkpoint Charlie (as it's name suggests). In fact, if you walk along to the intersection of Schuetzenstrasse and Freidrichstrasse, and read the hoardings up along the site of the wall, you can even pick out the building from the photos from the 1980's in which the hotel is now housed before the wall came tumbling down. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, and the rooms are absolutely spotless. Some have coffee machines and flat screen TV's and balconies. There's a sauna. The U-Bahn at Stadtmitte is 3 minutes walk away on a direct line to a bus connection to Tegel. It doesn't have a great view, but it's a city hotel - if you're spending a huge amount of time in your hotel room in a city like Berlin then you might as well have taken your needlepoint and a DVD of past episodes of Home & Away. Within 5 minutes walk are Checkpoint Charlie and the accompanying museum; the Currywurst Museum; and the Stasi museum. Within 10 minutes you can visit the Typography of Terror or the Gendarmenmarkt. We were offered a complimentary glass of wine on our visit - the bar even has a Wurlitzer jukebox - enjoy a drink in the Weingarten. The buffet breakfast at 18 euros was a bit steep for me. But there are loads of good local places to enjoy a coffee and pastry or croissant. There is an interesting local selection of restaurants within walking distance. We enjoyed Maximillian's (excellent starters); Entrecote Fred's looked busy every night; the local Italian Mandala was highly recommended. We tried to eat at Lutter and Wegner (bistro section) who were incerdibly snotty. One block north was a really unpretentious beer hall with outdoor tables serving good food. Can't go wrong really. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdkwisdom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and was very impressed with the hotel. Nice large room, super clean and a wonderful breakfast. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a a central locaiton”
Reviews.Author: LucyFM
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a fantastic central location near to some great restauarants and with easy access to the UBahn. The rooms were large, clean and quiet. I didn't use any of the other facilities in the hotel (restaurant etc). I wandered into the gym (two cardio marchines with no weights at all) but it was not only sparsely equiped but it was rather warm as well. The hotel was an absolute bargain (I paid £48 for the room per night) and would absolutely stay again. One thing I did notice, whilst sitting in recpetion, was that different customers were presented with different information and treated differently according to room rate. As I only paid £48 I got very basic information and was ushered to my room rather quickly. Such segmentation should not occur!

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: myrtillesauvage
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel-just the right size. Pleasant staff, excellent rooms-we had a family suite-incredibly roomy. Good bathroom, tea and coffee in room and excellent breakfast Good central location and checkpoint Charlie is/was just round the corner

Reviews.Title: “A great pleasant central place to stay -”
Reviews.Author: glennalan110551
Reviews.Content: We checked in here after having checked out of another hotel which offered bad service. As we were here for the IFA trade show we were worried we might not find a nice place. We were very pleasantly surprised. In room coffeemaker and waterboiler for tea were offered complimentary upon request. Roomservice breakfast was exceptional. Any problems we had were solved right away with a smile. Cost of parking in the hotel garage was acceptable and space was ample. Free use of internet in the room would make for the finishing touch. Our room had a balcony and view on the inner courtyard which was a small park with nice trees.

Reviews.Title: “We Had a Fab Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Miss10London
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights in August and wished we had booked for a longer stay. On arrival we were given a voucher for 2 free glasses of wine. The staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome. We stayed in one of the suites, it had a small kitchen, toilet, sitting area and a balcony downstairs. The bedroom and bathroom suite was upstairs. The accommodation was immaculate and climate controlled. Breakfast was delicious, plentiful and varied. The hotel is central to the attractions with 'Checkpoint Charlie' just around the corner, a museum and shops. The U-Bahn is also nearby (don't forget to verify your ticket before boarding the train) and you can also board several 'hop on - hop off' buses. I would like to visit Berlin again to complete my tour experience and if I manage to go back I will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnapolisAuthor
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, comfortable and well appointed. Good location within walking distance of most sights. Also the underground just 2 blocks away. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. My only complaint was the price of 18 euros for breakfast which I thought a bit high. There are, however, many coffee shops within a short walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and superb service”
Reviews.Author: Luke23_11
Reviews.Content: Great for getting around and all staff very helpful and friendly, would highly recommend. Bar a bit pricey but otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, very friendly staff and excellent location"”
Reviews.Author: LynchLondon
Reviews.Content: As with all the other reviews I cannot fault the hotel. The staff were extremely welcoming and always on hand to help out. It made a real difference to our trip. They recommended local restaurants and were very helpful with directions. You can't go wrong with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean and helpfull staff good location”
Reviews.Author: ArieAlkmaar_Holland
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel trough expedia.nl and was pleased to see it so close(300 metres from heckpoint Charlie and the subway). We traveled from Schoenefeld Airport to the hotel by bus and subway for 3 euro. The bus no 171 was already waiting to pick up people and left us at Rudow to take the sub. You can use the same ticket for the sub within 2 hours. Taking the line towards Rathaus Spandau and change at Mehringdamm towards Alt-Tegel for just 1 or 2 stops more. My wife was in need of a cappucino and just when we left the undergroud we bumped into a Starbucks. About the hotel: early check-in and we dropped our cases in the room. Great room we got with balcony, the room itself was around 45m2 not included toilet and bathroom which are separeted from eachother. As the hotel does have a sauna ask for a complimentery bathrope with slippers as the will profite you happely and leave them in your room when you check-out. We didn't use the breakfast as we are taking some along the way while we are exploiring the city. To do so we used the hop on hop off bus. Just to get your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Graeme W
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the Suites on the 4th/5th floor. It was a good size with small kitchin and very clean, THe Hotel is in a great location within walking distance of most of the main tourist attractiosn and some great restaurants, I would recomend Entrecote in particular which is just down the road. The only negative would be the price of the breakfast, but then it is a as much as you can eat buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, couldn't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: Betsy304
Reviews.Content: Well run, spotless, excellent service, quiet rooms and great buffet breakfast. Quiet road but bars within 10 mins walk, and underground just 5 mins away so easy access to all parts of City. Nearby Italian restaurant, Sale E Tabacchi, excellent, just 5 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “uau!!!amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: R4ff4
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room but when we arrived to the hotel, the guy that was at the desk told us that a little upgrade has been made. The room we got was incredible!!!it was a suite/apartment with two bathrooms, a huge bed, a living room and a kitchen and four huge window on one side that fulfilled the room with a lot of light!!great!!! The breakfast is super: you can choose between yogurts of different types, cereals, tasty croissant, different kind of honey to sweeten your milk and yogurt,cheeses, eggs, bacon......you will enjoy itfor sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: nicsweb
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It is in a brilliant location just a few minutes walk from the check point charlie museum, the Topography of Terror (SS museum), and a part of the Berlin Wall. Not much further brings you to Potsdamer Platz, Brandenburger Tor and the Reichstag. We didn't try any public transport as there was no need! The hotel is very clean and the staff were very welcoming. We definitely recommend staying here especially as it is relatively inexpensive. We would also recommend the excellent 3rd Reich Walking tour that we did with Sandemans.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, convenient to discover Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Maxisalex
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel made it perfectly convenient for our two-night stay in Berlin. Close to the sights, central and well-connected, ideal for a discovery visit of Berlin. We stayed in a family suite over the courtyard, so no noise from the city, quiet room, very well equipped. The suite was clean, had two rooms with a TV each, connected through a corridor, bath and shower room, and separate toilet. Minibar prices are high, but nothing extravagant for a 4* hotel in a European city. On the downside, the breakfast room hardly manages to accommodate all clients during rush-hour, i.e. 9h30 to 10h30 on week-end days, but the breakfast buffet is more than well catered. For those whowish, Cappucino can be requested in lieu of coffee, tea, hot chocolate. We would most certainly choose this hotel again next time we visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Really good option for sightseeing Berlin!!!”
Reviews.Author: Davicho77
Reviews.Content: As most of my choises when I pick up a hotel, I gave a try this hotel for the good reviews I read on tripadvisor, and I could tell that it was a perfect as my base for sightseeing Berlin!. We got by train to the amazing HauptBahnhof Berlin and transfer to Metro to Stadtmitte stop (U6) to then walk to the hotel 10 min. The hotel is just two blocks away of the FriedrichStrasse which is one of the coolest avenues of the city. Also, its 3 blocks away of the Charly Check point (maurer museum) and 4 blocks away of the open exhibition where there is a real part of the original Berlin Wall. The area is really quite, therefore you have a major site steps away, but with no noise at all. At the front desk, there were two employees very polite that welcome us. We tried to check in early (around 11am) but it was not possible and we were offered to leave our luggage nicely. Therefore we decided to start our 1st. day of sightseeing. At the charly checkpoint site ALL sightseeing buses make a stop, so there is plenty of options to take whatever you like the most. They operate full day (9am/6pm). I believe this is one of the best ways to get all main attractions in Berlin. Tip: have the full tour at the first time, and then, when you finished you may choose where to hop off. I highly recommend you take the time to get off coupple of times...Berlin has a really nice spots and you get them better on the ground!. When we got back, around 6pm, our keys were ready and a smile from the receptionist lady was refreshing. She told me I had one of the nicest room at the hotel ( I just cant remember the number, but it was on the 4th floor and you had to "transfer" elevators, no big deal in fact). When we got into the room, I realized what the lady meant. The room WAS HUGE!!!!...believe me... it was the biggest room I ever been to...two levels as two complety different rooms connected by a stair. Big-big-big everywhere. It was a balcony as well (indoors, but nice) a kitchenette, living room...the only down it was that we had only one bathroom at it was small compare to the size of the rest of the room, but still good enough. All the hotel is spotless clean and you feel it nice and warm. We did not try breakfast at the hotel, having not included in our room rate. In stead, we went to a close small supermarket (2 blocks away) and bought essentials for starting our day without spending too much money (I believe breakfast was around 18euros per person, which is quite pricey). Check out was easy and quick. We left our lugagge again because we have a late flight leaving from Tegel Airport. TIP: with the U6 Line, the one that also gets you the closest possible to the hotel, it also has a PERFECT connection to Tegel Airport by metro/bus. Just take the U6 line to ALT-TEGEL direction and get off at the Kurt-Schumacher-Platz stop and then, with the same ticket, transfer to BUS 128 which will put you in front of the departure halls at Berlin Tegel Airport. A 35 min rushless and cheap way to get to the airport. I highly recommend this hotel for its location and service. We booked our room in advanced an got a good rate, having a GREAT value for what get here. Enjoy Berlin!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bordon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a realy good location for the main sites of Berlin. About 100m from Checkpoint Charlie and Freidrichstrasse. The hotel is good value and met all our needs. A lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location , lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cauli2
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of August. The Hotel is in an excellent location-not far from subway, some good restaurants and cafes, small shops-and yet wonderfully quiet.Our room was beautifully furnished (on 5th floor) and very comfortable. We could not fault it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The garden is a bonus and a good place to relax after a busy day. We stayed on a room only basis so unable to comment on food. For a good French reataurant , we would recommend the nearby Entrecote .

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in berlin”
Reviews.Author: tinavd
Reviews.Content: the huge rooms, the friendly staff, its situation around the corner from checkpoint charlie, friedrichstrasse and u-bahn, the little balcony overlooking the 'hinterhof', the restaurant with quiet terrace and great wines, it all made the hotel just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: zimbaMexico
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a quiet street but very close to Friedrichstrasse and the U-bahn. Beautiful Gendarmenmarkt and top restaurants are just minutes walk away. Excellent service at the reception. Rooms are clean, interior nothing exciting but very functional. We were upgraded to a very large suite. Absolutely nothing to complain about. Enjoyed the free massage treat on Tuesday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very good service”
Reviews.Author: KajsaH
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this very pleasant hotel. We were surprised of how spacious the room was and of how friendly and service-minded the staff was.We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we found it a bit pricy (18 euros/person). However, with that in mind I can´t imagine a better value for our money as the room was 300 sek (about 30 euros) per person and night. The only things we could wish for more would have been an even better location. The hotel is situated, as given by the name, just by checkpoint charlie, which is a very good location. However, we found it a bit difficult to get there by night from the restaurants and bars in Mitte. Also, It cost a moderate amount to get access to the wi-fi but for shorter use of the internet there was a computer by the reception from which you could go online. Given all this, we can highly recomment to stay at the Mecure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie for your stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, fantastic holiday.”
Reviews.Author: pikupiku
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in the premiere (?) rooms - one ip from basic. Lovely big room overlooking the sweet courtyard. Very clean (as I'd expect in Germany ). Amazing location , walking distance to everywhere. Delicious breakfasts too. As previous poster, loved gendarmarkt. Didn't even mind the rain! Have been to berlin once before- 1985 - and found where hotel had been built on an old photo - used to be in the "dead zone" between the two Walls!

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in Ideal Location for 1st Timers in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ambrose1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I chose this hotel for its central location and excellent reviews. We weren't disappointed in the least. It was spotlessly clean, the room, as requested, was quiet and non smoking and very spacious. The breakfast was a substantial start to a long day's sightseeing and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I would thoroughly recommend staying here - we chose to walk everywhere but there is a very handy U bahn station just minutes away. There is a also a wide choice of eateries only a stone's throw away too. Our favourite spot to sit and enjoy the view, the people watching and the buskers was Gendarmmarkt Platz - again just a couple of minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “well worth a stay great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Topman1
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 8 people - small group trip Hotel: Staff could not have been more helpful both before and during our visit Our room had not been serviced on our arrival so we were immediately offered an upgrade to a 'superior' room very large and with small balcony! Great hot and cold buffet breakfast but not cheap if purchased separately 18 euros per person! However if you book ahead there are some very attractive prices inc breakfast on a non refundable basis through the internet Very nice clean hotel with some pleasant areas to sit including small terrace and garden Small bar and sauna available Location is great: easy walking distance to check pioint charlie, underground and other major attractions We did not need to use public transport The hop on hop off tourist bus is great and reasonable price Being 8 in our group we took people carrier transfer from airport cost approx 50 euros each way so about 6 euros each - travelling time 25 /30 mins Berlin is an attractive city not so much in a pcture sense but because of the buildings old and new and the various museums are both informative and well laid out Would have no hesitation is suggesting this hotel to anyone visting Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great Location would stay again”
Reviews.Author: loulou2308
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 3 nights in July 2011 and the hotel was greta. The reception staff where helpful, our room was ready early for us and it was very clean and spacious. Location is great for sightseeing and transport liks around the city. Cafes and restaurants also close by. would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel room with a conference room”
Reviews.Author: Novel_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in Berlin and Mercure hotel was accommodating to get us a nice huge room. I would recommend this hotel which is very close to Checkpoint Charlie.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay...”
Reviews.Author: AnishKGeorge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. A great hotel, great location, good staff, great service, great breakfast, superb room, good AC, good soups and coffee.
