The hotel staff were very polite and helpful throughout our stay. When we arrived they gave us a very good and spacious suite. They offered some help on places to visit. One lady staff took us till the room, and even helped us to carry one of our luggages. Also while leaving they helped us to get a good taxi to airport. Room and toilet were very spacious and cleaned very well every day. They also had decent toiletries. We really liked the potato soup from there. The breakfast was very delicious with a lot of options. Location of the hotel is the best part. A lot of shopping areas near by. Underground metro station is only a few minutes walk. There are many italian restaurants around. And one of the best Thai restaurants also (Sisaket). Many attractions are at walkable distance. There are some very small, not-serious negatives also. May be I should call these as improvement suggessions. 1. When I booked through accorhotels.com, I added my initials with my last name. But in the hotel system, it was added automatically to the first name. Because of this, when I tried to retrieve the booking online by providing last name as I gave while booking, the system was always showing that the booking cannot be found. I got panic and had to email the hotel to confirm that the booking still exists. 2. There is no shuttle service from airport to this hotel. So I wrote a mail to the hotel asking the route. The reply stated, "Take the bus TXL from the Airport to Kurt-Schumacher-Platz and then from there U6". I decided to look up this route once again in bvg.de. It was actually not TXL but 128 bus. I was happy that I looked it up before my travel. 3. Before my travel, my credit card was charged for the whole amount, but when I arrived at the hotel reception, they asked me again to make a 1 cent payment with the same credit card. I did not understand what that was for.. 4. Our room was in the 8th floor, but the lift was available only till 7th floor. So we had to climb the stairs for one floor every time. 5. Since the shower was in the bathtub itself, every time we use the shower, the toilet floor was getting wet , because of the gap between the glass door and the bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had excellent stay in hotel. Upgraded to an apartment on arrival which had kitchenette with tea/coffee making facilities. Location could not have been better, within walking distance of all tourist attractions. Staff were very helpful and overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fair value”
Reviews.Author: danielwebster
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The location is excellent on a quiet street near busy Friedrichstasse. Large rooms, clean and well maintained. The staff from check in to check out were all extremely helpful, efficient and friendly. If I had any area of improvement for me it would be the decor which I found cheerful but sort of a lower end interpretation of a design hotel. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place quiet close to shops & Berlin wall & museum”
Reviews.Author: holidayms
Reviews.Content: Berlin is spread out over 6 kms and no real centre this location has shops a lovely time industrial museum and the Berlin wall whats left of check point charlie all within 300m walk. Watch out for bicycle riders speeding more than cars and buses. We are mature 60 yr olds from Australia travel to europe every year for 4 weeks and visit one country each year. It was Berlin Germany start this year self drive north south 2 days most places.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alliga2r
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel. Well located. Rooms very quiet and comfortable. Staff is friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “we were very satisfied and we shall return in our next visit to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Guillerm077
Reviews.Content: Breackfast was excelent indeed! Rooms very large and nicely furnished, large windows and we did not hear any noise from the street in front of our windows.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Emszy Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Berlin at the end of June 2011. We travelled in a group of four and shared a Privilege suite with 2 double beds. The rooms were very large and spacious - almost too large! The facilities were clean, the bed comfy and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is just a short walk from the Stadtmitte U-Bahn station and in a quite area. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in convenient location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Chippy-Field
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally placed for exploring Checkpoint Charlie and the surroundings in a quiet location off FredrikStrasse, a short stroll from either the Stadtmitte or Kochstrasse underground. Most sights are walkable (eg: Brandenburg Gate) or a couple of hops on the underground. The hotel itself was pleasant - not huge or flashy but fine for a short break. The room we had was spacious (two adults one child) although an unusual layout (long and narrow) but well appointed. The breakfast buffet was generous and varied. The staff in the hotel were charming and helpful. Wi-fi is chargeable.

Reviews.Title: “Excelleny on all counts. I would go back”
Reviews.Author: YannisP123
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and well decorated; the satff very pleasant; the breakfast very good. It is in a very convenient location for walking to the center and the miseums. I just enjoyed my 4 days I stayed there. I would strongly recommend it and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience left questions about returning”
Reviews.Author: charlierdu
Reviews.Content: My family (7 adults) spent a couple of weeks touring central Europe. Our first stop was Berlin and the Mercure at Checkpoint Charlie. Our experience was so mixed it is hard to determine if we will return to the hotel on our next trip to Berlin. The hotel was nice overall and is located in a great section of Berlin. Potsdamer Platz, Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island -- all of these are relatively close walking distances to the hotel The neighborhood is relatively quiet and felt very safe. A number of good restaurants are within short walks of the hotel. The rooms were perfect for a group of adults. We had "family" rooms which were basically two bedroom suites with a shared bathroom. This worked out very well and we were pleased with the cost/quality ratio. The negatives really came in terms of the rest of the experience. The staff was pleasant but not helpful. We arrived midday from the U.S. understanding we may not be able to get into our rooms immediately. They checked with housekeeping, asked us to go to lunch, and then we were to check back with reception. The official check-in time was 3pm. We arrived back from lunch at 2:30pm. Seven travelers in from overnight journeys. The staff appeared ready to send us upstairs when the acting manager (who had not been in when we arrived) refused to let us into the rooms until 3pm. While he claimed they were not ready, it was a miracle that at exactly 3pm the rooms were available for occupancy. (Note: we stayed here five days and the rooms were cleaned and ready before noon every day of our stay.) We were supposed to have wi-fi access in the rooms (the hotel, like many in Europe, charges separately for the service), but could not access any networks. We had two pieces of luggage lost in transit with a website provided for tracking progress. Connectivity was more important than normal. When I pointed out to the same manager that we could not access the internet he simply kept repeating there was wi-fi access in the room. The fact it was not working was not something he would even consider. Even logging on in the lobby was generally futile as the signal was so weak you were not able to connect 90% of the time. The final morning of our stay we were waiting on a taxi to the airport ordered the night before by the hotel. When the driver had not arrived 15 minutes after the scheduled pick-up time we were told simply "we ordered the car and they will be on their way". Kind of frustrating when you are traveling in a group and need the extra time at the airport to move through the check-in process. The overall experience was not helped upon our arrival in Vienna where our hotel was not quite as nice, but the service was so spectacular it made the Mercure staff seem apathetic at best. We all have traveled internationally (some of us extensively) and were pretty realistic in terms of expectations. Given all of our travel experience we were disappointed that basic service principles that could have made the stay truly outstanding seemed so lacking in priority by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: fgautier
Reviews.Content: I am a French journalist and writer who came to Berlin to covet the 30 year celebrations of the Art of Living Foundation led by HH Sri Sri Ravi Shankar. I was pleasantly surprised by the Mercure Hotel, Berlin Checkpoint Charlie. Not only was the staff very welcoming, but I was upgraded to a suite on two levels. everything was new, clean and comfortable. Great hotel. François Gautier Editor in Chief La Revue de l'Inde

Reviews.Title: “Good Option”
Reviews.Author: piupolino
Reviews.Content: Good location if you don't mind walking or taking the subway. Quite hotel with excellent amenities and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Radtrav
Reviews.Content: Good location. Comfortable almost luxury level. Pleasant staff. Fabulous breakfast. Good free wifi in lobby only. As one other review noted we had an unexplained visitor who entered the room after it had been made up and left on finding us there. Mysterious.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel,is not physically or financially safe.”
Reviews.Author: MontMorentze
Reviews.Content: I was made very welcome and treated with kindness and respect. I found the staff in all but one case, to be polite, helpful and courteous. My room was large, clean and just what one would desire and expect, of an hotel of the star rating of the Mercury. Unfortunately this politeness was only superficial . However there a crook or possibly a gang of crooks operating in their hotel The first intrusion. I was actually in my room. and the crook caught me drying myself, after having showered and ran off. The second intrusion, involved the removal of my Blood Donor card from the power switch. The card looks like an expensive credit but it is worthless. Third intrusion, I was having a shower, some one removed all the paper money from my purse but just left the change., My purse was full of money. I would suggest that it contained approximately,200 to 300 Euro. Who ever entered my room knew exactly where my money was kept, in a very large purse in ,my left pocket. All intrusions were reported to staff and all I received was blind indifference to my complaints and after having my money stolen, no attempt was made to call the police. I have made no claim for financial compensation, I just a asked that the CCTV be examined and the villain be brought to justice. I gave them a chance and they blew it. After putting my complaint in writing ,all I received a patronizing response and again callous indifference to the fact that I was muggeddin my very own room. The security at this hotel in non existent and any complaint is met with contempt. This hotel is not physically and financially safe, under any circumstances. Do Not Go There.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: steaknchips
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Hotel and Residenz CheckPoint Charlie Iis just a couple of minutes walk from this well known spot. This means it is also very near Friederick Str. which leads to Unter den Linden. At the end of this lovely boulevard find the Brandenburg Tor. This icon of Berlin is near the Reichstag and the Holocost memorial. Take another direction from the hotel and you are on Linden str. where you will find the Jewish Museum. Pozdamer Platz is also within a few minutes walk. Near the hotel there are some nice cafes and restaurants and it is not too far from the nearest supermarket and bakery. Koch str. U Bahn is practically beside Check point Charlie. Therefore this hotel is about location. The hotel itself is quite good value with spacious rooms which are nicely decorated in a bright fundctional style. The batrooms are good and it is very clean, although the dearth of products was a bit mean. There is a green courtyard outside and some suites have balconies. We did not sample the breakfast which we considered a bit pricey. There are plenty of good cafes nearby. We had a drink in the bar late one evening. It had a good atmoshere and was not particularly expensive for a hotel. There were a few minor deficits in our room but they were rectified when we brought them to the attention of the staff. We had a terrific time in this great city and this hotel is to be recommended for good value in a prime location

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_Dave
Reviews.Content: Good points for the hotel are: very clean and tidy, room was spacious and comfortable, helpful and polite staff who all spoke excellent English, the breakfasts were superb. Improvements would be: Housekeeping; twice left requests at reception, (one for a hot water boiler to make tea, one for the pillows to be changed), neither were acted upon, the wi-fi in the lobby was good, the wi-fi in the room was very poor - just about got a signal after having to go through a log-on process that kept stalling and finally freezing. Overall, a very nice hotel and a would defiitely stay again, but need to sort out the points raised above

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL ROOMS IN EUROPE”
Reviews.Author: hazelgran
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to Europe for almost 40 years, staying in hotels ranging from no stars to 5 stars. Based upon just two stays at the Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie and judging by the quality of the rooms alone, I consider this the best hotel in Europe. The rooms are spaciou beyond expectation, with comfortable beds, high-def television, refrigerator, and in-room safe. The lighting in the room is excellent, allowing for comfortable bedtime reading -- a rarity in most hotels. The bathroom, with a shower stall and no tub, is large and immaculate. On each of my stays, which were a year apart, everything in the room seemed brand new, certainly a testament to the care and attention of the excellent staff. I look forward to visiting Berlin again next year, in no small part, just to return to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located in Berlin, comfortable room & excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: marcpascal
Reviews.Content: Very well located, main sites accessible either at walking distance or by U Bahn. Spacious room, nice design, clean and confortable with balcony on very quiet internal garden. Excellent buffet breakfast. We got a special offer for double + breakfast at good value for money (<110 €) And last but not least, welcoming staff!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bdoyle1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located within walking distance from the centre of town and the river. The room was spacious and very well appointed. The staff were very friendly and most helpfull and could not do enough for you. The staff were always happy and full of greetings from the front desk to the cleaning staff. The breakfast was well presented and an excellent variety. People who left not full were too pickey.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: joaoYreina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while in Berlin on business. I had a two room suite with plenty of space and one and a half baths. One of the rooms had a small balcony that faced an inner courtyard. The batroom was spotless and had a towel heater which was nice as it was cold and icy that week. The staff was very friendly and overall i must say that mercure hotels tend to be a good value. The location is good, a short walk to the U bahn and to the Jewish museum. There is a Lidl just down the street if you want to pick up some groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central area”
Reviews.Author: Pat_Pete53
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a large room. It was very clean and quiet. The staff were helpful and the courtyard gardens were pleasant to sit in and relax.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Berlin and the Mecure Checkpoint Charlie”
Reviews.Author: Coza
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a 2 days in June in a Privelage suite which was roomy enough for 2 adults and two children 11 and 13. The location is very central and surrounded by a number of great restaurents and shops. A 3 minute walk to the old check point and 10-15 minutes to the Brandenburg Tour. The staff were very helpful and the buffet breakfast is well worth the money, parking is also available on site a reasonable rate. We would recomend this hotel to any of our friends. Family from Australia Melbourne

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amazeu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter for 4 nights. Great location just round the corner from Checkpoint Charlie. Three of us stayed there and had two rooms which were very large and spacious - far better then excepted. Very light with a small balcony and well equipped. Buffet breakfast was extensive and good quality. Would definitely go back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend - We had an excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: drnovak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie for 3 nights and had a wonderful stay. We had a great room with 4 windows and a kitchenette. The beds are comfy and there is an in-house sauna. The hotel is close to the U-bahn and the breakfast was wonderful. You can eat outside if you like. The staff was friendly and very helpful. My only complaint was that there was not free wifi in the rooms. You could pay for it, but it was expensive. There is free wifi in the lobby and a computer for use, but it was a bit of a pain when I want to do research on Berlin and don't want to sit in the lobby to do it. Our stay was excellent and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: breadforthejourney
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were helpful and friendly, made for a good start to stay. The room was bigger than expected, nicely laid out. Free use of internet in the lobby reception area. The hotel is conveniently located, easy access to shops and good restaurants - we tried Tim Raue for lunch and Entrecote for a simple but enjoyable dinner. We joined the free walking tour that begins outside the Starbucks at the Brandenburg Gate. It's 4 hours long but extremely informative and helped me appreciate Berlin much more, it was my 4th visit there. Thank God the weather was good too, couldn't have asked for a better few days!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel In Mitte”
Reviews.Author: pkrockit
Reviews.Content: A modern chain (Mercure) hotel centrally located around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie with the Metro only two blocks away. Limited restaraunts closeby but a good Italian place a block away and a good Bavarian restaraunt not too far away. We got upgraded to a two floor suite on arrival but once settled in we realized it was a bit of a pain having to go downstairs to use the bathroom at night. Next time we'll pass on the upgrade. Very comfortable accomodations in spite of this minor complaint. Excellent, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Henning34
Reviews.Content: Very nice, quiet and clean hotel in a quiet street near Gendarmenmarkt. Very nice and helpful staff. Sublime breakfast buffet! My very spacious (superior) room even had a balcony to a charming and quiet atrium. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiovanniMondo
Reviews.Content: We booked from looking at TA and selecting down to a few options, and we weren't disappointed. Yes, we got a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite which certainly helped our view of the hotel. The hotel was clean and modern. The reception staff were extremely helpful, including in recommending places to eat, and in checking pre-booked reservations for us. There's a free PC and printer in the lobby so we could check-in for a flights back. We had a junior suite facing the interior courtyard, including a small balcony area. The location was great, about a 10 mins walk to Gerndarmemarkt, and the nearest U-Bahn, and 15 mins walk to Brandeberg Tor and 20 mins to the Berliner Dom. It's a few minutes to the old Checkpoint Charlie, but unless you're actually at the checkpoint crossroads you don't notice the other tourists. We didn't go for the hotel breakfast - there are plenty of cafes within a few minutes walk. We also didn't try the sauna or fitness area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: renlb
Reviews.Content: Everything was fantastic! The best part of the stay was that it was extremely quiet, even though we stayed on a friday night...had the best nights sleep ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large light rooms, helpful staff, super breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitraveller999
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed here and we all thought it was a super hotel. Just around the corner from Checkpoin Charlie. The rooms were light and spacious - with an entrance area and desk in the room. Very nice shower rooms and our room overlooked the garden and was wonderfully quiet with only birdsong to wake us up - unusual in a city. We did think that the breakfast, although excellent, was quite expensive as an extra at Euros 18.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thomasjster Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great place to stay and great location in berlin right by check point charlie and had a nice view from the balcony and a giant room which was great to relax in after a long day of sight seeing. The staff were great as well and very helpful and even gave us free internet which helped with keeping in touch with friends back home

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: twbart
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with the hotel. Great location, terrific service and very helpful staff, good (although expensive) breakfast. I would definitely recommend this hotel to frineds.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rhian53
Reviews.Content: Top hotel in a super location. So easy to get to and from the airport. The hotel is so clean and the staff were excellent. Can i say well done to Fabio Gold who had a constant smile and made us feel special and to Nicole Dessaule who kept checking to see if all was well...and that was just the breafast. The reception staff were always on hand but the try to get hold o M Garnes (not sure of his first name) who went out of his way daily to make sure we got the best out of the hotel and Berlin. Would take this hotel and staff with me on every city break if I could. Thanks everyone.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place”
Reviews.Author: stefanotorino
Reviews.Content: It is right in the middle of the city. Spotlessly clean. Private park in the basement. Friendly and helpful staff. Free internet station in the hall. Sound-proof rooms. Not expensive at all. I have to go back to Berlin and will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: pixieboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a superior room & were very happy with all aspects. Room was clean, spacious, & quiet. Staff were, friendly & helpful. Breakfasts were very good with a wide choice. Location is excellent - we were able to walk to many of the places of interest - but a U-Bahn station is 5 minutes away. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: 19_in_my_head
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and really only used it as a sleeping place. Spoke with 3 different reception staff, all of whom were charming and efficient. Decided that 18 Euros per person was too much for breakfast and so frequented the local bakeries instead. This is our only criticism. Room service with a continental breakfast is available but no price was quoted. Contrary to lots of reviews toilet in our room was in the shower room. On entry to room small lobby with suitcase rack and mirror - door to left led to shower room (no bath) and on right was the huge bedroom. 2 3 foot singles next to each other, which was fine as I was with my daughter. We looked over the inner courtyard and had 2 French windows. Cleaning staff kept leaving the aircon on, but we turned it off - not necessary in this room's situation - Beds very comfortable - bedding changed after 3 nights - or so it seemed!! Situation is very good and very quiet- 5 - 10 mins walk from 2 U-bahn stations. I would definitely stay here again - in fact can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Superb hotel, beautiful with a great location and fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: UIAlums
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for nine total evenings in April 2011 on three occasions. I found the exterior, designed by a world class architect to be beautiful as were the furnishings in the suites. The service is among the best I have received in 40 years of traveling Europe. The front desk staff members are gracious, informed, helpful and fully prepared to help a person enjoy the city. I found the front desk staff every bit the equal of fine hotels like the Four Seasons in Istanbul and Dublin. The location is excellent, walking distance to all the central Berlin museums, and top quality shopping and dining. The breakfast buffet literally fills a large room with delightful choices.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: dave2566
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for two nights and were very pleased with our stay. Upon arrival we found the hotel approximately 2 blocks from the Stadtmitte metro station. The reception was nice and the staff was very helpful, courteous, and English speaking. We originally booked a single room but we were upgraded to an "apartment" in the Residenz section which is basically an enormous room with small living room, kitchenette and huge walk in closet (this was a welcome upgrade after coming directly from Amsterdam and a tiny room). The Checkpoint Charlie sights are just around the corner and there is a small grocery store, and several restaurants less than a block away. To give an idea of how far other sights are, we walked to Potsdamer Platz the first night which took about 15-20 minutes but was not bad. The Brandenburg Gate is another 5 minutes past Potsdamer Platz as well as the Reichstag. I would have given a full five star rating had there been free wifi in the room (free in the lobby) and a cheaper breakfast in the hotel but I'm just being picky. Overall the room and hotel was very clean, quiet, and new. Very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - very nice hotel - quiet atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Ann-Lie
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for 4 nights end of November 2010. This hotel is conveniently placed close to a metro station, checkpoint charley and the "gendarmenmarkt" (nice X-mas marcket in winter). If you choose not to take each day the breakfast buffet in the hotel there are nice places to have breakfast at a 300m walk. Also a lot of good restaurants in the neighbourhood. Ideal place to make a city trip to Berlin. Just go there from the airport with a taxi (40 euros) and than use the metro... Nice and friendly people at the reception, fast check-in and check-out without any worries. Room service is available and is quite good food to.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: Brianwiz
Reviews.Content: Well-situated. Big bedrooms. Comfortable beds. Speedy, efficient check-in by helpful desk staff. Loved my stay

Reviews.Title: “Centrally and quiet – with nice rooms and high quality service”
Reviews.Author: Oystein-Asker
Reviews.Content: We stayed three friends (men in the early 50s) at the Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie for four days in April 2011. We got a very good first impression as we were upgraded from three single standard rooms to three really large apartments. Actually we had a floor of our own! A fine gesture at a very reasonable price! Breakfast was excellent with a lot of choices, both cold and warm dishes. Try the marmalade with mustard for cheese. There is fresh fruits, fresh juice, and fresh coffee. The address is superb for sightseeing, only a short distance from the Checkpoint Charlie. You will also find bikes for rent nearby – ant that is really recommendable. We used the U-bahn a lot, but cycling is indeed the best way of getting to know the town. Especially in weekends. Try for instance Tiergarten on a Sunday. Are you interested in art, then visit a hidden gem nearby, the Emil Nolde Museum. The staff was always very helpful and patient with our queries, trying to assist us with tips for a restaurant or tickets for events. We´ll be back! The Three Norwegians

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ths0803
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is very cordial and make any effort to help, surprising us very positively, beyond expectations. Congratulations to the team. The room (family room) is ideal for families, with plenty room. The location of the Hotel is very close to checkpoint Charlie and to Friedrensstrasse, which offers good stores for shopping, Restaurants and Acess for subway and train transportation

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: KimberD22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "family suite" at this hotel & there was plenty of room for us & our 2 teens. Hotel was clean and modern and everyone was friendly. Most tourist spots were walkable from here yet the area around the hotel was quiet (nice for sleeping). Public transport was very close as well. Breakfast was too pricey for us (although it looked like a large American lay-out) but there were many coffee shops & bakeries nearby to grab something to eat. We were extremely happy with this hotel & would recommend it to everyone going to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jimhans
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, Travelocity sent over a confirmation of only 2 people when my reservations clearly stated three people (one adult and two kids). Initially, the Mercure Hotel staff wanted to have me get a refund from Travelocity and reboot at the current rate card for my stay. After showing that I wasn't to blame (my Travelocity reciept), the Mecure Hotel staff horoned our room reservations with a very nice room. The location near Check-Point-Charlie was very nice with a close (Stadmitte) s-bahn stop and Friedrichstrasse very close by with lots of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to discover Berlin and relax”
Reviews.Author: SerenaAndre
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights and everything was perfect; we booked in advance and we had a special deal: 2 rooms connected; that was great because our daughter (20 months) has her privacy and we too...! Breakfast was good: big choice and nice service. We tried also the Room Service:the food was not great but the delivery was quick and the wine was excellent. I would book again the hotel if we go again to Berlin. Serena and Andre, Hannover- Germany

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SBGLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Mercure for 3 nights over a long weekend in Berlin Location: A little tucked away in a very quiet street but certainly within easy walking distance of U Bahn and various vistor attractions. Although not truly central it was gloriously quiet at night.. Breakfast: As previously reported, extensive, varied and good quality Bar: Not the best hotel bar I have been in; tiny, part of the corridor, with virtually no atmosphere bar constant juke box music. Watch out for the price of the wine which is advertised in 10cl measures (surely just a sip?) but poured in 20cl measures which doubled the price! We had 3 glasses of a moderate plonk at €13 a glass - steep to say the least. Rooms: Clean and comfortable with excellent bathroom and really nice shower. Pillows were the only think that let it down - they were foam and quite unpleasant. rest of room was large and well laid out with a good TV and chairs etc. Conclusion: We booked ahead and paid about €78 per night including breakfast - we all agreed that this was very good value for a hotel that clearly lives up to its 4 star status.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in this hotel, nice rooms, great breakfast and very professional and helpful staff. Would have liked tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Good selection of restaurants locally.

Reviews.Title: “Stone's throw from Checkpoint Charlie”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterPammy
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel after reading excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. Everywhere is spotlessly clean and the rooms are actually huge. The only slight inconvenience (if you'll excuse the the pun) is that the toilet is not in the bathroom but is on the other side of the room and like I said, as the rooms are so big, it's a bit of a schlep if you need to go in the middle of the night! Also, don't forget to take conditioner girls as this hotel doesn't provide it. My husband, an architect, was particularly impressed by the hotel as it was designed by Aldo Rossi (who is a 'signature' architect - whatever that means). It's in a great location and if you dont want to eat breakfast in the hotel, go out the main door, turn right and then right again at the end of the block and there are a couple of attractive looking cafe bars to choose from. Top Tip: Dont turn up, like we did, and expect to go round the Reichstag building - you wont! Apparently you have to book a week in advance (because of the terrorist threats last November) - major bummer. The walking tour of the 'Third Reich buildings' we took was excellent and lookout for the 'beer bike' - looks a helluva lot of fun (it has to be seen to be believed!).

Reviews.Title: “really friendly staff, lovely room and good value”
Reviews.Author: Johnny095
Reviews.Content: A good clean hotel, staff really helpful and my room was lovely, like all hotels very hot though

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MuyFriaEnCanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel had great rooms and a great location - it was quiet and has a nice little bar with a freejuke box. I didn't eat there but everything was top notch. WiFi was a little expensive but the rooms were huge. It is a short walk to lots of great restaurants. Staff were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently placed, sensible price and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PeterG38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a four night break and were pleasantly impressed. The rooms are airy, well appointed and comfortable. There is a pleasant bar for a nightcap and for casual dining. There is no restaurant for lunch or evening meals. The breakfast (included in our room rate) was excellent with fresh fruits, juices, plently of choice of breads, cereals, and hot and cold offerings. Stadtmitte U-Bahn (Underground) station is about a 5 minute walk, and Unter den Linden and the Museum Island each about 10 minute brisk or 15 minute leisurely walk away. There are a reasonable number of restaurants within a 2 to 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality business hotel compromised by average location”
Reviews.Author: 100nights
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best arrival processing I have ever experienced, made to feel welcome. Rooms are very large, but poorly designed. A large desk/TV console dominates the centre of the room, which orphans two rather inadequate single lounge chairs. There is plenty of space to make a rather nice sitting area and put the desk to one side. Bathroom was small (separate WC which is at the other end of the room ~ strange) but functional, but you can't convince me that the eco shower head (limits the amount of water) make sense. Room service was average and most days room amenities were not replaced. Downstairs bar was friendly but strangely placed along the main passageway, like having a drink in the middle of a pedestrian walkway! Front desk staff were very friendly, but frequently got things wrong, so we learned to double check Internet was free in the lobby only ~ when will hotels learn that we object to paying Euro150 a night and then pay again for internet in the room? Major negative (and this is a problem with many Berlin hotels) was the hotel is 10 minutes from the nearest public transportation (U2 & U6) and taxis need to be ordered. Almost no restaurants in the area. Only average value

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel + some tips”
Reviews.Author: GuYsH
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 6 day stay in Berlin and the Mercure. As far as the hotel - there were no surprises. Everything written in Tripadvisor and the Mercure site is accurate. The room is very large in European standards, and I loved that the toilet and the shower are in 2 separate rooms. The room is well heated, has plenty of storage room and is overall just very satisfactory. The staff were also great, and helped us in a couple of odd requests. It's a 2 minute walk from the Stadmitte U-Bahn station which makes it less than 15 minute away from any spot in the city. The only disadvantage with the Mercure is that it's surrounding area isn't packed with Restaurants and pubs. In fact, it's hard to get a beer at 23:00 at a walking distance from the hotel. But then again, it is very close to many of the "daylight sightseeing" and the U-Bahn is a 24 hr service so even that late night drink is like 10 mins away.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: govindblr
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the hotel on a holiday trip. Booked room at the hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and I was not in the least bit disappointed. The room we got was large and spacious with very comfortable beds. The breakfast is one of the best I have had at any hotel, and highly recommend it. Great location within 5 minute walk from Checkpoint Charlie and the metro stop. Most of the other sights in Berlin are a short metro ride away. Only negative is the absence of free wi-fi internet in the room (though there is a computer in the lobby for checking mails) as well no complimentary bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: thomasbutler
Reviews.Content: Well trained friendly staff. Always ready to oblige with advice, telephone calls, helpful hints etc.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: flypaolo
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel -- good location, nice staff (except during the night -- bartender wouldn't serve me food late because I think he was in a rush to leave). Overall a good experience in a nice part of town. Very close to Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, Reichstag, and other good attractions. I would stay here again and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ryanair3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and found hotel extremely comfortable with friendly staff and very clean also very quiet. It is an excellent base to see everything whether walking or taking underground which we felt a lot safer than London. There was a good choice for breakfast and we fully intend to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, handy to restaurants, u-bahn and tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: born2travelcom
Reviews.Content: Clean warm rooms, efficient check-in and, very handy to Berlin's amenities. Traveled with two teenagers, who liked the hotel, also. The bar/wifi point is handy - can drink coffee or wine while checking emails. Did not have breakfast here as there are many breakfast options within five minutes walk of the hotel. Found three great restaurants nearby on consecutive nights that had great food and were teenager friendly. A major 80 meter section (one of only three remaining) is just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Jax9000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an excellent base to explore the city. The breakfast is very good but be aware to purchase it before your arrival because it will be much cheaper. Rooms are big and spacious and matresses are firm. They have a sauna with massage but I ddn't tried it. Easy walk to all major attractions. There's internet in the room for a fee but it's free in the hotel lobby. Good bandwith since I used to talk with relatives using skype from my ipod with no problems, while other customers were also online. The staff is very attentive and helpful but don't trust thier recommedations for restaurants (run away from Lungomare, the Italian restaurant one block from the hotel and usually the first one the hotel staff will recommend). Walk to Gendarmenmarkt for much better options.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly comfortable and good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluerobin59
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are very welcoming and atmosphere is friendly. Breakfast very good and presence of business travellers makes hotel more relaxed as they seem to stay for longer periods and there is a more of an informal feel as some occupy residences. Location is handy for sights and museums. Italian restaurant across road very good but not many others nearby. Munich style Beer hall /pub near quite good with German food. Checkpoint Charlie just round corner.Mini Bar expensive. Rooms good size and very clean Double bed really twins together.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: tminperth
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Berlin - I picked this hotel from the recommendations on this site and it was great! Very easy to find just off a main street, subway close by - in walking distance to almost everywhere you would want to see! We had a fantastic room which easily accommodated three adults and had a separate loo to the bathroom (vital!) Beds were very comfortable and sound proofing and blackout curtains very good. Value for money wise, I thought the bill was wrong because it was so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mpw001
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location. We got a free upgrade upon arival to a nice suite. Staff is very helpful and the breakfast is good. I would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: fdaml
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located, you can walk to most places. Very quiet, large rooms, very clean and comfy. Nice sauna upstairs, appreciable when you are coming back frozen by the German winter! Good buffet breafast, with fresh juices, and anything you might like. Perfect service, very nice, polite and smiling staff. Would love to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dougzz99
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, all the good stuff in Berlin is in the former East. This hotel is super clean, had great staff, a nice bar and restaurant, and was excellent value. I really can't praise it enough.

Reviews.Title: “We got more than we had expected”
Reviews.Author: berlin1234567
Reviews.Content: The first time I visited Berlin was in 1959. Then I have also been there a couple of times during the 80´s. This time I was overwhelmed by the fact that the City has changed a lot! To visit all those interesting places and buildings was very enjoying. Three days were not enough! People were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worth your money.”
Reviews.Author: GW1_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very nice staff. Big and very clean room. Free internet acess, very fast and a good computer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Murphy84
Reviews.Content: From arriving at the hotel until departure the service received was first class. All staff were extremely welcoming and attentive to all our needs. The room was very spacious and . The hotel is situated directly round the corner from Charlie Checkpoint and is in a central location making it easy to visit all the attractions of Berlin. There are two undergrounds stations near the hotel which are a 2 min walk in either direction although my wife and I walked everywhere during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Having returned for my second stay they upgraded my room at no extra cost - Fantastic upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Kierancondon
Reviews.Content: The upgraded room was the biggest hotel room I've stayed in. Double story, two TVs, small kitchen, a little balcony and a lounge area. All this for the price of a reasonably priced room anywhere else. (They call it an "apart-hotel"). The Mercure is not all glitz-and-glamour but it is well finished, very clean and it is right next to Check Point Charlie which is a well known spot in Berlin. I know they have a gym and sauna as well.

Reviews.Title: “A very warmwelcome and excellent, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: DaveSmithson
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and welcoming, the hotel was clean and tidy, the room was first class and the location perfect for exploring this famous city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: alff2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mercure Checkpoint Charlie for a second time, the first one was in May 2009. We could afford more expensive hotel but prefer this because had very warm memories. Since 2009 nothing change, the hotel still has good service, spacious and comfortable room, tasty breakfast, good location and helpful reception clerks. We really enjoyed. Small area of development - the cleaners became a little worse than earlier, for example, I blotted sink with my mascara and nobody cleaned it during cleaning. And cleaners were a little bit pushy.From the early morning every 20 minutes they tried to get into the room and left it fast having seen us before we could say them what time it would comfortable for us for they to come.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect Berlin location.”
Reviews.Author: g_hoskin Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First time in Berlin. Decided to stay for the big New Year's Eve street party. This hotel was a fantastic choice. Excellent location - could walk everywhere, but if we had needed to use public transport we were very close to several stops. Excellent position for sightseeing, shopping and eating out. Easy walk to Brandenburg Gate for New Year's Eve festivities. Hotel facilities and service were excellent. All staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Will definitely stay again if we ever return to Berlin. Will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC hotel, hidden little gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Michie_B
Reviews.Content: We were thouroughly impressed with this hotel in every aspect. This hotel is conviniently located downtown, within walking distance to the major historical attractions. 1. Great customer service. We were very impressed. 2. The rooms are enormous for a typical European hotel room 3. We booked on Expedia.ca, and got a fantastic rate, which also included breakfat buffet 4. The breakfast buffet was superb. What an enormous selection to choose from. 5. The beds were very comfortable. 6. The staff were very helpful in providing tourist info. 7. Free internet on the computer in the lobby. 8. Parking in basement garage of hotel for only 13 euro per day. 9. Closely located to a great sushi restaurant that is very reasonably priced! 10. Within walking distance to the Jewish Museum Berlin (only 5 euro for entry, and 2.50 euro for students), which is hosting a very educational highly reccomended exhibit about the war called 'Forced Labor' until January 30th for only an extra 2 euro. We would definitely stay here again if we are in Berlin!! Fantastic hotel, and great value overall!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: blagov_s
Reviews.Content: It is allways a pleasure for me to stay in this wonderful hotel. Thank you so much for this opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fantastic Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: heathergill
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 nights in snowy,cold Berlin staying at this hotel.On arrival they had kindly upgraded our two standard rooms to residenz rooms (I had e-mailed saying our trip was to celebrate my husband's 60th birthday). The rooms were huge and had every amenity but were very starkly decorated and furnished, had no character whatsoever and were not at all welcoming. Nevertheless the hotel is excellent - the breakfast was marvellous,the rooms are quiet and the location is perfect - within walking distance of Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Potsdamer Platz and Unter den Linden with all its museums, shops etc.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding--deserves another star!”
Reviews.Author: susialpina_10
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel experience we have had in a long time. Staff really went out of their way to make our stay special. They were simply delightful, consistently friendly and helpful. The room was very large and tastefully furnished. We stayed here four nights and were really sorry to leave. Excellent customer service, great location, and spotless room. The hotel has a sauna--highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: K3v19
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, already advised few of my friends to use Mercure Hotel when booking a weekend break to Berlin for February.Our room was clean and surprisingly big. Hotel is in a great location right beside Checkpoint Charlie and the underground train. All the tour buses go past the end of the street it is located on. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Successful, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jarmake
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent, close to two well served metro lines that take you to most sights in Berlin easily, also transport to Tegel airport is fairly simple with by metro & bus combination. Hotel itself is on a side street so there was almost zero traffic noise coming in. The reception staff was fun, helpful people with excellent service attitude. They really made me feel welcome and valued guest. Rooms are quite basic but clean, spacious and in good coondition. Comfortable bed and pillows. Good bathroom size. Breakfast was well organized, delicious and very plentiful so it's definitely worth the price. The complimentary sauna is great after a day of walking around in Berlin. Check out was very fast. Only minor gripes I had with this hotel was some TV noise coming from adjacent room (stopped when another guest complained) and the corridor background music was sometimes audible to the room. Also the bathroom shower stall wall could be a bit longer to reduce spilling water on the bathroom floor. Also the shower head is plain weird and I'd personally like it to be more "conventional". However none of these had significant impact for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: nerthus
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was very comfortable. The room was large and clean, and had a separate shower. The service was in most cases excellent. The hotel had a sauna which could be used free of charge, and bathrobes could be borrowed from the reception. Breakfast was versatile and of good quality. The location of the hotel is good, as there are two metro lines only 5 minutes away. Also Gendarmenmarkt and Galeries Lafayette were in the walking distance. The only negative side was that there was some occasional noise during the mornings. However, in general the hotel was quiet and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KentMusketeers
Reviews.Content: modern hotel in a very good position for sight seeing all within walking distance. Went for 3 nights to see the Christmas markets. Staff friendly, all spoke english and were very helpful. Rooms clean well set out for 3 of use ( two singles together and and one on its own), enough wardrobe space and the shower was like a wet room fantastic with the toilet separate good idea when 3 in a room. Heating through the hotel and in rooms brilliant as it was -10 and snowing outside. Breakfast spoilt for choice, was that good and filling we never had lunch!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Clean Hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: yumyum46
Reviews.Content: We came for a weekend trip to sight see and visit the Christmas Markets. I had checked out the Hotel previously on Trip advisor and was not disappointed with the choice. On arrival we were greeted by the friendly staff and after dropping off our bags went for a drink in the bar which had a very good atmosphere and a 1950s juke box which was fun! There was also a quiet area to relax with your drinks with a small selection of books and magazines to read. The room was surprisingly large, very clean with a separate shower/wet room with wash basin and another room with loo and basin. The hotel is in a very good location only being minutes from Checkpoint Charlie & a short walk from the Brandenburg Gates. We took breakfast in the hotel and although it was busy the staff were friendly and seated us within only a few minutes. Good section of hot and cold food, fruits pastries in plentiful supply which stayed open till 11am on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, great room, couldn't ask for a better place”
Reviews.Author: Bex10121
Reviews.Content: What a great find! Very large room, very clean, friendly staff and lovely breakfast. Short walk to the metro stations and to the main sights of berlin. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location,but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemum69
Reviews.Content: Absolutley fantastic family rooms (suites) with plenty of room and privacy for all. Reception staff pleasant although a little disinterested when we arrived . Bar staff fantastic and friendly. One disappointing feature was there is no restaurant in the evening for meals ..not good for families of young children or I imagine tired business travellers!!! Noise level of a morning(6am) and in the evenings terrible as either side of the hotel have courtyards where trolleys are wheeled around to the back with ? linen or supplies ,this was just appalling and very disturbing whentrying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: riesle
Reviews.Content: This is a very centraly located hotel with excellent service, prefect breakfast, and large rooms, in a quite area just off checkpoit charlie

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EndaStorey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel...I went from Sat to Tue so mixed a weekend in Berlin with a seminar trip. Hotel is close to all amenities. I was surprised at the size of the room, maybe got a bigger one for being off-peak. Sauna was great after the seminar and its on the top floor overlooking the city from the terrace...no restaurant but its close to Friedrichsstrasse and Brandenburg so many choices not far away. Staff v friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gatortail
Reviews.Content: Hotel, Location, Service and Food were great. I traveled with my wife and two kids, and sometimes it is hard to find a family room. They had a great room (actually two rooms in one) for a very good price. Overall very happy. Found thru tripadvisor. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: Joaquim_bcn
Reviews.Content: Is in the center of Berlin, really. Very good breakfast. Perfect silence in the room.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but where is the coffee?”
Reviews.Author: paula188633
Reviews.Content: I staid at the hotel for 3 nights during visiting friends in berlin. The room was nice and quiet and the bed was very comfortable. I found the U-Bahn station a bit too far, but for young people it is not. The only thing I disliked was that there was a coffee machine at the room, but when I arrived there was only 1 coffee and 1 tea pad. The next day there was nothing at all, I had to go to the reception. The 3rd and last day, again there were no pads. It can happen once, but that it happened twice, It really irritated me going down to the reception one more time.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JST16018
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the desk in the middle of the room. A perfect place to make review reports in the evenings. In most cases the desk is situated in one or other dark corn of the room not really inviting to work. I would like just to suggest to make more free space on the desk; hughe television, big coffee machine, drinkglases,telephone .... take a lot of space on the desk. But in general I enjoyed my stay at your hotel and already booked my stay for the coming week.

Reviews.Title: “name for satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very satisfyied with room size,calmness. Smal remark - size of the breakfast room might be slightly bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Privelege Room Superb with space to work and sleep and a great breakfast to follow!”
Reviews.Author: NigelPowell
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with superb Privelege rooms that have separate areas for working and sleeping in, together with a coffee/tea maker (for us Brits) and mini-fridge. Great breakfast in the morning and evening room service meal was of the same excellent quality. Only two negatives. 1) Expected internet access to be free of charge in the room but had to purchase vouchers at reception, albeit only 6 Euros for several hours. 2) Mini-fridge poorly stocked with only soft drinks and a couple of beers.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend Mercure Hotel & Residenz in Berlin!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roywood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just over the wall on the Russian side close to Checkpoint Charlie.A great starting point for a sigtseeing. Some Italian restaurants near the hotel, did not try them, however. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Nothing is a problem! The room was clean and had all the stuff you want from a hotelroom. Breakfast is great, and service fast, friendly and polite. I think the price is right for this hotel. Not a 5-star, but a good value for the money, and a very all right hotel! Recommendable!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan48
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends arrived for a three night stay and were met by a very friendly girl on reception. Our room (three girls sharing) was ready but we chose to sit and have a drink in the small but very comfortabel bar area. Over the next few days the bar staff proved to be both efficient and great fun too! The room, when we finally got to it, was perfectly adequate even with three adults in it. Most importantly it was exceptionally clean and this was the same throughout the whole hotel...Reception, Breakfast Room, Bar and even the bathroom in the Lobby area. The Breakfast Buffet was extensive with everything you could ask for. Only one minor irritation....the water for the tea was only just warm - it needs to be a lot hotter!! Location wise it couldn't be better....a one minute walk to Check Point Charlie and around the corner from one of the main shopping streets. Overall a great option if you want a good hotel at a reasonable price In Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good and friendly service, the room was very big and very clean and quiet. Just a few minutes away from the centre and touristic sites and easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “All one can ask for in a hotel - Spacious room, good location, friendly staff and good comfort!”
Reviews.Author: SSRajan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the city centre, close to two U-Bahn stations and a historic location (Checkpoint Charlie) where the Berlin wall divided East and West Berlin. There are many international restaurants in the area. Many museums are close by and easily accessible by train. We were delighted by the spacious room and an extensive breakfast spread (although not included in our room tariff). The front desk staff was very helpful in guiding us for sight-seeing tours or for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, clean hotel moderately priced in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: normaclarke
Reviews.Content: excellent location near Checkpoint Charley. very friendly staff who were very accommodating to whatever request you had. Clean rooms and bathrooms and spa area. Would recommend to anyone visiting Berlin who is on a budget. Norma C from Jamaica

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: coquille190
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, quiet, very clean, nice beds. (Smoking rooms avaialable!) Although the breakfast room was al little crowded, the breakfast was great, perfect when you're walking in Berlin all day. Have dinner at Entrcote, only a few steps from the hotel. My sweeteheart was very fond of the coquilles st. Jacques.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for sightseeing, most comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JohnR615
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the garden which meant it was very peaceful, it was a superior room - nice and large and comfortably furnished. Check in was easy and the staff were all friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was good value for money. There were several good restaurants in the locality and the hotel location made it easy to visit the sights. John & Hilda.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: flashpacker50plus
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in an excellent location with lots of coffee shops and restaurants around. the suite was ideal for married couple with older parent...lots of space. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. For 3 adults travelling together it was very good value

Reviews.Title: “Nice service but Not next to station !”
Reviews.Author: SheridanSHU
Reviews.Content: Couple days staying in this hotel was the lovely couple days in Berlin. Good things are : - Hotel itself was very clean, at the good condition and offer usually large room. - Our room was simple, large and comfy bed. Things to improve: - They have internet but not free at all, from where i am , it is always free as it is very cheap these days. - Location is not so convenient if u like to be next to U Bahn. However, it is easy to get to the city center (just ask the receptionists) I rate this average as i consider the 4 or 5 star hotel to be excellent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A good start to our European holiday - a stay in Mercure Hotel & Residenz”
Reviews.Author: evillaManila
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late so was initially given a smoking room. Just entering the smoking floor made us feel nauseous. When we requested for transfer, hotel asked if we did not mind staying one night in a special room for handicap and even showed us the room for approval. The room worked out fine and stayed there for the whole 3 nights. Staff are very courteous and helpful, location of the hotel great as it is near the metro and accessible to all parts of city, breakfast was plentiful and varied. No wonder reviews of the hotel are so great.

Reviews.Title: “Even Has German Irony Delivered by Reception Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bertbins
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. With my hubby being wellover 6 foot, the size of room can make such a difference to your enjoyment of a 3 night stay. I am pleased to say the room was amazingly generous in proportions, more like a mini suite. If you can get it, ask for room 603, it may be opposite the lift but we had no problem with noise at all. Bar staff were great and if you like a cigarette there is a great heated smoking area. Guy on reception tried to be clever whenwe asked where we could get English papers, but I think he was just trying out his line in irony. Seriously recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Berlin city and marathon runners”
Reviews.Author: sbcbonds
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Mercure in Berlin near Checkpoint Charlie. Very close to great restaruants and attractions. I had never been to Berlin so went by the reviews on-line. It couldn't have been better. Close to transportation as well. I ran in the Berlin Marathon and was able to walk to the start/finish line. I traveled with my wife and teen children---we were in a duplex there...plenty of room---highly recommend! Free internet in lobby----only downside was it's expensive in room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Just not a standard MERCURE"”
Reviews.Author: glecarpentier
Reviews.Content: This "One-of-a-kind" Mercure Hotel is ideally situated near the famous check Point Charlie and few minutes walking from the well known Freidrichstrasse. My room was great (large, modern and comfortable). Silent is real, I never stayed in a so quiet room. Finally, the professionalism and the friendliness of the staff are at the level of the hotel itself. It is definitely an address to recommend in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in central but but quiet location”
Reviews.Author: joyalkerr
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. The staff were very friendly and efficient. We had booked a 'superior' room (at around 130 euros per room per night excluding breakfast) which we thought good value for the location but were offered a free upgrade to a huge appartment like room with a lounge, balcony and kitchenette area on the top floor. This was excellent and very peaceful accomodation but does not allow us to comment on the ordinary rooms. Everything was exceptionally clean in a very acceptable modern utilitarian, rather than luxurious, fashion. The location was excellent. Tube station was no more than 5 mins walk. Berlin Circular Bus Tour stop the same, as was Checkpoint Charlie Museum. Branderburg Gate and Reichstag were 20 -25 mins walk. Several good cafes and expensive or cheap restaurants were very close so we did not have breakfast in the hotel - as a separate item it looked expensive but may have been good value. Apart from breakfast there were only snack meals served throughout the day although there was a good room service menu. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I am coming back”
Reviews.Author: TonyS02
Reviews.Content: The checkout was fast. The room was big and nice. Good and nice breakfast. Good bear in th bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DDBSB
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a few days in August. Excellent location - close enough to the city center, subway station and major attractions but not in the middle of the crowd (the hotel is located on a quiet block of Schuetzenstrasse). Simple, large, clean and functional room. Efficient staff. Good place to stay in Berlin if you don't want to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: luca0060
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie only one night, but the short time was however sufficient to appreciate the good quality of this Hotel. The location, first of all, is perfect, just in the city center, few minutes far from Unter den Linden by walking, for example; the room was fine, clean and very quiet; the service was perfect and the people very friendly. The price/quality rate is good, only internet is not free of charge and this is not good, for me. What else? Personally, if I will go back to Berlin I will choose again this Hotel and let me suggest it to everybody wants to visit this very nice city.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Stay in a "Triple" at Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: spetman
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a triple with my wife and her father. It was a nice little 'suite' that was actually two rooms, the main bedroom with a 'double bed' (similar to a king-size in the U.S.) and a separate room with a couch that folded out into a bed. The suite was sizable and had the toilet room and shower room in separate rooms too, which was nice. The minibar, safe, etc. were good and were standard Mercure-quality. Front-desk staff spoke English, were very nice and helpful (offered maps, directions to subway, and extra pillows). Location is great - right around the corner from the fabulous Checkpoint Charlie tourist site and museum, and about 2 blocks from a subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrific hotel; great location, attentive service, and large comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: aura60
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews I read on Trip Advisor, and I was very happy with my choice. It was conveniently located to both WW ll memorials, as well as Museum Island. There were good restaurants nearby as well. The room was large, clean, and very comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would stay here again if I was traveling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in easy walking distance of all the major sights and is just around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie. The only problem we experienced is that there is a lack of restaurants in the area..........we did find three which were very good but were not easily visible.Maximmilians was really good for typical german food and an italian which was at the corner of Frierichstrasse.Other than that the Hotel and area were perfect.We booked a taxi transfer prior to arrival which cost about £90 but it was well worth it as the airport is about 15 miles away and for a short trip to the city it was really useful. There is an airport shuttle train but the main station is quite a distance from the hotel so it is both time consuming and probably costly as you will need a taxi from the train station.Berlin was really interesting with lots to see and do and ponder over.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: chefdulce
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here, very clean, great, great location and competent and helpful staff. We did not have breakfast in the hotel but just a few steps from the hotel are many nice places.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money, excellent location, very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: csunata
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed in a triple room which was like a suite, despite the fact that one of the beds was a pull-up couch/bed. However, it still was very comfortable. The room had a small toilet in addition to the bathroom which was really convenient. Free drinking water was provided along with a fancy looking coffee/tea machine which was not so easy to operate. The room was pretty new and very clean. The location is absolutely great since it is so central. The staff was friendly and courteous. Free wireless was only available at the lobby. Close to several cafes around CP Charlie which are suitable for breakfast. A market that is open until 22:00 is within 5-7 walking distance. U-Bahn station is pretty close by. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “far from U Bahn”
Reviews.Author: Barbara_Mass
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not close to station. There is no retaurant around this hotel, you should finidh your dinner around Friedrich Strasse station. There are 3 restaurants you can go from this hotel by foot. One is Italian, the other is french restaurant, and hotel restaurant. French restaurant near by this hotel is selected by Michelin, but tast was normal, not so special on the other hand cost is very high. Staffs there were snobbish. Hotel itself was clean and large room.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBoyden
Reviews.Content: Large, quiet and clean room, generous breakfast, great location and friendly staff. What else could one want? Just one warning: Don't drink the bottled water on the table in your room - they'll try to charge you for it!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, good service, good price”
Reviews.Author: GJM3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in August 2010 on a trip through Europe. The Mercure was a fine refuge at the end of the day, very comfortable and quiet for sleeping. Location was close to numerous attractions and the the u-bahn. Hotel appearance was attractive, and the bar & garden were enjoyable. Service was friendly when asking directions or arranging for laundry. A very good experience, and great value for the rate - I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, splendid service, delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: berlijn
Reviews.Content: Both at the desk and in the restaurant the service was full of attention, friendly and professional. Spacious and quiet room, and good bed. The airconditioning was comfortable. The location was fine: a feasible walk to many highlights. Special compliments for the breakfast. We highly appreciated this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excelent location,friendship personel,good value. Do you need more?”
Reviews.Author: PedroyMarita
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nightas at the Mercure hotel. The location is excelent some 6 blocks from the Unter Der Linden. The rooms are very big, clean and very very silent. The personel of the hotel si extremly kind and efficient an you don´t have to speak German because all of them speaks clear and fluent English

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best Accor Hotel in the world !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Khouts
Reviews.Content: Central location Spacious and contemporary rooms. Delicious and large Breakfast And very professional and welcoming staff !!! Many thanks and congratulations !!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Equill
Reviews.Content: Very good and very fast service. Clean (everyday cleaning) and noiseless room with TV and fridge. Breakfast included. Located in historical center of the city just in few minutes walk from main sights and near from U-bahn station. Everything was excellent in this hotel. I will recomend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Superior room provides excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Clairec98
Reviews.Content: Convenient location with easy access to Berlin's wonderful travel infrastructure. Comfortable room providing an ideal base for a city break

Reviews.Title: “In charliepoint”
Reviews.Author: djflash
Reviews.Content: Bellissimo hotel, bellissime camere, stupenda colazione! Posizione interessantissima!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin August 2010”
Reviews.Author: Ocky528
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Berlin Checkpoint Charlie hotel is located about 200 metres from the famous former Allied cold war crossing checkpoint in the former Soviet Sector of East Berlin. The hotel has been extensively refurbished in the late 1990's over several houses' upper floors. The disabled suite is excellent and spacious although more consideration to the electronic gadgets in the bathroom should have been given as they can be a bit fiddly at times. The main bed was for a single person with a supplementary folding bed for a second person. These could not be pushed together to make one bed. There are three lifts, only one serves the underground car park, all are spacious and easily take a wheelchair and carer. The restaurant is only open for breakfast as there are easily over 300 restaurants/cafes around Berlin. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of Potsdamer Platz, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag to name a few historical places and of course the line of the old wall can be followed. Public transport around Berlin is excellent and is fully integrated if you do not want to walk or use your own transport (note you will need an Umwelt disc for your own car - penalties apply if you don't). All-in-all an excellent hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Again pefect!”
Reviews.Author: Marco1962
Reviews.Content: I already once stayed in the Mercure Berlin Checkpoint Charlie (11-2007) and had the suite 611.This time only room 316 was available and to be honest; I was a little worried since this a "standard" room. I was suprised by the size of if! It was large,clean and spacious. Breakfest was excellent and staff extremely kind. I will certainly return to this hotel. I have stayed in several hotels in Berlin but this one is just execellent on an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxbsitaly
Reviews.Content: New hotel very good and well located with staff very polite. In the morning breakfast is excellent. Berlin is a very large city and is very important to have Metro close to Hotel : so You can use Stadtmitte metro stop and You can go everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: fabi0t
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, huge room (65sqm!), clean, in a very convenient location near to a large number of sights and excellent transport/connections with all the others. Professional, skilled staff. Don't expect fancy furniture/decoration, but a very clean, comfortable and practical choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, strategical location”
Reviews.Author: cristina_dona
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel, in a quiet street far from noise and traffic but near to Friedrichsstrasse and the main monuments. Rooms were large and clean, the staff kind and helpfull. A negative note: breakfast is not included and really too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: imasuleiman
Reviews.Content: Location is great, close to historical sights & shopping street. Room was spacious (we had the privilege suite), simply decorated but had everything we needed, with the exception of a coffee pot. Air conditioning worked perfectly, the room was instantly cool as soon as we turned it on, which was great since the weather was really hot. Breakfast was excellent, and staff were efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: jcasasalc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days (4 nights) at this hotel. We are very glad to have choosen it. It is located next to Checkpoint Charlie, so you can walk to Brandenburg Gate (15 min.) or take the subway (u-bahn). As we were three of us, they gave us a wide and confortable room in the 8th floor. Two small drawbacks: the lift only reaches 7th floor, and there were an unpleasant smell in the hallway. Finally, breakfast is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Location & comfort”
Reviews.Author: keen_traveller495
Reviews.Content: Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie is located in the eastern part of Berlin. It is very close to the Brandenburg Gates, the Potsdamer Pltaz and other attractions. The hotel is clean and nice. Rooms are spacious. The breakfast is good. the price is reasonable. I highly recommend this hotel for the Berlin trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Dickie77
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at the hotel in 2009 staying in a family suite comprising of two good sized bedrooms, bathroom and WC - very impressed with the accommodation. Re-booked for 2010 and have to admit not quite so happy this time round. Again, booked a family suite but bedrooms (and bathroom) in this were considerably smaller. Also, whereas the suite last year had a good size bedroom with a desk and wardrobes, this time round the bed in the second room was a sofa bed, no wardrobes. Fine for small children, but not for our 17 year old. Thems the breaks, I guess. On our next visit to Berlin, will definitely look again at the Mercure, but will also be looking to see if can get a better deal elsewhere, will not be an automatic return.
