Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in a great town.”
Reviews.Author: WobkesDad
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Hotel staff was friendly, helpful and professional. All questions answered; all wishes granted. The breakfasts are absolutely superb (we remain grateful that our room arrangement was inclusive breakfast!). Endless buffet offerings to get you truly prepared for each day. In addition the hotel bar and bistro serves good food and drink til late in the evening - until 01:00 the weekend we arrived. The triple room we stayed in was roomy despite its narrowness, with separate bathroom and toilet, and plenty of wall outlets (a personal favorite). Hotel staff puts the rooms back in fine shape each morning. The Mercure has a great location within walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie (duh) as well as many other sites, shopping, places to eat, etc. We ended up extending our stay to six nights and it wasn't nearly enough. Internet availability is provided by a single wired terminal available for guests next to the reception desk , and a fairly slow WiFi signal throughout the lobby. So what. You should be outside seeing Berlin. The "fitness room" was a bit less than expected, a rather small room on the 7th (top) floor of the hotel comprising an exercise bike and a stair-climber, with an adjoining smaller room with a mat on the floor. Hard to find much inspiration here. Didn't try the sauna. No problem, again, since all the walking and biking we did in Berlin afforded plenty of exercise. Parking is available from the hotel; the lobby elevator takes you directly to the secured garage level for Mercure guests and costs EUR 13,-- daily. We would definitely fly to Berlin on our next visit, however, as the car wasn't used at all during our visit, and the seven hour drive from Holland isn't very interesting (w/ apologies to those living near the motorway on the way to Berlin). There are many places to eat near the hotel, or the nearby subway stop takes you anywhere you want to go in the evening. We enjoyed a very nice Italian restaurant a block from the hotel ("Lungomare Trattoria Bar" at Krausenstr.11) for dinners, and late evening coffee. The recommendation for daily excursions in Berlin is to rent a bike (said the Dutch guy). Head towards Potsdammer Platz and rent bikes to see this extraordinary city easily and cheaply. We paid EUR 10,-- a bike per 24 hour day, with no deposit. There's lots to see and do in Berlin. The history is rich and hardly limited to the suffering from WWII and the Cold War. Plenty of other musea! The architecture is amazing. The food, the beer, the shopping, the sites, the nightlife, the people. Cool town.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: gpd132
Reviews.Content: I was in town to see Berlin and visit a friend. I found this hotel to be in a good location and a good price. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly, and the room comfortable. There were many attractions within walking distance and the nearby U-bahn station will take you anywhere in Berlin..

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Mercure - I'd stay again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: alohomora713
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the recommendation of a friend who stayed there with her boyfriend several weeks before my trip. I then did some research and saw how well it was reviewed on TA so I decided to go for it. The hotel is just off a large main street (which was never busy during my 4 night stay) and is a very short walk from the nearest U-bahn station. There are several local convenience stores nearby which are handy for water and other amenities. The lobby of the hotel is small, but the staff at the front desk were extremely helpful, polite and smiley. We had a normal twin room on one of the top floors of the hotel and it was amazing. A very, very large room. One of the largest I've ever stayed in. It has a reception area to hang coats, bags etc. There's a small living room space with table and chairs. The desk is in the centre of the room, with TV, desk chair, phone and mini-bar underneath, then the beds are on the other end of the room. There are two large windows that open out onto balconies overlooking the light and bright courtyard. Also, a curious addition to this hotel room (which I love and have never encountered since) is that the toilet is in a separate room to the bathroom. The bathroom itself was of adequate size, with a walk in shower. There's surround sound throughout the entire room, so when listening to music or the TV the sound is brilliant. The staff that we encountered during our stay were always helpful and polite. We regularly call down for bottle openers, buckets of ice or glasses and we always had our needs met. There was a small but perfectly laid out gym spread over two floors. It had a sauna, fitness equipment and excellent shower facilities. It was also open 24 hours. In terms of room size, this is still the hotel that I compare all others to.

Reviews.Title: “My stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: seanread1
Reviews.Content: The staff at this Hotel are very good and always try to help, this is the 4th time at this Hotel and they always look after me with a good room, I will be going back soon. Keep up the good work. Sean Read

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tony155011
Reviews.Content: hotel was within easy walking distance of many attractions - or we could easliy catch the U Bahn Hotel was clean, rooms were clean and airconditioned - great for the hot July in Berlin. Rooms were large - beds were comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. The bar led out into the courtyard or Hof - very quiet and peaceful. B/fasts were expensive at 18 Euros - but there were sevaral coffee / bakeries close by. WiFi was free in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, spacious, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Paula039
Reviews.Content: Good location in the middle of the centre, very nice room, got good information in the reception about underground, directions, museums and so on. One complain only: when I had ordered room service for the next morning I had to phone and remind about it when they hadn´t turned up. When I called they came straight away.

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Cat Duncan
Reviews.Content: We had a very emjoyable stay at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie. My husband and my 2 children in their early twenties took me to Berlin to celebrate my 50th birthday and we stayed in a family suite with a double room and a twin room. The rooms were huge in comparison to normal hotel rooms and with simple but pleasant decor. The breakfast was good but not sure I would pay EUR 18 each for it (ours was included in room rate). The staff were very helpful and always gave a smile in passing. We all had a free 20 min massage on the Tuesday and it helped sooth the weary muscles after a long day sightseeing. Very good location - easy walking distance to main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: KarenCaetano
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights, it was a great hotel, greal localization, easy to go to many atractions walking and easy to get to the subway. The room was very clean and wide.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoFB
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excelent location. Close to metro, checkpoin Charlie and 15 minutes walking from Brandenburg Tor. Also has a very good room, spacious and well cleaned. Breakfast is good and the staff so much atencious. Internet is free in the lobby. The only complaint I have is about the treatment of the manager (I think she was the manager). When I ask for a 1 hour later checkout she said ok. Then, when I asked the same thing for my friend, she said no. So, I ask: if he requested, would she approve? Remember that check in is 15h and check out is 12h. We dont have 24h. Except for this, the hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Gret Location!”
Reviews.Author: Renjay27
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We booked through the website that advertised a "Romance Package" which included wine, welcome gift and breakfast" we booked this because the deal was so great. When we arrived we were greeted with friendly staff who explained to us our room will be ready within 15 minutes so enjoy a free drink at the bar while we wait. Great! Then when we got to the room, it was the biggest room I have ever seen. Tall ceilings, huge bathroom, sitting room etc. There was rose petals on the bed and scattered in the bathroom. There was even a cake for us to eat, whch was beautiful! We were very impressed with this room and the service. Breakfast was also very good. The location is fantastic, within walking distance to the Sony Centre and Checkpoint Charlie. Berlin is a grat place. The hotel also provides free massages on Tuesday evenings, so make sure you book yourself in it is great. There is also free wifi in the lobby. This is ok because there is a bar and LDC on, so it is ok to sit there at the end of a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay, Good Service & Support from Hotel Staff.”
Reviews.Author: MixSuresh
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location in the center of Berlin. Hotel Staff very commendable. We were provided with very good support and our questions were patiently answered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - We will be booking again!”
Reviews.Author: elintuk
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel - We will recommend to others and book again ourselves. Room for three was spacious and clean; the service and breakfast were outstanding; the location was convienient to all the historical sights; and the value was unbeatable! Well done Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie!

Reviews.Title: “hotel to recommend!”
Reviews.Author: antonello251150
Reviews.Content: Large room, always very clean, friendly and helpful reception service

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: JLaing
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Europe travel”
Reviews.Author: VladimirI
Reviews.Content: Really good and positive hotel. Not cheap - but it fits money for 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mark22015
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expecations. We booked a family room, which contained two seperate sleeping rooms, with TVs in each. Shared large bath area with both shower and bath tub. Hotel was quiet, but near Fredrickstrasse shopping and close to U Bahn stop. As noted in other reviews, breakfast was 18 Euros if not booked with room, but several cafes, bakery and McDonalds were less than a 5 minute walk from hotel, to get a reasonably priced breakfast. Booked room through Orbitz at great rate. Family room was not your usual European small hotel room. Large and spacious by US Standards. Wireless internet was at a reasonable price, but a computer was available in lobby with free internet access, but occassionally has to wait to get access. Well lighted secured parking in basement of hotel for $18 Euros a day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: asofoulis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled from the UK (London) through the Netherlands, Germany, Switzerland, Austria, Italy and France for 5 weeks and stayed at 3-4 star hotels in each city. The Mercure Berlin (Checkpoint Charlie) was the cheapest hotel we stayed in, but probably the 2nd best hotel! The location is unbeatable, the room was huge, the bathroom was great, the facilities were fantastic, the buffet breakfast was the best we had. But, the difference was the staff. The reception staff were extremely pleasant and went out of the way to help us. When I fell ill, they arranged for a local doctor to visit me within 2 hours of us telling them. We recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: happyasabean
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 3nights in april. The hotel was easy to find as it is right next to Checkpoint Charlie and there are lots of restaurants and bars in the streets around it. The room was large and clean and the UBahn station is a few minutes walk away. Our city break fell during the time when the ash cloud from Iceland caused the cancellation of flights and our flight home was cancelled, the staff were very helpful in helping us find accomodation for our extended stay (they had none available) and kept us updated with air reports. There was free use of the internet and international tv available. The receptionist was very eager to help and spoke english perfectly, he gave us directions, recommendations and maps to help us on our way. overall I loved berlin and the unexpected extention to our visit was very welcome as there is so much to see and do. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An ambiguous hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItaliaBio
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no help from desk with our luggage at arrival, uncapable personnel in understanding our needs, and insistent in forcing us to hire a delinquent taxi at departure. We didn't like the room cause in the disabled person room there are two separated beds and no way to set the beds togheter for a couple. So we were forced to sleep in the standard room, with obvious difficulty for the electric wheelchair we use. The location is pretty good. We liked best the location, least the personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Berlin for family with older kids”
Reviews.Author: Mercerislandtravel
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Mercure Berlin Checkpoint Charlie. The hotel had an excellent location. It was perfect for our family with my wife and 2 boys, 25 and 18. Our family suite had 2 bedrooms with 2 baths. Wonderful modern furnishings. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Lambi
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, in a quiet street near Checkpoint Charlie and Unter den Linden. Close to Stadtmitte U-bahn stop. Stayed in a family suite, which was large with two bedrooms. Good value throuh hotels.de. Bathroom was fine. Beds a little bit hard, but ok. There was no coffeemachine, waterbolier or cups in the room, which was a disappointment. Expensive brekfast at 18 Euro p.p., not included, and which we did not want to pay as extra. A small supermarket and a couple of cafes and restaurants in the close neighbourhood, plus a fast-food joint selling really tasty currywurst.

Reviews.Title: “First time visit to Berlin, definitely not the last!”
Reviews.Author: WelshOssie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel choice for visitors looking to experience the history, culture and buzz of a fab city. Location-wise, the Mercure is a five minute walk from Checkpoint Charlie and the "Wall"; 15 minutes from Unter Den Linden and the sights of Museum Island and the symbolic Brandenburg Gate; 10 minutes from the shops along Friedrichstrasse and the Stadt Mitte U-bahn which takes you to many other great sights. The hotel itself is a stylish and modern building, comfortable rooms, good facilities and, most importantly, really helpful (and English speaking) staff who made the stay very easy and pleasant - even as England were exiting the 2010 World Cup ...!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the heart of town”
Reviews.Author: TravelSiMa
Reviews.Content: We stayed several times at the Mercure Hotel at Checkpoint Charlie, always on weekends, last in June 2010. Location: The hotel is located 2 min by foot from Checkpoint Charlie. You can park the car in the hotel’s garage, but also in front of the hotel paying with coins for the time you need. The whole Sunday is for free on these places. Rooms: We always booked a standard room, but were upgraded from the hotel twice to a junior suite and to an apartment. All the rooms, the suite and the apartment were spacious, comfortable, nice and clean. The suite and the apartment both faced the street, but it was always really quiet at night, the standard rooms faced different inner courtyards. One of the rooms had a balcony opening to the inner courtyard with the hotel’s restaurant & breakfast areas in, but it was also very quiet. The staff is helpful and friendly, but maybe sometimes a bit too enthusiastic and talking too much to the customer, but this is just something we personally do not like so much. The breakfast is a really good buffet that you can book additionally. They have an internet access for free in the lobby. We can absolutely recommend staying here and would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: traveler112005
Reviews.Content: As everyone else has said, great location for sightseeing, with 2 subway stops nearby (Kochstrasse and Stadtmitte). To get there from Tegel airport by public transportation, take bus 128 to U-bahn Kurt Schumacher-Platz (7 stops), then get on the U-bahn going towards Mariendorf to Kochstrasse. Hotel is then 2 blocks north and 2 blocks east of subway. Also, there is free wi-fi in the lobby and also a computer with internet access in the lobby. Wi-fi in the room is 9 euro/day

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mandersonx
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mercure Check Point Charlie is in an excellent location for a visitor to Berlin. Close Metro stops but we were able to walk to everything we wanted to see. There are many good restaurants within a couple of blocks of the Hotel. My room was so comfortable - spacious and immaculate. The room was made up every morning while I was at breakfast. Walk in closet, fluffy towels, good lighting, many windows, very comfortable mattress, a duvet, nice linens! I would definately plan to stay here when I return to Berlin. The staff were so helpful, always offering suggestions, helping solve problems, ordering tickets for performances for you, making phone calls to airline to help locate lost luggage.......they were wonderful! The breakfast room has a very well put together breakfast buffet that was always delicious - huge number of choices including freshly squeezed orange juice and good coffee. Lovely staff, always cheerful, pleasant, and attentive. It is an excellent value although the charge was E18.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Modern Hotel with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: Barb048
Reviews.Content: Berlin was our last stop in Europe. Checkpoint Charlie is a very modern hotel, compared to others we stayed in through Europe. The location is excellent and the staff is very accomodating. Although it is quite close to the main thoroughfares, our room faced an inner courtyard which was very quiet and had a lovely balcony. The only draw back we found was the high-speed internet was at a price and did not work well in the rooms. Once we informed the staff however, the charge was removed from our bill. Berlin is a great city, we walked around 20k our last day. Don't bother making the walk to the Europa Center - you are better off shopping on Fredrichstrasse or other shopping areas in the city.

Reviews.Title: “We were very satisfied with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: funtank
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location. Centrally situated in the heart of Berlin, the main tourist attractions were in easy walking distance. Mercure Hotel and it's staff were most pleasant and friendly. Room was ideal, clean, and very well maintained on a daily basis. Food was excellent and our breakfast was superb. No complaints whatsoever. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mm914
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service, specially at the reception. The room was large, clean and quiet. As well the surrounding was quiet, even though the hotel is located in walking distance from Berlin centre and many sights. Nice selection for breakfast and at the bar. Great hotel - we will for sure come again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: martinaston
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,friendly efficient staff who all seem to speak very good english.Rooms generous in size and well designed. Very convenient location within walking distance of many attractions with a U bahn station two minutes walk away. Have secure underground parking which was a requirement for us as we drove to Berlin.There seemed to be plenty of on street parking close to the hotel.Very pleased with our stay and have no negative comments to make.Would definetly stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: alkIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to major sites such as the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie and Topography of Terror. The restaurants and bars of Potzdamer Platz are within walking distance. A slightly longer walk takes you to Alexander Platz in former East Berlin and all it has to offer. The shopping street of Friedrichstrasse is conveniently located for anyone interested in buying Bugatti or Gucci. A short walk to Gendarmenmarkt has several restaurants and bars; I would particularly recommend Malatesta. We were 2 adults and 2 pre-teen children in a suite. The two double bedrooms were more than adequate and felt more like an apartment. On checkout we felt a bit stung on having to argue to remove the hefty €18 (per person) charge for breakfast for several days which seemed to be applied as a matter of policy regardless of whether you availed of breakfast or not. But this was just a slightly sour aftertaste to an otherwise enjoyable experience. With kids, Berlin zoo is a must. Knut the polar bear and Bao Bao the Giant Panda are the star attractions. Animals can so often look agitated in zoos but in Berlin zoo the animals seem contented overall, and this adds to a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks the personal touches”
Reviews.Author: homelover48
Reviews.Content: Just an ok city Hotel, lacks the personal touches eg: shower cap, hair conditioner and body lotion. The mini bar doesn't even include a glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: we2StocktonOnTees
Reviews.Content: As the name suggested it was close to Check Point Charle and within walking distance to a lot of Berlin's sights. Our room was large and although overlooking the main road was very quiet, it was also lovely and clean. Breakfast was good with a varied choice of both hot and cold food. The only down side about the hotel is that there are not really any bars/restaurants nearby to go to but I suppose this is to be expected with a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lesSables
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel and can only agree with the other reviews - its a very nice hotel, very clean and with big rooms. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a pleasant experience. One negative thing though - the hairdryer in the bathroom! If I had wanted to use a hoover to dry my hair, this would've been ideal! I ended up looking like a woolly dog (thank God it rained most of the weekend so I had an excuse for my bedraggled appearance), so please Mercure management, do something about that! Its the only complaint though - we highly recommend this hotel. Very near Checkpoint Charlie and within walking distance to some of the major sights. It was our first time in Berlin and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PEW56
Reviews.Content: We had a family suite which consisted of a large king bedroom with balcony and TV and a second double bedroom with a TV with a hallway adjoining with a separate toilet and sink and then a bathroom with shower, bathtub and sink - perfect for a family!

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDutchman64
Reviews.Content: Clean room, quiet, free newspaper (German) every morning, central location, close to U-Bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location, staff are friendly and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: jswh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent quiet location and well presented. All the staff were extremely friendly and very helpful with going the extra mikle for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, yet nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: ladaca
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on its high rating on TripAdvisor, and we weren't disappointed. Very efficient service, reception staff spoke excellent English. Location is great, a stone's throw from Checkpoint Charlie, near Stadtmitte U-Bahn, and plenty of shops nearby. The room was enormous, and nice and quiet. We didn't bother with the breakfast, which seemed overpriced at 18 euros per person per day. There's a bakery/cake shop and a little supermarket on the next block, and we got breakfast there each day for a few euros. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “They gave our room away”
Reviews.Author: BernieB68
Reviews.Content: Imagine our disappointment when we finally arrived at the hotel after numerous delays to our flight to find there was no room for us! The hotel were quite pleasant and ordered a taxi for us to go to another hotel. We arrived at the Novotel Mitte to be assigned a room that was already occupied! Can't say I was that impressed. When we did go back to the hotel the following day we had been upgraded to a very nice room with some fruit but it was a pain having to move and made me very disappointed once again with the A Club! Couldn't tell you what a normal room was like! Also the air conditioning vent was not in the bedroom so the room was really warm overnight

Reviews.Title: “Great service with a warm welcome and a smile”
Reviews.Author: Colin84
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights 27 - 30 May 2010 primarily to attend Michael Buble concert at O2 World. Greeted with a warm welcome at check-in. English speaking receptionists. Room huge with balcony. Highly recommended hotel with excellent breakfasts. Near all the major sites in the east and centre of Berlin. Checkpoint Charlie 400 yards away and U-bahn station just around the corner from hotel so you can easily travel to all parts of the city. Also recommend Fat Tire bike Tours All In One City Tour - great tour guides.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a long week-end”
Reviews.Author: TELLERVO_2
Reviews.Content: Friendly and welcoming service; we received valuable tips from the receptionnists for nice locations for dinner and drinks. Tidy and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Donna J
Reviews.Content: Just come back from our first trip to Berlin, this hotel is ideally placed for seeing ALL of the sites within Berlins centre. Once you get your bearings you realise that you can easily walk to all the historic places. The hotel will also help you by booking trips and/or tickets for events. They were able to give us a printout of the U-bahn timetable that we would need in order to get us to a concert that we had tickets for (yes, the undergroud trains run to a timetable and are extremely efficient). We arrived late at night and had paid a basic rate for a basic room, upon arrival we were told that we had been upgraded to a suite - what a fantastic surprise. The suite was massive and absolutely spotless, we had a balcony overlooking an internal courtyard and a little kitchen area where we were able to make a good old cup of tea after a hard days sightseeing. The staff cannot do enough for you and are all very friendly. The breakfast is a bit pricey at 18 euros per person but there is a damn fine selection, we just couldn't help but have it most mornings! Can't wait to go back to Berlin and will definately be using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good central location.”
Reviews.Author: eckmacb
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely clean quite hotel in a good central location. Close enough to everything, but not in the middle of it. The staff was very nice with great language skills.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: LB-21-B
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is good, near to two tube stations and in a walking distance from the Museum Island. Rooms are very big and comfort and very clean. Breakfast was great, with a lot of options. The only thing that was a bit disappointing, but did not influence my overall positive view for this hotel, is that some people from the staff were not speaking English fluently; hence I had some misunderstanding when trying to order food from the room service. What is more, I experienced some difficulties with the wifi; I could not get connected with the voucher I bought from the reception, which they did charge me finally even if I did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly caring staff”
Reviews.Author: KrakowFFTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie 3 nights and enjoyed every one of them. We got a warm welcome and the staff was very helpful during the entire stay. They had time for a short chat and the general impression we got, were employees happy to do what they do. The hotel is properly quit new and that combined with good housekeeping made the rooms and facilities inviting. Location is perfect, full of history (cold war) and very close to public transportation (U-Bahn). Summarizing: Plusses: Friendly staff Great location – close to everything Newly build Direct access from closed parking to floor of room, protected with electronic key-card. Extensive break first of high quality Minuses: No restaurant – when travelling with a child, possibility of dinning in the hotel is an advantage. No coffee / tea maker in the room, which usually is standard in Mercure Hotels. The two minuses are the reason for “only” four stars. Apart form those, we wouldn’t hesitate recommending the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: terenzio22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to Checkpoint Charlie, the U-Bahn, Galeries Lafayette all within easy walking distance. The room was very clean and comfortable, nicely furnished. The full breakfast at 18 Euros is expensive but you can easily get a coffee and croissant at a cafe. We would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, positive experience in every way”
Reviews.Author: Koene
Reviews.Content: Friendly personel; nice, clean rooms (family room was perfect) and very good breakfest! Very nice hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff!! Huge, functional and...”
Reviews.Author: msonline
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff!! Huge, functional and clean room. Remark: WiFi is not free in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city trip in a Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: makof16
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to metro, checkpoint charlie, tours, restaurants and bars. Booked a triple room - large and very clean. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Would go back to same hotel if visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “One hotel to rule them all”
Reviews.Author: TigroPL
Reviews.Content: In July 2009 I decided to go to Berlin. Searching both a good and not exceedingly expensive hotel in Berlin was a pain. After some time I thought I wouldn't be able to find anything worth a visit. And then I found Hotel Mercure Checkpoint Charlie which filled all my requirements. First of all, I'd like to say that the location is really great - one can almost throw something to Friedrichsstrasse out of the window and get to Checkpoint Charlie within seconds or to Unter den Linden within a short while. The stay was extraordinarily great - the day we came to check-in, we realized that we got a free upgrade to the Executive Room instead of the standard one we paid for. It was HUGE. And by "HUGE" I mean - "HUUGE"! In the room, there was a safe, wardrobe, two beds, desk and an additional table near the window. There is one thing I just have to write about the bed: the mattress was just AMAAAAAAZING! In my life, I've never experienced such soft and comfortable mattress. Sleeping or even lying on it was a pleasure and I heartily thank you, dear staff, for supplying such beds :) The room was very clean and nicely furnished. I chose to have a room without breakfasts (since I like diversity so I prefer eating every day in another place) so I can't say anything about this service. The staff of the hotel was very, very friendly and helpful. Few hours after I asked them to book a table at the Reichstag Cafe for my family I had it done (and, moreover, they sent me a message to my mailbox in the TV in the room so that I knew it just after I turned on my TV :)). There is also a gym in the hotel - I liked it very much. I haven't tried the solarium, but both the sauna and the fitness area were good (and, what's worth mentioning, free of charge!). Pleasant view out of the window, cosy atmosphere - could I want more? :) There is also a nice thing about the parking place - it's hidden underground so we can't bother that someone throws something at our car from the street. There is of course a lift from the underground level straight to the hotel so we can go to our car every time we want without even going to the street. OK, now let's find some cons :) One day my room wasn't cleaned even though I didn't ask anyone to skip my room during the cleaning. However I informed a lady at the desk about this and not only did it never happen again but also they proposed me to clean my room right after I told them about the problem. There is also another bad thing about the cleaning staff - the last day I was staying there, they didn't provide me new soap bars or tissues. I really didn't like it cause it looked like "OK, you're leaving anyway, so let's not bother with you anymore..". Then, the main cons are the merits of the cleaning staff. I also didn't like the fact that the Internet connection wasn't free of charge - however, it's a disadvantage of almost all four-star hotels in Europe... Even though I like to find faults or even cavil, I simply can't find any other things to point out as "bad" in this hotel. Let this be a testimony of the hotel's quality :) Summing up, the hotel is amazing. Everything here made me happy - from such trifles as the awesome mattresses through extremely helpful staff to the vast room. I loved staying in this hotel and I recommend it as strongly as I can.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable base in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: aygeemac
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights in the hotel. Our room was spacious, comfortable and well appointed. The Mercure Checkpoint Charlie is well-situated in Berlin Mitte within very reasonable walking distance (5 minutes) of 2 U-bahn stations Stadtmitte and Kochstrasse. Many of the sights of central Berlin and the shops of Friedrichstrasse are also within easy walking distance. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel because at €18 per person daily we didn't think that represented good value - no matter how much you eat. We did, though, have a light lunch (with wine) in the bar one day and the cost was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: here2007
Reviews.Content: We used Trip Advisor to screen hotels in Berlin and choose the "Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie" on the basis of location, comfort and price. In the event we were delighted with our choice. It is ideally located within walking distance of many of the sights. U bahn Berlin Mitte was also close. We had a large and comfortable room with a very large bed, TV, safe, and minibar. The shower room was also large. Breakfast was a touch expensive, but with excellent quality and choice. There was a comfortable bar. Service could not be faulted: all the staff were friendly and very ready to be of assistance. We had an excellent recommandation for evening dining from one young lady at reception: nearby Maximillian's restaurant - so good we went there every night. We would recommend this hotel without hesistation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excelent breakfast and careful staff”
Reviews.Author: RenatoFuzz
Reviews.Content: What a good surprise! Mercure hotel was simply perfect. Great location. you can shop on foot, very near subway station. The breakfast is among the best I've ever had and the staff did everything for a excelent stay. Congratulations Mercure Checkpoint Charlie Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “evcellent hotel for service and location”
Reviews.Author: boraldo
Reviews.Content: would suggest to improve internet connection: only one computer for the size of the hotel seems not adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortabe hotel for a stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ggeleyn
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - rooms with a lot of space (even the standard room I had) and very quiet even though you are in the centre of Berlin. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis... it was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: haecca86
Reviews.Content: I felt really good: nice personal, silence in the room night, a big and nice room, good bed... Only the breakfast could have a better quality (some bio or ecologic things for exemple, or a very good bread, etc.). More diversity than quality... But for all the other things I will come again!

Reviews.Title: “"2nd Visit to this roomy, quite and Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bfcjeep
Reviews.Content: IWe have stayed at this hotel previously in one of the top floor suites, this time we opted for just a standard double, but as well as the Bedroom area there was also a separate seating area and both with TV's. Internet is available in the room. No resturant but a good breakfast room. Also room service with a good selection. Within 15 walking distance of the centre but also abot 5 minutes to a tube station. We will go back again, still plenty of berlin to see.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ThomasMS
Reviews.Content: Actually we were in doubt... whether this hotel deserved 4 or 5 stars. Everything was spotless. Newly renovated. Nice bathrooms, good beds and most importantly very very quiet surroundings. Our room was next to the escalator - and we did not hear even the faintest hiss from that. No sounds from the street. Only reason why this hotel does not get 5 stars: 1. We did not like the room decorating (very subjective - but blue and orange are not our favorite colors). 2. Toilet was in a separate roome from the bath (a fact some may actually appreciate) 3. The reception recommended a steak-restaurant which turned out to be really really bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggih
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, spotless and comfortable. But beware the final bill, they assume you have had breakfast (which isn't included in the room rate) even if you haven't. On a 3 night stay this would cost you 96 euros. They overcharged us, easy mistake but no apology.

Reviews.Title: “Check in at Checkpoint Charlie!”
Reviews.Author: cubuff1453
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute for Easter weekend after browsing tripadvisor and what was still available. This place was great. Front desk was wonderful! Could not have been better. Went above and beyond helping with directions, maps, and suggestions. They made us feel very welcome as a visitor. The rooms are large by european standards and the beds super comfy. Nothing wrong with the room at all. It is really only 2 blocks to checkpoint charlie and only 2 blocks to 2 different U stops-so it is easy to get anywhere. The U in Berlin is fantastic. You can also walk to Postdamer Platz and Unter der Linden no problem if you are in half decent shape. Gendarmenmarkt is a must see and only 5 blocks away. This place was a winner. Only negative is there is no nightlife within a few blocks-but the U runs late.

Reviews.Title: “It was a plaisure to stay in this comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ginnybirba
Reviews.Content: Reception personel is skilled and get guest in relaxed condition.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay in good atmosphaere”
Reviews.Author: mwix
Reviews.Content: we were here to run ½ marathon. we got good help when our kids want to sleep alone in a single room, we got the handicap room, which was very good :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DUB67
Reviews.Content: Second time we stayed here and again it was almost perfect. The only drawback was that our room was warm and dry. We stayed three nights. It's the perfect location if you visit Berlin for the first time. Since we have been around several times the next time we will book at Prenzlauer Berg, just because the vibe is better for us there. For business stay highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfect”
Reviews.Author: robinsonm008
Reviews.Content: I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. I travel a fair bit and I can say that this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Everything was perfect. The room was huge and spotless, modern and tasteful. The breakfast was excellent. The staff were very obliging. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & so helpful”
Reviews.Author: winterboy
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to explore -but note there are lots of bars and restaurants on an evening in the near locality so you need to travel a little bit. Hotel rooms are nice & spacious, breakfasts are a feast and staff are juts wonderful and helpful-as was everyone in Berlin . I can really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great no-frills hotel even for site-seer”
Reviews.Author: Livin_in_Germany
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a business hotel so it doesn't have a fancy restaurant, large lounges, etc., The "business center" is one computer next to the front desk in the busy lobby. But it is in a good location for site seeing. (The nearest U-Bahn station is Stadtmitte, about three blocks, and it is not one of the 'main' station stops.) I walked to every site I wanted to visit. I had a large, very clean room, with sitting area, and even a balcony. Even though this is just a block from one of the busiest tourist sites in the city (Checkpoint Charlie), the street was quiet. The staff were helpful. I skipped breakfast. I thought it a bit much to charge 30 Euros, even though that is about the going rate in city hotels. There are many coffee shops in the area so that worked well for me. There is an Italian and a French restaurant just down the street. This is part of a large European chain which often has good specials on rooms. All in all, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotels”
Reviews.Author: maryhillmagyar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is round the corner from Checkpoint Charlie, and about 300 yds from nearest 'U' station at Stadt Mitte, which is 2 stops from Friedriechstrasse. From there Airport express is about 30 minutes. Rooms are amazing, ours was about 300 sq feet, seperate toilet and wet floor shower room. Breakfast was everything you could ask for and plenty of it! The bar in the hotel is a bit pricey, 2 wines and orange juice 20 Euros. There are a a good few restaurants about 200 yds from hotel, French and Italian. Staff in hotel are excellent, always helpful and welcoming with a word whenever you arrive at hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: McGAussie
Reviews.Content: We got a very good rate booking via the Hotel website and felt we got great value for money. Our room was huge, simply furnished in the standard Mecure style, and spotlessly clean. We had the usual European twin beds (although well proportioned) pushed together to make a “double” with single doonas. However, the toilet was in a separate room to the shower – a pleasant surprise. And the heating was the right ambient temperate: not too warm to sleep, not too cold to want to stay in bed in the morning. We didn’t partake of Breakfast/Restaurant in the hotel. Instead there is a little coffee shop 100m from the hotel where 2 latte coffees and 2 croissants cost around €10. We dined at the nearby Italian Pizzeria/Restaurant – classic fare at reasonable prices. And if you want, there is a French Restaurant close by as well. Although the hotel seemed isolated away from the main tourist attractions, it is only one block from Checkpoint Charlie (as its name suggests) and only another block on to the last remnants of "the wall" insitu. We chose to walk briskly to the TV tower and it took only 20 minutes, however, it would be approx 40 minutes walk to the Brandenburg Gates. Compliments to the Reception staff who were very helpful and courteous. Use of the internet was free. And it only cost €20 to the Airport. Overall – we left with a very good impression of the Mecure Checkpoint Charlie. PS: when in Berlin, take a Segway tour – so much FUN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Location”
Reviews.Author: AmirGhasser
Reviews.Content: This is great place to stay as near to Checkpoint Charli. You need to try and it will be great. just walking distance to shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, comfortable hotel with extremely nice staff”
Reviews.Author: pepinparis
Reviews.Content: Very good location, comfortable hotel with extremely nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: DomGobin
Reviews.Content: Good location; very kind employees; very good breakfast (may I suggest you also serve pancakes).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Henrik L
Reviews.Content: Quiet, central, clean, friendly staff and a very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: jimhath
Reviews.Content: Read reviews on TripAdvisor and booked based on that. We were not disappointed - great hotel in good location. Booked through Mercure website and got great deal (including breakfast) when paying up front.

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid base for a Berlin trip”
Reviews.Author: ManorRoad
Reviews.Content: We went as part of a large independently-booked group of people, celebrating a friend's 50th birthday, and so the hotel had to be good enough to deal with a range of demands. And it was... We booked a family room for two adults and our two girls. On check-in, the hotel attempted to charge extra for the girls, but we pointed out that we had been perfectly clear on our booking and had paid in advance because of that. The misunderstanding was satisfactorily resolved. Another problem is that we had requested a non-smoking room, and were not given one. 30 minutes later, all sorted out. (However, it's worth adding that Berlin as a whole has a 1970s attitude to smoking - highly tolerated). The room was great - two bedrooms, one of which was large enough to accommodate pre-dinner drinks for eight people. Beds very comfortable. As usual with most hotels, the mini-bar was stupidly expensive, so we didn't bother. Breakfast at 18Euros was also costly, but opinion varied on this - I thought it poor value, with a limited selection of food and poor coffee. My partner was more pleased, as were most others in the group. Being from the UK, I found bar prices also very expensive - 4.50Euros for 500mls of average beer. There is no free internet in the rooms - the lobby area has free wireless reception, and a computer for guest usage. The lobby was also good for pulling together the 20+ party of people, and very pleasant anyway. The location is great - near Checkpoint Charlie, close to the underground and buses, and within walking distance of many great restaurants and facilities - for example, we walked to the Sony Centre Potsdammerplatz twice to go to the cinema. Staff were helpful, and had a German style of service - not friendly, but very efficient (except the bar - up to 10 minutes to charge a drink to your room!) The desk people helped us book restaurants, and looked after our bags on check-out day. This was our third hotel in Berlin, and easily the best.

Reviews.Title: “Proud to be Italians”
Reviews.Author: MilanDona
Reviews.Content: We have been welcomed in this hotel, planned by an italian architect, Aldo Rossi, very corteusly. The double rooms are very confortable, wide and quiet. The hotel is located in a district , planned by the same architect, silent near the Check Point Charlie. Friedrichstrasse is a wide street with many shops and near a wonderfull square Gendarmen Platz. The best is the confort and efficiency. The least the early closing of the restaurant in the hotel for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Warmth!”
Reviews.Author: Comfortseeker58
Reviews.Content: Berlin is a truly fascinating city, one we will surely visit again in the not too distant future. We chose this hotel partly because of its reputation among Trip Advisor members. Our accommodation was spacious. Rooms were located in a quiet part of the hotel. The restaurant wasn't open in the evening but the breakfast was outstanding; I can't recall a more extensive choice at any previous hotel, whereas everything was fresh and attractively presented. Staff were friendly but never obtrusive. The hotel's location close to Freidrichstrasse is another aspect of its appeal. You are close to some 'must see' attractions as well as being handily placed for a selection of restuarants and bars. Quality shops are also nearby. Berlin's genuinely integrated public transport system must be among the best in the world; the hotel was close to the Stadtmitte underground station, giving us easy access to anywhere in the cityt-and beyond!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Dhalia85
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Mecure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie tremendously. It was extremely spacious and the breakfast was wonderful. Everyone was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for a Berlin stay.”
Reviews.Author: Hubert_Cumberdale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights. Check in was quick and efficient. The rooms were immaculate and comfortable. Breakfast was expensive but we made use of the kitchenette in the room. The fitness centre is small but very well equipped with a stunning subterranean lap pool and spa. The staff are very respectful and low key. The location is within walking distance to many attractions, although it can appear dreary and quiet. We felt safe at all times. Will stay again when I’m next in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: alexunia
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by room size, it's very spacy and comfortable. And I'm sure you'll be charming by the staff of the hotel. They are very kind, smiling and professional!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, comfortable with very professional & welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: paul1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights while in Berlin on business. Hotel easily deserves it's four stars with clean, well equipped and very comfortable rooms, quaint bar, restaurant and health club. Found the staff throughout the hotel to be very welcoming, courteous and professional, willing to help wherever possible and always greet you with a smile. Good location for us as we spent most of our time at Potsdamer Platz. Great value for a hotel of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, worthy of the high tripadvisor ranking”
Reviews.Author: MsPhileasFogg
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my mother to Berlin for the weekend. Upon arriving at the hotel they told us that they did not have the twin room that we had requested, however they had put us into a room that had two separate bedrooms, which suited us better. We chose the hotel based on the fact that it was top rated on tripadvisor at the time of booking and we did not regret our choice. We did feel conned over breakfast though - I couldn't remember if my booking and pre-paid rate included breakfast or not and I was assured by reception that it did. But when we came to check out we had been charged extra for it. We wouldn't have minded so much if we'd known and made the decision to eat there, but as it was we only grabbed a quick small snack before heading out for the day and the cost of the breakfast was overly expensive just for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & also got an upgrade!!”
Reviews.Author: emmaIre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and found it really good. On arrival we were given an upgrade to a suite which was a lovely touch :) the staff were very helpful with directions and anything else we asked. The sauna was of great benefit after a day in the snow and to have it there for free 24hrs is ideal. We didn't eat their breakfast as it was quite expensive - i think 15euro per person but there are plenty of nice bakerys around. The only thing I that may put me off staying there again is the area is very very quite – initially I thought it was a good thing as we slept great but there were no good bars around – suppose it depends what you’re looking for!!

Reviews.Title: “Got upgrade on room, great room, and very friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: stephan_b63
Reviews.Content: Although it was a very short stay, the welcome at the reception was great, in perfect english! Received an upgrade on the room

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tingweng
Reviews.Content: Since a lot ppl praise this hotel,overall I agree it's a good hotel. Let's talk about downsides. 1.The internet is not free in room. 2.The toiletries are not top-notch. Overall,it's very good.Few would regreat staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: bexstee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights over the weekend. I chose the hotel based on the reviews I had read here and was not dissappointed! On arrival we had been upgraded to the business suite free of charge! So much space! The hotel is very clean and the staff very helpful, all speaking English! We used the sauna facilty and this was great! Only downside is breakfast is quite pricey at 18Euro.. BUT it is very good quality with so much food to choose from. The location is really good. 5mins walk from Stadmitte U Bahn, but also possible to walk up to Unter den Linden and Brandenberg Gate. The hotel is located in a side street so very quiet. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine !”
Reviews.Author: Dan1950
Reviews.Content: Right in the Mitte of Berlin. Fine confort. very good food at room service. Only one complaint: Euronews is only in Italian :-) Dan Matei, Bucharest, Romania

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: scarlett345
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely delighted with our stay at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie. We had a 2 bedroom suite for our family and it was very comfortable and modern. The breakfast was served downstairs in the breakfast room and was extensive with choices for all tastes. The hotel is located near Checkpoint Charlie and most of the sites we wanted to visit were within easy walking distance. Taxis are plentiful and reasonably priced to take you anywhere you can't manage on foot. The service from all staff was excellent and there is free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “wunderbar”
Reviews.Author: gialb
Reviews.Content: near city centre,you can go out during the night without problem,near 2 undergroundstation. when we arrived the told us that we would have stay in a suite room,it was a fantastic surprise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Profesor57
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. People are really nice. And the room wzas huge. A wonderfull stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location , value for money, wonderful service....”
Reviews.Author: Linda019
Reviews.Content: arrived here on 29 December from Ostbahnhof by taxi for 9 euros and were upgraded to superior room free of charge. Hotel and room absolutely spotless and tastefully decorated with an eye for detail. Abundant and fresh breakfast with great variety, good coffee. Friendly and helpful staff. Buy Berlin Welcome Card at Ostbahnhof for the amount of hours you are planning to use public transportation (48 or 72) and it is just hop on- hop off, u-bahn of s-bahn or bus. The hotel is located on the Schutzenstrasse, just around the corner of Checkpoint Charlie and the Friedrichstrasse. Here you can also hop on the u-bahn (metro Stadtmitte) to the major sights of the city. Unter Den Linden, the Reichstag, Nickolaiviertel, Gedächtniskirche, Brandenburger Gate, the Kurfürstendam and Kaufhaus des Westens are just a few sights that can't be missed and that are very easily reached by public transportation. From the hotel to the metro station Stadtmitte is only a 10 minute walk. There is no restaurant in the hotel but you can order snacks like burgers with french fries and soups and spaghetti. There is a bar and in the lobby is a computer with free Internet. We enjoyed our stay very much and loved the New Year's Eve Party at the Brandenburger Gate.

Reviews.Title: “Its a very romantic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dobbelaar
Reviews.Content: Nice and perfect location nearby the highlights of Berlin. The hotel is situated in a small side street of the Friedrichstrasse very quiet no noise of traffic. The rooms of the apartment were very clean and the people/staff were very friendlyand helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: adimale
Reviews.Content: In strategic place to join Friedrich strasse for shopping, to the Museum Island, to the Brandeburg Door, to the DOM and especially to Check Point Charlie, a site to be seen to make everybody aware of what has been Communism!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: adamgarrison
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was great, as it is a very short walk to Checkpoint Charlie, and close to Brandenburg Gate and other tourist sites. Breakfast was good, although it is overpriced at 18 Euro. No one can eat 18 euro worth of food for breakfast. For 3 people, it was 54 euro which is about $77. Way too much money for breakfast. Bakeries are nearby if you want to save money. Overall, I would definitely stay here again as the price of our hotel room was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Tamoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights during our recent visit to Europe. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends back in New Zealand. The staff were friendly and our room was exceptionally clean and extremely spacious. Will definitely be staying there again if we were to visit Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for price, location and service”
Reviews.Author: poppypippin
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. We booked several months in advance and our room was around £70. The hotel is five minutes walk from a station and just 15 from the Reichstag/Brandenberg Gate. Our room on the 7th floor was spacious, spotless and perfectly comfortable. We stayed three nights. We don't normally use hotel bars but the small one there was nice and cosy and the staff excellent. We would stay here again and thoroughly recommend it, especially in December as the wonderful Gendarmenmarket is seconds away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anja_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel! Spacious rooms and nice interior. The location is alright, although not on a main street. Most sights are located within walking distance. I really liked it. Would nice to have Wifi in the rooms though..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - spacious and spotless!”
Reviews.Author: Ruinair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 4 nights. We booked a family room in advance. On arrival, we found a spotlessly clean hotel. Our room was the largest family room we have ever stayed in, more like an apartment! We didn't have breakfast included in the price, however, we paid extra for it on the morning of departure. The breakfast was quite expensive but worth it. There was plenty of choice with a lot of fresh produce as well as the traditional German cuisine. This hotel has a brilliant location too, just a short walk from Stadtmitte U-Bahn station as well as being only a few metres from the up market shopping street Friedrichstrasse. Berlin is an amazing city, so stay there in comfort at the Mercure!

Reviews.Title: “A very impressive hotel, offering a good location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: lindsayhead
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly large rooms, with a shower room separate to the WC. Extremely clean and modern, you will find the trail of the Berlin Wall just along the street, and Checkpoint Charlie just around the corner - a great place to base yourself for exploring the city. The staff were excellent - very friendly and helpful. There is internet access in reception. The cost of the hotel was reasonable, although breakfast expensive at €18 extra (however there was a good cafe right across the street)

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheSGB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for four nights in mid December 2009. I booked the hotel on the strength of so many positive reviews and wasn't disappointed. The hotel is perfectly situated in a quiet street close to the shops of Friedrichstrasse and the U-Bahn station Stadtmitte. The room was surprisingly spacious, spotlessly clean with a very comfortable bed and wet room-style shower. The staff were helpful but unobtrusive. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Calgarymember
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have vacationed in Europe for about a month a year for the past 5 years, having stayed in numerous hotels. We always use Trip Advisor as a critical input in choosing our hotels. We do not want hotels where a doorman holds the door, etc and bell-hops grab your backpack from your hands - we look for something more personal. We were not disappointed in having chosen this hotel for 4 nights in Oct 2009. The room was very well appointed, spotlessly clean and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. When I could not get my netbook to connect, the front desk staff had me bring it to them and explained the issue. Hint: if you are using your own portable, once you open the internet window, making the connection including entering the password, you then need to open your search engine in a second window while leaving the sign-in window open (i.e., minimized). The hotel location is great, around the corner from the former Checkpoint Charlie (which is still a huge tourist draw). While the physical hotel and the room is always very important to us, it is the attitude of the staff that distinguishes the really excellent from the average and this one is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Space!”
Reviews.Author: Zosterops
Reviews.Content: We were really surprised with how much space we had in this hotel. We have been travelling around Europe with three children, aged 10, 7 and 4 and we have become used to cramped rooms and often sharing a bed with the youngest. Not here. It was bliss...the children had a room to themselves,with the separate shower and bathroom between us and them. There was loads of room for everyone to remain squabble free. Everything was spotlessly clean and fresh, mint on the pillows, and incredibly quiet at night. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and there were vast choices at breakfast (traditional German cold meats, cheeses, breads, yoghurts, and cereals, toasts, eggs, hot dishes). Our only minor problem was that the breakfast room was overflowing on the Sunday morning, so we had to move out to the Marguis beer garten. This was OK, but we weren't forewarned that it was the smoking area. We really didn't enjoy eating breakfast with people smoking, and would have preferred to wait for another table. The location was good, a small block away from Checkpoint Charlie.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Olivier74
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Despite the fact that there is no restaurant, there is a small bar with wide opening hours. Room are spacious and clean. No noise in the neighborood. Breakfast buffet is offering a lot of choice and of high quality. Staff is serviceable and helpfull. There is a (very !) high speed WiFi connection available (€) A few step away from Checkpoint Charlie tourist hotspot, hotel is not far from main touristic and commercials. Subway station is also a few meters away. I had no negative feeling at all and no issue to point out. I left there a whole week. One of my best experience.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireFlax
Reviews.Content: Excellent service; huge rooms; everywhere spotless; breakfasts gargantuan!; everyone so friendly. Local area a bit run down, but was just over the wall in the East & looks to be up & coming. Good position to walk to most sights & Checkpoint Charlie literally round the corner. Most restaurants around seemed to be Italian, but so what? They were very good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid-range hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: climate_criminal
Reviews.Content: Went over for the 20 year celebrations of the fall of the Berlin wall and spent one night here. Extremely helpful and friendly staff who went out of their way to make sure everything went well for us. The room was very big, spotlessly clean, and quiet. Nothing fancy, and rather dull decor, but comortable. The beds were great! No bath, only a shower, which didn't bother me but might matter to some, and no tea or coffee facilities in the room which I did miss. The hotel breakfast was quite expensive so we went to a cafe just around the corner where we had excellent pastries and coffee for a fraction of the price. And I can't recommend the nearby Lungomare restaurant highly enough - truly excellent Italian food at incredibly reasonable prices. So all in all we were very happy with the Mercure. It was cheap for such a great room in a great location, the staff were excellent, and we very much enjoyed our stay. A few minor quibbles, and it's certainly nothing fancy, but as a solid mid-range hotel I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wizbud
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over the weekend before the 20th anniversary of the Wall coming down.Being so close to Checkpoint Charlie,the atmosphere in the area was great.It was close to a U Bahn and it was easy to walk to many of the sights.We used the hop on hopoff sightseeing buses (they can be caught just round the corner at Checkpoint Charlie) which gave a good overview of Berlin. The hotel itself was quiet and very comfortableand the staff were, without execption, extremely friendly and helpful.Wewere upgraded to an apartment which was very spacious,although,as one other reviewer said,one day we returned back at 4pm to find the room hadn't been serviced although when we then left at 6 and returned at 9 it had been done !!! We thought breakfast was a bit on the expensive side but the choice and quality were superb,we couldn't really complain. We would definitely stay here again. If you are celebrating,go to Le Entrecote (almost next door) for a meal....expensive but fantastic food.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent guest review”
Reviews.Author: leotrvlr
Reviews.Content: Our company has an office nearby and this is where I always stay. While I think Mercures can be hit or miss, this place is a hit. First, the staff is extremely welcoming and friendly. The hotel itself is modern and sparkling clean. The breakfast is very good. And I find this location to be very central to public transit as well as Checkpoint Charlie. I've been here about 8 times and am heading again next week and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Super!!”
Reviews.Author: HeidiNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Everything was super: the staff, de rooms, de cleanliness, the location, the service etc. We had a lovely stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngelinaCymru_Wales_
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. We choose this hotel after reading the many positive reviews on TA. We had an amazing apartment (only booked room). We were celebrating a special wedding anniversary and were left flowers and a heart shaped cake in the room. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was awesome! Hotel location good, away from the maddening crowds but close enough to many site seeing locations.Would recomend one of the many walking tours which begin near the Brandenberg Gate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ludvix
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and really enjoyed it. Our room was large, quiet and nicely equipped. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel's location is excellent, close to many interesting sites in Berlin. The only thing missing to perfection would be free wifi internet in rooms. We will likely return to this hotel next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: danstrips
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights online a few days prior to arriving in Berlin and we were not disappointed. We arrived a little earlier than expected and were given a room upgrade. The superior room was very spacious, clean and bright with a little balcony facing a beautiful courtyard. The room was exceptionally quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The location was excellent. Far enough away from the touristy strip yet close enough to walk to all the main attractions, restaurants and shopping streets. We decided not to pay for the breakfast at the hotel and there were plenty of options close by to choose from. The free internet on a PC in reception area was very handy. All reception staff were very friendly and helpful too. We had such a wonderful stay here and will certainly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NetherlandsSabine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable. In fact, that says it all. The hotel has no special charms really, but I had a large and very clean room with a large bathroom and wonderful breakfast, all at a very reasonable price. The only thing I didn't like is the cleaning policy. I stayed for four nights, and one day I arrived back at the hotel at 13.30, and another day at 16.00, and both times the room was being cleaned when I arrived. The staff were nice, polite, and apologetic, and explained that they didn't finish cleaning all the rooms untill 17.00, which I think is really a bit too late. On the day that I checked out though, I arrived back 11.15 or so (check out time is 12.00) and the room was allready cleaned, the beds newly made, etc. My suitcase was still in the room, so they must have realised the room wasn't vacated yet. I felt I could hardly use the bathroom or rest a little before leaving. But enough about that - all in all I can really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise, great value, very spacious room, very freindly.”
Reviews.Author: ThistleBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We arrived here after staying in two different tiny, expensive rooms in Denmark and were very pleasantly surprised by the warm welcome we recieved and enormous rooms we were given, the largest hotel room I've seen in 25 years of travel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect just a block or so away from the U2 and U6, you can get anywhere in the city in no time at all. There is also great shopping, sightseeing and neighbourhood restaurants within walking distance. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: prasan68
Reviews.Content: Had taken a two bedroom apt. and the hotel location was superb. Breakfast was good. Staff were helpful but mostly busy. Our three days just flew by. Rooms were very well kept though the TV is now dated. The apt had one shower and one separate toilet so it took four of us a while to get ready. Great value for money and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ScarletM
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site and were very impressed. We stayed 2 nights and it was a very good base to see all the sites of Berlin. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The staff were friendly and very helpful too. Would definitely recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, excellent service, very fare price”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer726
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel on the basis of reviews from Trip Advisor site. The reviews were accurate and reflected my experience on a recent 4 day stay in Berlin. The hotel is very modern inside behind a period fascade. The room we were given as a free upgrade was a large triple with a seating area. The location is great, two blocks from Checkpoint Charlie with dining alternatives for breakfast and dinner. There are Ubahn stations for the U2 and U6 lines that connect with all the common destinations in Berlin. The hotel service is superb and the room rates are very fare for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: francejulie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The rooms are very big, and when you stay one week long this is very useful and very nice. The service is excellent, they always find a solution and are more than helpful, smiling, and nice. I traveled with 25 customers who were very pleased with this hotel also and will probably come back if they have the chance. I would definitely recommend it for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyinPhoenix
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem. We were greeted warmly and treated this way throughout our stay. We had many questions and the staff always helped in any way they could. The location was convenient for sightseeing. The rooms were impeccably clean and quiet. The breakfast was a treat we looked forward to each day. Internet was priced separately but that seems to be the norm. Loved this place and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: kwendy88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and it was a great location and walkable to all the major sites...we like to walk a lot! The hotel was clean, quiet and fairly roomy. Our room price was very reasonable considering the rooms. We didn't get breakfast thrown in or anything but that was fine with us. There were plenty of cafe's and restaurants to go to nearby. There was one computer in the lobby where you could surf the internet for free and if you brought your own computer, the wifi was free in the lobby but not in your room.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: officematt
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, very spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was quite big and the shower was just perfect. The breakfast buffet was the best one I have seen in quite some time with something for everyone. If and when I go back to Berlin, I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a hop, skip and a jump away from the action!”
Reviews.Author: maryk27
Reviews.Content: A good friend and I enjoyed our stay at the Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie around Memorial Day 2009. The hotel is nothing if not "hip" and we appreciated that. The rooms are trendy/functional and breakfasts are a generous combination of more-than-breakfast foods. This is not 'your mother's breakfast buffet'. Everyone on staff was pleasant helpful when queried for area information. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay. great location for attractions”
Reviews.Author: stevetptoronto
Reviews.Content: really good hotel to stay at. big modern rooms. great location to visit attractions. one thing to remember is to check if the buffet breakfast is included. If not you will be charged 20 euros per person for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly luxury. Great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Myrtlebush
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its central location and good write up, and we were not disappointed. It is within easy walking distance of all the sights in the Mitte area, but also in a pleasantly quiet street. We booked privelege rooms which are bigger with some extra facilities, and were very comfortable. The breakfast buffet had an amazing choice of food, stayed open nice and late for holiday makers, and was well staffed so everything was quickly replenished. The little Tratoria on the corner opposite the front of the hotel serves great pasta, in a very friendly atmosphere. Out and about, we enjoyed a train trip (bargain) to Potsdam to see the Sanssouci palace and gardens. Great day out. In town, we took in a excellent orchestral concert in the Konzerthaus, what a fabulous building! An unexpected treat was the river walkways beside the Spree. All in all, a great city to visit, and we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant base for a visit to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandCreature
Reviews.Content: My room was a nice surprise -- large, pleasant, and bright, looking out onto a leafy courtyard. For 101 euros per night in Stadtmitte (through Venere.com) I had not expected anything so comfortable. The room had a largish (for a hotel room) desk with a lamp and a good chair, two armchairs, and a small balcony. There was a separate dressing alcove with a closet and a laptop-sized safe, and a WC separate from the bathroom. There was no clock or coffee-maker. There was only one maintenance issue: for a reason I can't figure out, the door lock is baulky, and locking it always requires several attempts. The hotel is situated on a quiet street in what seems to be the therapeutic massage district, a few minutes walk from Stadtmitte and Kochstrasse U-bahn stations. It's very close to Checkpoint Charlie and Gendarmenmarkt, and an easy walking distance to many other tourist points. The breakfast buffet was good and offered a broad selection. Internet was 7.95 euros for 24 hours, which is cheap by local standards. The desk staff generally tried to be helpful, though their advice was not always 100% accurate.

Reviews.Title: “A place to return to”
Reviews.Author: Blank001
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, in a block designed by Aldo Rossi, very friendly staff. In the center of the city but nonetheless in a quiet street, even when you have a room at the front side. If I have to be critical it would be the bathroom. It is not designed very well, it is small, not very luxury and not very well lighted.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as we anticipated”
Reviews.Author: randchome
Reviews.Content: Booked the cheapest option the hotel offered. Good pleasant service, great breakfasts. Clean room, handy to the sights - good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly place to stay with large bright room!”
Reviews.Author: cdeldeo4
Reviews.Content: Since we were staying eight days in Berlin, and we don't like to move around, we picked the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie from the internet site. It was a wonderful location with hair salon next door as well as Thai and Japanese message. Very good French restaurant one block away. The hotel service was excellent with friendly helpful people everywhere. Our room was light yellow with high ceilings, large room with desk, TV, eating area, small kitchen area, nice bathroom with tub and large windows. We had a wondeful time in Berlin and believe staying at the Mercure enhanced this travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot for first time visitor”
Reviews.Author: TartanLad48
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected by our son for us, he had traveled to Berlin several times and thought it an ideal location to explore the city from. The staff were excellent and friendly and the location ideal. Many restaurants nearby and great access for U Bahn.
