Our room was upgraded on arrival and I realise this was lucky it was a great surprise. Berlin is a huge City and there is no one ideal spot to be located but I would say this area is as close as you will get. I have stayed in Mercure hotels before and have always found them clean, efficient and friendly, and most of all great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreFahey
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with nice, friendly, helpful staff. It is ideally placed for sightseeing, shopping and restaurants. The cleanliness of the room and facilities in the room were also very good.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful days”
Reviews.Author: Renateluzia11
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent two wonderful days at the hotel. The whole staff was very nice to us and always willing to lend a helping hand. The room we had was well decorated, spacious and provided all the comforts one could need. The breakfast buffet included a wide variety, ranging from a common selection of fruits to the typical german "wurst". Being located in Berlin's center means that it is near many of the famous tourist attractions, making it possible to walk from the hotel to them in no time. Also the street where the hotel is located is very calm making it ideal for a good night's sleep. The nearest underground station "Kochstrasse" is no more than five minutes walking from the hotel. I would definitely recommend anyone staying at the Mercure Hotel & Residenz Checkpoint Charlie if they choose to visit berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenatHastings
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears out of the way, but is very close to several underground stations, so this did not cause any problem at all as everything within reach. Checking in was quick and the service polite and efficient. We actually checked in several hours early, but our room was ready and they were happy to let us in. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet. Only criticism is that our bed was two singles pushed together. Cannot comment on the food as did not eat there. Did have several coffees in the bar area during the evening. The atmosphere there was pleasant and the service again was excellent. We actually breakfasted at the Aroma Cafe at the end of the road - coffee and croissant was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “By far, the best hotel we've stayed in while in Europe.”
Reviews.Author: sodakmn
Reviews.Content: My daughter traveled with my husband and I, and we all were happy with the stay there. The rooms were very clean and beautiful. We were thrilled with the balcony which was a big surprise to us when we saw that we had one. The staff went overboard to help us find taxi's, hold our luggage while we went sight seeing before we left and were all very courteous. Close to everything we wanted to see. I would definately recommend staying there to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: cc3333
Reviews.Content: This quick three night stay was made less stressful by the considerate and good service by the staff at the Mercure. Brilliantly clean room and lovely helpful service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - poor service”
Reviews.Author: MnOslo
Reviews.Content: Positive: good location, clean rooms Negative: had booked no-smoking room and got a smokers room that they could not change for me. WiFi was not free. Roomkeeping left window open during the day. Roomkeeping knocking at my door at 7am when I had not ordered any wake-up calls or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every respect...”
Reviews.Author: tolayawearyhead
Reviews.Content: During August I stayed first at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie for 7 nights, and then moved to the Berlin Hilton for the last 3 nights. So a comparison may be in order. They are seven minutes walk away from each other - Checkpoint Charlie to the Gendarmenmarkt. Both are excellent central places to stay with convenient U2 and U6 S-Bahn at hand. Halfway between the hotels lies a good and well-stocked supermarket (Kaisers at north side Friedrichstrasse 60). The Mercure was a very welcoming hotel (and my warmest thanks to Liese and her colleagues for making it so). I had an internal room onto the treed rectangular courtyard; very quiet, with a pleasant balcony. The move to employ an Italian architect of note to design this hotel has certainly paid off: this was one of the most memorable hotel rooms I have ever stayed in, so beautifully thought out, spacious, relaxing, and just totally right in every respect. And unlike the usual cramped shower, the wet room was all a shower space should be. But the Mercure chain does need to think hard about not providing what is now taken for granted: bath-towels (necessary after an evening shower), toiletries (of which no shampoo, nothing), and bottles of mineral water. And the old TVs, which need upgrading, detract from the overall experience. I cannot comment on the food as I did not pay for breakfast, and cannot say that I found anywhere handy for it. As already mentioned in these Trip Reports, the computer at the ready in the foyer in a dedicated area was great to use and invaluable. To summarise: a great hotel in which to feel at home. The Berlin Hilton was similarly welcoming, and my warm thanks to Marieka and Rebecca for making my arrival and departure so pleasant. This hotel has a great setting onto the square, the perfect place to sit in the evening. I had breakfast in the hotel: attractive room (one area looks through onto the Square) with attentive and pleasant service; the food offered a wide, if not inspired, choice and made a satisfactory start to the day. Rooms can often mean a quite long walk. Compact and well-designed, I again had a quiet room looking onto a central courtyard with vegetable beds and glasshouses growing food for the hotel. Good modern bathroom with a proper bath, well equipped with toiletries and bathrobes. But not a room to linger in and read like the Mercure. The lack of a computer for general use has already been mentioned by others: this is a serious omission for travellers today (we don't all have laptops with us!). To sum up: better location than the Mercure but with a less enjoyable room. To eat: I ate several times at each of the following: Lungomare trattoria bar (Spaghetti puttanesca - excellent); Malatesta caffe ristorante (Pappadelle al funghi - excellent); Maothai aka Sisaket thai restaurant Mauerstrasse 76 (good lunch offers, overpriced in the evenings and empty). The two Italian are between the Mercure and the Hilton and reasonably priced. Guidebooks: if you take no other get Berlin (Everyman MapGuides) from Amazon. Brilliant! Pergamon: arrive by 9.30am unless you want to join a long queue (no pressure at the other galleries)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, staff, and service.”
Reviews.Author: Jazzbo88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie for 21 days while visiting family in Berlin. The hotel could not have been a better choice. The room was perfect. The location was perfect. The staff was outstanding...24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great room”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Residenz is on a quiet street a few hundred meters from the famous Checkpoint Charlie and is also a quick walk from the Stadtmitte U-bahn station. Check-in was a breeze. The helpful desk agent accompanied me to my room to make sure I could find it and to show me how everything worked. I was in the "Residenz" building, 2 doors down from the main hotel lobby. This meant that my room was larger, but also meant that internet connectivity was non-existent. Wireless internet was available, however, in the lobby. The room was very large - please see pictures - and very clean. The bed was large, but not as comfortable as I would have liked. The two pillows were thin and unsupportive. Overall, the staff was fantastic - they were always eager to please and more than happy to help me, despite the fact that I couldn't speak German very well at all. The breakfast was hot, tasty, and well-serviced. The fitness center consists of a pair of cardio machines and a few weightlifting machines. There is also a sauna area and tanning bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family room”
Reviews.Author: MPO64
Reviews.Content: Very nice and luxurious double bed room, excellent for a family with kids. Highly recommended. Central position in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, friendly staff... we would recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: shazp32
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for five nights at the end of august, hotel did not disappoint with a relaxed atmosphere and a spacious bedroom. we requsted a double bed as most doubles in germany are two singles pushed together.. this was not a problem.it was in a great location and not far from all methods of transport. we bought a five day pass-welcome card at the airport which means you can get on buses,trams,underground etc any time... as often as you like, also if you show this at any of the attractions metioned in the welcome book you get some money off tickets... places include zoo, boat trips,palace, cathedrals, tv tower etc...staff were extremely friendly... booking early morning (5am!!)taxi for transport to airport on our last day. only thing was lack of english speaking channels on tv provided, it had a mini bar... although you can pick up beer etc in one of the shops around for a fraction of the price(kaisers to name one) although as we didnt include breakfast in price at 18 euro fridge came in handy to put breakfast supplies in for the mornings!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family hotel - Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: DubaiSameer
Reviews.Content: The Mercure is an excellent hotel in a fantastic location - just metres away from Checkpoint Charlie and the main shopping areas in Berlin. But that is not the only reason that it is ranked so high in Tripadvisor. The rooms are large and clean and the staff is very helpful - more than happy to guide you on the places to visit, things to see and how to get there. Would definitely stay there again when we visit Berlin next.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and tidy, within easy access of the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: maruse
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, only there were no shower caps for women, and we would have like the cafeteria to be open at breakfast time. We never have breakfast, just a cup of coffee. The rest was perfect, I guess one of the best places to stay in Berlin. we'll surely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and position”
Reviews.Author: GianlucaPItaly
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was very confortable, rooms were very large with balcony. We were there with our dog (big dog, Berner mountain dog) and everything was just perfect. The position is great just few meters from the Check point Charlie. Just a nice walk to the center. I left my car in the garage of the hotel (confortable too) for the whole period of my staying. Also some restaurant are just very close to the hotel. Internet cost was reasonable for the room connection, in the lobby it was free.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Dodgychris
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel many months ago but on arrival were met by the Office Assistant who explained that they had not been able to collect the money or contact us and that they had no rooms available for the first night of three - that was the bad news. However, they had arranged, at the same bargain rate as the time we booked, a night in a comparable 4* hotel (which was fine), a complimentary taxi ride to get there and a choice of returning to this hotel or staying at the alternative. We returned because of its location and were given an upgrade to a suite type room. For a problem that was, to be fair, mostly ours, the hotel could not have been more helpful - a superb example of customer care. The location is great for sightseeing with a U-Bahn station round the corner and it's on a quiet street. The room was very good although beginning to get to a point where redecoration might be required - a minor point. All the staff were so helpful and friendly and particularly Thorsten who did such a good job of working around the problem. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: neilmac1971
Reviews.Content: Impossible to fault anything about this hotel. I travel a lot in Europe and stay in all types of hotels but this has definitely been one of the best. On arrival I was greeted by friendly and helpful staff and was advised that my room had been upgraded from a "Superior room" to an "Appartment". This was a surprise to say the least and a fantastic size room with its own lounge, kitchen, 2 bathrooms, breakout area with desk, balcony with table and chairs and king-size bed. Excellent facilities at the hotel - wi-fi was available in the room for 7 Euros a day or you could use the computer in the reception area for free. Breakfast was included in my deal so not sure how much it would have been seperately but its buffet style and you can choose from cereal, yoghurts, fruit, bread, cold meats, jams, scrambled egg, bacon, sausage, pancakes and so much more. Hotel was very clean, TV in the bar, I ate in the restaurant only twice during my stay and the food was of good quality and very reasonably priced for a hotel. The location of the hotel is also one of it's important features as it is right in the middle of the city, the nearest underground station is Stadtmitte which translates to "middle of the city"! its on the U2 line which runs central through the city from the Olympic Stadium right across Potsdamer Platz and over to Alexanderplatz and beyond. Perfect in every way and would go back to Berlin tomorrow, and certainly use this hotel for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: rttraveller
Reviews.Content: large rooms, very good furniture, quiet, excellent service, central location to touristic features, short walk to subway, free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “real good”
Reviews.Author: azzurraG11
Reviews.Content: good location, kind staff, very clean... and an amazing Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: AmericanInHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel conveniently located to tourist sites and UBahn. Terrific breakfast included and clean, basic rooms. Very quiet neighborhood at night. Everything closed around 8pm. We especially want to thank Daniela at the front desk for being such a big help. Got a great "Sommer" deal by doing a bank transfer instead of a credit card. Saved about euro 356 for a week's stay on 2 rooms over any other price on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...great breakfast...excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: DivePenny
Reviews.Content: Visited with a friend and her 13 year old son recently and found both the accomodations and the staff outstanding. I usuall y stay at top five star hotels, and this came close in every way. EXCELLENT location for a tourist. Walking distance to may sights including the Jewish Museum, the Gropius, and Gedarmenmart [sp?] as well as Checkpoint Charlie. Close to a very convenient U Bahn stop....a short direct ride to KaDeWe and a walking distance to Gallerie Lafayette. While the rooms are not overly stylish, they are very clean and comfortable. We stayed in a suite with and adjoining LARGE room which I highly recommend for a family group. This is not a hotel with excelptional charm or character, but it is certainly a very comfortable place to stay if you are sighseeing or visiting friends in Berlin. Be sure to book with included breakfast. It is worth every Euro....and more. The food is top quality and the variety unending. Many nights we skipped dinner because we'd eaten our fill in the morning. The staff all speak excellent English and are very helpful. In particular, we want to thank Danielle, who treated us as though we were family who'd come to see her. Don't let the value price fool you. This hotel is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: phoenixflyers
Reviews.Content: Modern comfortable hotel in a great area of Berlin. Clean comfortable room with a/c; loads of space; helpful staff. hotel is a short walk from two different u-bahn stations, a number of restaurants, and many of the historical sights. Great location - great experience. First time in Berlin - we may return and will likely stay at the Mercure again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in the middle of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: heidihamburg
Reviews.Content: Hotel in the centre of Berlin, calm, romantic garden - near Unter den Linden, Friedrichstraße and a few minutes walk to the underground station Stadtmitte, good service, good bedding, we'll come back next year...

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Pablo-Q8-AR
Reviews.Content: I spent three days with my wife and two children at Mercure Check Point Charlie, the hotel is beatiful, we stayed in a superior room which was really confortable. The staff is very kind and helpfull. It is well located to visit WWII historical places and near magnificent Unter Der Linden and Friedrichstrasse. Due to the short time of our stay we couldn't enjoy all hotel amenities but definitely I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mingei
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mercure hotel for 3 days and it was a great experience. The staff was helpful and polite. The hotel was very quite. The room was big and very clean. Excellent!.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: xochitl
Reviews.Content: Based on the good reviews on this forum I made a reservation on this hotel. When making my reservation, I got a reply offering a week night for Euro 99 instead of the 139 they were originally quoting me. I took the offer, but what a surprise upon arrival, I had been booked at their hotel located 20 Underground stations away from CPC. Good news : Free car parking Good News : The Underground station is next to the hotel. Bad News : The Underground ticket for the day is almost Eu 7 per person Bad News : Wi-fi in the lobby not working, if you wanted in your room pay extra Eu 9 Bad News : TV only in German, except CNN. Only one pay movie for Eu 13, and I had already seen it. Bad News : Breakfast costs Eu18 ! Bad News : Isolated hotel, no other place for dinner nor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Simply great !”
Reviews.Author: tiger01m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days and everything was simply great ! We got a beautiful room with an additional bed for our 2 years old child, thanks to very nice front desk lady Liesa, breakfast was excellent, location was excellent, everything was excellent ! Looking forward to return in the future !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, more than lived up to our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: WOWGordon
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful staff, great location ,(only a few minutes from Stadtmitte underground and the historic 'Checkpoint Charlie'') and fantastic breakfast. Small but good sauna - let the reception know before you want to use it and they'll turn it on for you and lend you bath robe and slippers. Room very comfortable and modern, great night's sleep and very spacious. A great base for exploring Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “just excellent”
Reviews.Author: i_aprilius
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. I don't know if I was upgraded to a better room but it was a very nice room. Spacious most of all with every kind of amenity I might needed, overlooking at the terrace at the back. Excellent neighborhood, quiet but still colse to the centre and the U-Bahn station. The personnel was excellent too, very friendly, polite and helpful with a genuine smile on their face. The only matter needed to be solved is the access of Wi-fi at the rooms which is not always working. It is working perfectly in the lobby though if you can carry your laptop there. Excellent hotel in overall, will definately come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: WiseOwl45
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in July with our teenage son. On arrival we were upgraded, which was a very nice surprise! The staff were very friendly and helpful. We have stayed in lots of hotels in other cities and would have to say that this was one of the best - could'nt fault it at all! The rooms were comfortable, spacious and quiet. The location was perfect - most sites were within walking distance. Would definetly stay here again when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: thefishermans
Reviews.Content: As far as the location is concerned, Berlin is massive, so it depends what part you want to see. We wanted to be by the 'Checkpoint Charlie' area, so we selected a hotel by it. Therefore, the location is excellent! The hotel staff were extrememly helpful and friendly. Our room was great (we had a free upgrade to a junior sweet!). The sauna and fitness areas are small, but we used them and they were a nice bonus. Berlin is one of the best cities we've been to and we recommend it and this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for visit to Berlin...great price, location, and staff!”
Reviews.Author: OCTrippers
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie and loved it. Because of the length of our stay, we were upgraded to an amazing apartment right next door to the hotel. It felt like we were actually living in Berlin. The staff is beyond nice...they work long hours, are always cheerful, and unbelievably helpful. We got tips on where to hear music and where to relax within the busy city. The breakfast is pricey, but there are a number of good coffee shops near by that serve a relatively inexpensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Super friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: PatAntwerp
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Excellent location and super friendly staff. So: thanks to all, over there. Regards, Patrick

Reviews.Title: “Ripped me OFF!!! GO ELSEWHERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bignellie
Reviews.Content: I had to cancel the day before my 5 night stay due to my pregnant wifes medical emergency and they still charged me for the entire week!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalvadorDave
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for all the sights in central Berlin and in particular it's great for shopping on Freidrichstratze. The hotel is smart, clean and pleasant. The room was a good size and had TV, minibar, hairdrier, shower, desk easy chair and good storage. My room had a single bed but came with a large sun terrace with chairs to sit out an enjoy the sunshine (weather not guarenteed!!). All the staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. The hotel was great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Happyaussie24
Reviews.Content: We have a 15 year old so the two-bedroomed suite suited us perfectly; it was two good-sized bedrooms with a shared bathroom. We had just come from four weeks of staying in apartments around Europe so we missed having a lounge area too but for the price, we can't complain. Not much personality but clean and comfortable, and well located, being two minutes from Checkpoint Charlie. Staff are very helpful. We did a Fat Tire bike tour - five hours riding around the Third Reich sites, which our teenager loved and which was very informative. Lungomare Italian restaurant nearby is good family fare, and if you want to splash out a bit, we recommend the French restaurant on the same street as the Mercure. The beergarden at Tiergarden has good hearty food but can get crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to See Why This Place is Berlin's #1!”
Reviews.Author: bluesteve71
Reviews.Content: Excellent friendly service from reception & bar staff. Always willing to help with directions, local info etc. Room was clean, bright, comfy & HUGE! Good location, just around the corner from the wall, & right by Checkpoint Charlie (as you would expect!) 2 mins from the U-Bahn, & easy walking distance to the main attractions (Brandeburg Gate, Reichstag, Potsdamer Platz, museums, restaurants etc). Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VaniaBrazil
Reviews.Content: I loved our staying at Mercure Berlin Checkpoint Charlie. Good location, great staff, very comfortable room, excellent breakfast! My son and I loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: bilo61
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights last week. We found it very clean, comfortable and staffed with friendly people. Our room was not what I had booked, but it was very large, sunny and had a big balcony overlooking the courtyard. I didn't realize this until our 3rd night and when I mentioned it at the front desk, we were offered another room (told it would be smaller), and the hassle of moving from an essentially comfortable room was too much. It would have been nice to have the bathtub and separate bed referenced in our original booking, but whatever... We did have a small kitchenette area w/microwave, cooktop and fridge, which we made use of. There were no plates or utensils, but that didn't make any difference to us. If you plan on actually using the kitchenette for a longer stay, bear the lack of cookware/dinnerware in mind. There was a kettle for making tea, which was very nice to have. Our room was on the eighth floor and the sauna was right next door. This was very convenient and we used the sauna several times. What was not convenient is that the elevator only goes to the seventh floor. If you have trouble walking, ask for a room on a lower floor. It was not a problem for us, except on departure when we had to lug our suitcases down two flights of stairs at 6am. I'm afraid we made a great deal of noise, but the suitcases were bulky and the stairs made of marble. We couldn't avoid making a racket. The layout of our room was odd. There was a shower/sink room close to the sleeping area and the toilet/sink part of the bath was at the entry door, quite far away from the bed. Again, we were puzzled, but whatever... The air conditioning was excellent, the room was very spacious and had 4 HUGE walk out windows to the balcony and we were generally pretty happy with our experience. The room was very quiet and we particularly enjoyed being able to sit outside in the evenings watching Berlin's Die Welt tethered balloon ride go up and down in the sunset. It was very relaxing. What was really alarming, especially as two women on their own, was the disregard housekeeping had for the custom of knocking, or even announcing their entry into our room. This happened multiple times. One evening, a man carrying a clipboard came into our room completely unannounced, asking if everything was in order. We were shocked and frankly, frightened. We had been watching television, right near the door to our suite, and had not heard a knock or anything until he stood before us. I found that unacceptable and from that time on, placed a chair under the door handle. There was no interior door latch. Other than that, it's a nice hotel, clean and well located. We ordered room service breakfast one morning and the Continental basket lasted us for three days. Very generous portions! There is free internet access in the lobby and the staff was accommodating when it came to printing our boarding passes for our flight home. Just bear in mind you will have to climb stairs if you are on the 8th floor and that you must be careful to barricade your door if you are concerned about privacy/security. We got a pretty good rate, but it would have been better if breakfast was included. My only real issue was security when it came to housekeeping's unannounced visits and I would not recommend it to friends solely for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, let down a bit by the WiFi”
Reviews.Author: OFVCAT
Reviews.Content: The highlight was the breakfast buffet which was varied and tasty and could set you up nicely for the day. The WiFi didn’t work for us and there wasn’t a lot of help forthcoming. It seemed a bit hit and miss. We had a great room and the service was fine. A light bulb was missing but the lady was soon up with a replacement together with proper English tea and a kettle. The people were very friendly and I would recommend it heartily to people not reliant on the Internet. To be fair the access was fine from the hotel’s own machine in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Reebi
Reviews.Content: From the minute you walk in the door you are made to feel so welcome and the staff could not be friendlier or more helpful - we have just returned from 5 days stay in Berlin and it was certainly made more special by the staff at Mercure Hotel. The location is great for sightseeing - Checkpoint Charlie is on the doorstep with heaps of information about the wall and the impact it had. It's also within walking distance of many other attractions that are on a must see list if you are a tourist to Berlin. The tube is nearby too either Stadmitte or Kochstrasse. The rooms are very spacious, comfortable and clean. Also as it is in Germany you will not get drink making facilities in the room and if you want a cuddle with your partner you have to leap the great divide - yes it's that German thing of 2 single beds making up a very large double. But the beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms have air conditioning. The wine garden in the courtyard is a relaxing place to sit with an excellent and reasonably priced glass of wine. Breakfast is very good with plenty of choice - things do run out sometimes but the staff are more than happy to replenish anything you wish for. A couple of things that may not be obvious (to us at least) if you want to use the sauna you need to ask reception to turn it on and they will also give you oil for the sauna and bath robes. The toiletries in the room are limited but again if you ask at reception they will happily supply what you need. If you are in the sauna and fitness room check out the sun terrace. This is a four star hotel but has five star plus service.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Berlin? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Jimmal-151
Reviews.Content: Apologies in advance as this is a bit long! Have just returned from short Berlin break. Went to see U2 play and get an idea of what Berlin is like. What can I say, the city is a great place to visit, we will return and when we do we will stay at "Checkpoint Charlie" again. We arrived at Tegal at 10:00 and took a taxi to the Hotel for the cost of €20 for a 30 minute trip taking us past the Victory Angel, the Brandenburg Gate and Potsdamer Platz so a nice mini-tour thrown in. We got to the Hotel expecting to drop off our luggage as check-in was stated at 15:00; however we were warmly welcomed and informed that our room was ready and checked in on the spot. The room was a "standard" but if you moved it to a London based hotel then it would have been classed as at least a "superior". Entry was into a nice sized hallway with a good size bathroom to the left and a generously proportioned room to the right. His and Hers wardrobe with an additional set of 3-drawers with a further 2 sets of cabinets either side of the bed meant that you had adequate space for clothing even if you were on a two-week stay. The wardrobe contains a safe so money is relatively safe and the mini-bar is well stocked so you have something to spend it on. The rest of the hotel is equally pleasing being light and airy in design, the foyer has a number of comfortable chairs and tables spaced around and leads into a separate bar area. The bar area is slightly smaller than it appears in the pictures but this only lends to a nice cosy atmosphere. The staff came across as genuinely friendly and interested in talking to us, when checking in I asked regarding the U-line to the Olympic Stadium and I was immediately engaged in a conversation on were we going to see U2 and had we seen them before etc... My wife had also found information on the revolving restaurant at the top of the TV tower in Alexanderplatz and we asked if they could make a reservation there. We were initially disappointed when the receptionist was told there was a 3-week waiting list, however her colleague suggested to her to ask the hotels concierge to assist; the next morning we were advised the reservation was made. Now they may not be able to do this for every restaurant in town but it was appreciated and the meal and views were excellent. I will close (finally) by agreeing with the comments regarding the hotels location; it really is within walking distance of a number of places to visit. Checkpoint Charlie itself is literally around the corner, left out of the hotel and first right takes you to Gendarmenmarkt (look up to the right for the winged Pegasus on the top of the hall). A 30 minute walk taking in Bebel Platz along the way gets you to Alexanderplatz; the Brandenburg Tor is maybe 35 minutes at a leisurely pace along Unter den Linden. If you are looking for an excellently located hotel with friendly staff that also offers value for money then Charlie is your man.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for your stay in Berling”
Reviews.Author: janstrOslo
Reviews.Content: Value for Money! This is the perfect hotel for your stay in Berlin. The location is perfect regarding all the "must see".

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: willip
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel on a 3 night break to relax and do some shopping. We are very familiar with the city and many of its hotels. We hold Accor A-Club Platinum membership. Check in is at 3pm. Our flight from London arrived two hours before and we went to the hotel, checked in, left our luggage and went out for lunch awaiting a call to say that the room was ready. No call came so we returned at 3pm and found that the room was still not available. The receptionist directed us to the bar but there was no offer of any complimentary refreshment to compensate for the delay to the room. Eventually, at 4.20pm, and without assistance with luggage, we were given the room key. We had written confirmation of our reservation details which was for a smoking suite. We found ourselves in a non-smoking family room with a put-me-up type single bed in the lounge. A call was made to reception and a manager duly arrived. We had already been informed by reception that all rooms were full. On arrival and having failed to persuade us that this was anything other than a normal family room and not what we'd booked she offered to try and "see what can be done." A short time later she returned and showed us to another room (so it wasn't actually full) and to our dismay the alternative was even smaller than the last and still had the family room trappings including a put-me-up bed. It had the additional unwelcome feature of a toilet with a very noisy flush about 1.5 metres from the bed. We declined this room also and returned to the former to await a solution. We had both decided that if the hotel couldn't provide accomadation confirmed by them in writing then we were going to leave. About 1 hour into this pantomime we were eventually shown to one of the duplex apartments in the Residenz part of the hotel. It had a terrace where we could smoke and fitted the description of the suite promised. The manager was concerned that during our initial wait we had been left to fend for ourselves on the refreshment front and provided us with two vouchers each redeemable at the bar for "any drink of our choice." It was a gesture we appreciated notwithstanding the delay. The accomodation was fine and the beds were surprisingly comfortable to the extent that both of us experienced the best of restful sleep in many months. Our time in Berlin was busy and we ate only breakfast in the hotel. This can be described as plentiful and of adequate quality. The main problem is that the dining room is clearly not big enough to cope with all guests when the hotel is busy. We dislike being kept waiting for a table and being shown to tables before the mess of the preceeding guests has been cleared. There was also a noise problem in that the hotel seems to try and be something that it is'nt with scaffolding and rigging gangs running around the place trying to set up foir some sort of show or exhibition when guests are trying to relax in the bar or looking for a space to eat breakfast. On our final day we decided to use our vouchers for a drink before going out to dinner in a nearby restaurant. We ordered a Bacardi with diet coke and a Brandy with diet coke. When the bill arrived the vouchers were taken in payment but we were asked to pay for 1 of the diet cokes as the hotel considered Bacardi with coke as 1 drink but a brandy with coke as 2 drinks! We were dumbfounded but paid for the coke that came for the brandy as we had had enough of this place, it's attitude to guests (even those who have been messed around and disappointed), and its less than acceptable standards. We have no clue as to the type of guests this place either caters for or wants to attract, but on our experience if you want a trouble free stay where you are provided with what you confirmed in your booking then you need to give this place a miss. Not recommended in any way - I'm sure you can get much better at a far cheaper rate and come away smiling.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: therealirishgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a city break recently and was most impressed - a huge room which was well equipped and very quiet with a lovely balcony; the hotel was stylish and very clean with attentive staff and an excellent location,close to U-Bahn stations. I booked this hotel based on it's favourable reviews and I wasn't disappointed, it certainly lived up to expectations! I would highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: OzChards
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade to an apartment so was very spacious and just what we needed to relax in. Right next to Checkpoint Charlie and the shopping area so very handy. Whilst a chaim hotel it was very cozy and welcoming. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “LOACTION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: belof
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous stay here in April. There were 16 of us in total celebrating a birthday. The hotel was really easy to get to by train from the airport and is in a perfect location.ALL the rooms we had were very spacious and clean. They had a very cute little garden where you can sit out and enjoy a few drinks. The weather was really hot! (End of April) Breakfast was buffet style and delicious. The staff were so so friendly and helpful. We took a sight seeing tour for 3 hours which was a great way to see the city as it is so beautiful. Would definately reccomend this hotel for its wonderful staff and great location

Reviews.Title: “Deserves it's high rating”
Reviews.Author: minniemoo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Mercure twice; once last June and again this year. The location is perfect, close to Checkpoint Charlie and 5 minutes walk from Stadtmitte. The reception staff are pleasant and polite and the rooms large and very clean. The beds are so comfortable. We chose to have breakfast, mainly because my son loved it last year, so I couldnt say no! The array of foods is excellent and like everything else in the Mercure is very good quality. The hotel even booked us our tickets for the Blue Man Group which was a godsend as I was unable to book online as there was no English option. I love the city of Berlin and this hotel is perfect for a short city break. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch! Surpassed expectations!”
Reviews.Author: DK5
Reviews.Content: We traveled in a group of 11 - 4 adults and 7 children ranging from 8 years to 16 years old. I booked the hotel based on reviews I found on this web site. I was offered a "special rate" that included breakfast and after checking around, found that it was a great value! We booked 3 family rooms and boy were they big. You will not find dinky European rooms here, these are big and open. The kids were thrilled to flit between rooms and the breakfast was fantastic. The staff treated us very well, we were not complainers and had no problems, they were eager to assist us with a sight seeing plan, train info and dinner reservations at a good German restaurant. The location was perfect. I would certainly stay there again and recommend it to ALL.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CJTF
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, spacious, and an easy walk to East and West Berlin Tourist attractions. The lobby was decorated in a funky, boutique style. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Not a luxurious hotel, but a very good value for the price tag. Parking available below the hotel for a reasonable fee (on-street parking was available as well). Shopping and several cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, nice hotel, nice courtyard”
Reviews.Author: family-man1000
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the large room which faced a quiet and peaceful courtyard. The room had everything, a real nice desk which is perfect for working, comfortable beds, very clean. The only drawback was that the toilet is separate from the shower and located at the entrance to the room. Also they left a bottle of water which I drank and paid 3.20 Euro for--a lot of money for water. But I would go back if in Berlin. Very nice people at reception. Nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Pity we couldn't stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: groobster
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Checkpoint Charlie. The hotel is well positioned, just a short walk from the U-Bahn, and about a 15 minute walk from the S-Bahn stations. In a quiet part of Berlin, but within easy walking distance of the sites - Checkpoint, Brandenburg etc Do to a booking error I ended up staying in one of the Residenz rooms - what a bonus! So much room, so comfortable as well. If I have the pleasure of visiting Berlin again I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Devotees
Reviews.Content: We had a very good time in this hotel. Very helpful staff, nice silent room (very comfortable beds), huge breakfast ! Didn't have enough time to try sauna and fitness...we'll be back. Location good, in the center of Berlin. Exactly what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “well deserved top rating”
Reviews.Author: bridgerobe
Reviews.Content: Ups: - big, well appointed room. All the hotel is new anyway - top position kind of in between everything. Close to U-Bahn and the most elegant area of Berlin (Gendarmenmarkt) - staff kind - very very quiet - the hotel and I guess all the rooms Downs: - the toilet is just OK - it doesn't come cheap - and breakfast is 18 euro each. If you are willing to spend a bit more remember that Berlin is plenty of 5 stars hotel and they are very competitive. For a little more you get much more. In the area looked very nice the Hilton, the Sofitel, the Regint and above all the Hotel de Rome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4* in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Curvealert
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel three times and have never been disappointed. The location is central enough to reach the main sights on foot within a 15-20 minute walk, and convenient for trips to the Ku'Damm, Kreuzburg or Charlottenburg. The rooms are not what I would call beautiful - they are typical 4* functional, but the hotel is in a quiet location, the rooms are huge, even the standard ones, and the quality of furnishings and cleanliness is excellent. My boyfriend loves the walk in shower! Service was also of a high standard and we were always acknowledged on entrance and exit from the hotel - in how many places can you say this happens? Minor criticisms - €3.20 for a bottle of water is insane! There is a Spar supermarket around the corner on Charlottenstrasse. Also the price for breakfast is on the steep side, considering Berlin is a city where very good breakfasts are easy to obtain for a much cheaper price. If you want the convenience of room service, €18 is OK, but I would go for a little walk and pay what Germans pay for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great value, fast and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Shebbie68
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed. We got the two bedroom suite. It was the large, and probably the best hotel of the ones we visited this trip. The staff was very accomodating. The breakfast is on the expensive side, but I enjoyed it tremendously. It is within walking distance of a lot of the sites you will want to see. Not to mention, it was a great value for the money. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience in a legendary place”
Reviews.Author: travelend
Reviews.Content: Willingness to service and to make visitor feel welcomed by the hotel's staff

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly and welcoming, convenient location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: LondonBdb
Reviews.Content: My son and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotels friendly staff made us feel welcome and were always helpfull. The breakfasts are fantastic, just what we needed to start each days sightseeing. Great location meant that most of the main attractions were within walking distance. Will not hesitate to recommend to anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_8Perth
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and were lucky enough to be upgraded to one of the suites. The room was huge with a balcony and small kitchenette. Breakfast was excellent! Lots of choices an everything was fresh. The staff were excellent...went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed - they even escorted us to the the lifts when we checked in and gave a tour of the hotel on the way. And you get a hello and a smile from every staff member as you walk through the hotel. Excellent location - only a very short walk to many sights in Berlin. We were at the end of a 2 week tour of Europe and this was by far the best hotel we stayed in. Would definitely stay again when in Berlin and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Kasch
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights and were very happy with the location, comfort of the very large room and the extremely friendly and helpful staff. Even though the hotel is only 3 blocks from the underground station Stadtmitte, it was also extraordinarily quiet. The only sound was the twittering of birds in the courtyard in the early morning. The toilet and shower are separated, which is practical. Mattress very comfortable. I have never seen a hotel room with so many electrical outlets! We were aware that someone had really thought the furnishings through. My only criticism was the light in the bathroom - terrible for putting on makeup! But there was a large magnifying mirror (which worked for at least half of your face, since the light was coming from one side only) and a good hair dryer. Breakfast buffet was very good with variations each day, which is nice for a longer stay. Plenty of fresh fruit, different cold cuts, meats, cheeses, smoked salmon, fresh vegies, hot dishes, breads, condiments, yogurts and cereals - just a wide selection of everything you're likely to want to eat for breakfast and of good quality (the jam is not in little packages(!) and there are 3 or 4 different kinds of honey), not to forget freshly squeezed orange juice. They also have so-called Privileged Rooms, which apparently include a coffee-maker (which would have been nice to have in the standard rooms) as well as suites with kitchenette. There are no restaurants in the hotel - only breakfast is served and small snacks in the bar. The bar has a very nice heated patio area in the courtyard for sipping a glass of wine. But there are plenty of good restaurants within easy reach. The Vietnamese "Rice & Roll" on the corner is an excellent choice for weekday lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, comfortable and great value - will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: MarieGlasgow
Reviews.Content: The staff dealt wonderfully with a minor booking difficulty we had on their management website. Their email response was personal, prompt, efficient and helpful. We therefore arrived in the hotel confident that the staff would be very professional. This was indeed the case, from the moment we checked in until we left three days later. The accommodation is very relaxing and comfortable. The room had a larger than normal seating area which made it feel like a mini apartment, rather than just another hotel bedroom. Great mattress! It was unseasonably warm when we were there in late May but the room temperature was perfect. We loved the french doors opening onto the balcony which overlooked the quiet wine garden area. The room was light and airy but was also sufficiently dark for a great night's sleep. We booked on an internet deal which included breakfast - one of the best hotel breakfasts we've ever had! Fresh breads, pastries, cereals, fruits, yoghurts, cold meats, cheeses, hot sausages, omelettes, eggs, fruit juices, tea, coffee...a terrific selection of tasty, fresh stuff! Although in a quiet street, the hotel was in a very central location. Because of the lovely weather we did a lot of walking around the city and nowhere seemed too far. Best of all, we were within only a few minutes walk of restaurants and bars for going out in the evening. The hotel made a great trip to Berlin a really great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wundervahr! Thorsten, Lea, Daniela, Nichole and co-workers were warm and helpful in every way. FIVE STARS! Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SnoTiger
Reviews.Content: The room was one of biggest and most beautiful we've stayed in...with a balcony over the courtyard and enormous windows. Location is first rate, pick a direction and you are blocks from everything but the Zoo and KuFuDam. Potsdammerplatz, Sony Center and Kulturalforum (und Tiergarten) to the northwest. The Brandenberg Tor, Unter den LInden, Museum Island to the north. Alexanderplatz and the Tower to the northeast. Checkpoint Charlie a block away. It's all close enough to walk! Marvelous! The staff was amazing. I tend to treat everyone as my concierge, and all were helpful, efficient and personable in every way. I've never been treated better at any hotel in 25 countires. Mercure Checkpoint Charlie...I can offer no higher recomendation. We would consider another trip to Berlin just to stay here...it's that good! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Aggressive Cleaning Staff”
Reviews.Author: OliveBinItaly
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and nice hotel with a very friendly staff and in a great location in Berlin. My one complaint is that the Do Not Disturb tag on the door does not seem to mean I'm All Set Today, Come Back Tomorrow, it apparently translates to please come back and knock on my door and/or call me on the phone with the awful ring. That would be my one complaint about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate ! It is very nice !”
Reviews.Author: Islakoul12
Reviews.Content: People very kind and pro Room, bar of the hotel very nice Hotel closed to different others restaurants and bar

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: lashedout
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel. The check in was very fast and friendly. We were informed that somebody would escort us to our "very special" room, which I found intriguing. We got a room in the 8th floor of the building; the elevator goes only up to the 7th floor, so it was slightly difficult to find the room, hence the need for somebody to accompany us. Although I was a bit concerned about where we were being taken (since this was the first time somebody had to escort us to our room in a hotel), when we finally got to our room I was gladly impressed. It was huge, with a separate living room area and a huge bathroom. We had the spa and sauna in the same floor. There are only two rooms there so it was very very quiet. Breakfast was wonderful with a great variety of things to select from. Internet access was free of charge in the lobby. The location of the hotel was just great. We arrived to the central train station and took a taxi to the hotel for 10 euro. We could have taken the subway which is 2 blocks away from the hotel, but we didn't want to carry our luggage. Check point Charlie is two blocks away from the hotel. We walked to the Brandenburg gate which took about 20 or 30 minutes, but it was through a very nice shopping area so definitely I would recommend to do this at least once. I can't emphasize enough how friendly all the hotel staff were to us. Check in and check out was very expedite, they were happy to describe us different things to do and see in Berlin, etc. In summary, an excellent hotel with excellent staff and facilities at a right price. We are looking forward to coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a good price”
Reviews.Author: forbesrw
Reviews.Content: I was unfortunately not able to enjoy the hotel to it's fullest, and I regret that. Breakfast was great for someone in my position (short on time). the hotel was in an excellent location. Few mins walk to most major venues and close to both U-bahn and S-bahn. The weather was great so even in my free time I tended to walk around a lot. Rooms were birght and airy and in furnished in a contemporary way. Time and the weather prevented me from really enjoying the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really great”
Reviews.Author: alff2000
Reviews.Content: Very good location, close to main shopping street and main sightseeings of cold war. But it's far from cheap restaurant. Sauna works 24 hours. We had superior room. Room was good with complimentary coffee, but only for 1 person. There were 3d bed in our room, it was situated in very convinient way. Bathroom has only shower, not very big. The breakfast is great. There are also a restaurant in the garden, it was good. No free internet. There were only 1 nightlife pub near - Newton pub, the hotel is far from common nightlife. But in comparison with other Berlin hotels this hotel has the best combination of price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Modern, great location and well priced”
Reviews.Author: willdc1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights mid-week in May 2009 on holiday and booked the hotel via the website hotels.com (via Quidco to get cashback). I booked the hotel off the back of the great reviews on tripadvisor. Hotel The hotel is ultra modern and easy to find. I took the train from Schoenefeld Airport to Berlin city centre. To get to the hotel from the airport, get the train from the airport to Friedrichstrasse, and then get the subway from there to Kochstrasse. To get to the hotel from Kochstrasse, walk out of the subway towards the crossroads at Checkpoint Charlie and then take the next road to the right after the crossroads, keep on walking and hotel will be on your right. Simple and only a few minutes walk from the Underground. If you want to buy a day ticket for the Berlin transport network, the hotel sells them. Just make sure you get the ticket stamped at one of the stations before you travel to validate it. The hotel reception will be able to give you a free streetmap. There is computer with free internet usage in the lobby. Location The location is brilliant and very central. It’s round the corner from Checkpoint Charlie, the shops on Friedrichstrasse, and about a 15 minute stroll to Unter den Linden, so within walking distance to all the main sights. Yet the road that the hotel is on is very quiet with a lovely quiet garden at the back where you can have a drink. That’s what is so great about this hotel - so close to everything but yet so quiet. Check-in The check-in was efficient - no queue - and we were given a credit card style ‘key’ for the room. You need the card to activate the room lights and aircon. Price The room price was £84 per night without breakfast. Breakfast was extra and very expensive (18 Euros per person), so instead we decided to go the supermarket in the subway at Friedrichstrasse or to a bakery call Kamps, near to Checkpoint Charlie to buy a couple of croissants and a coffee. Room The room (number 520) was facing the back and so quiet. Couldn’t hear anything outside or anything from next door /above - excellent sound insulation. It had air conditioning which was silent and very effective - very welcome when it’s hot outside as I can’t sleep well in a hot room. The room was huge with 2 really comfy big beds pushed together with 2 separate duvets - really comfortable beds and a refreshing change from the small ‘double’ beds often found in hotels - and there was also a single bed at the other end of the room. There was also a large desk with a TV on it (English speaking channels were BBC and CNN), plenty of cupboard space (one cupboard included an electronic safe) and there was lots of room for luggage. The toilet was separate to the shower room (no bath) which was a nice layout rather than toilet and shower. The only slight negative was that there were no tea/coffee making facilities, (but there was a minibar) but drinks (tea, coffee, alcohol etc.) were easily available from the bar downstairs near reception. There was a large bottle of water on the desk in the room, but beware – it cost 3,20 Euros. We thought it was complimentary, as we failed to notice the price tag round the neck of the bottle until we’d started drinking it! Meals The hotel has a bar and also a breakfast room, but as I didn’t eat/drink there I’m unable to comment on the food. Summary To summarise, it’s a modern, immaculate, well priced hotel in an excellent location, with friendly staff, and I would thoroughly recommend staying there. It was perfect for us as we wanted somewhere convenient, quiet, clean and had a good shower and air conditioning. The hotel didn’t have a gym or swimming pool, but as we were mostly out and about it didn’t matter. This hotel hit the spot - the only improvements I can think of would be to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room, and the breakfast to be very much cheaper. A great hotel in a fabulous city. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: jayseetoo
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent a weekend here and it was really quite wonderful. There were no twin rooms available when we tried to book ( why would we choose anything other than the top rated hotel in Berlin on tripadvisor?) but on looking at the hotel pictures we realised that there were 2 beds in the rooms anyway with separate duvets so we went for it. The room was much bigger than any I have stayed in in a city hotel lately with a clear bed and sitting area divided by a table with TV and seats ( should you want to eat in). There was a toilet and separate wetroom. We also had a balcony which looked out onto the lovely courtyard. Checkpoint Charlie itself (or what remains of it) is on the corner of the street the hotel is on. Walk right up Friedrichstrasse from there and 15 minutes later you are at the magnificent Brandengberg Gate and Reichstag. We used the underground and S-bahn system for the areas further afield . Costs 6.10 Euros for an all day ticket - great value ( 2.10 euros for a one journey ticket). The Statdmitte U-bahn station is only minutes away from the hotel. There is so much to do in Berlin I hope to visit again soon and I will definitely stay at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: drdka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel just for one night but it was great and relaxing stay. The stuff is extremey friendly and helpful. I also used the room service and enjoyed great tuna salad in my room. The room was really spacy and clean and very quiet but without some specific or unforgivable atmosphere. The location was very conveniet, just few steps from Check Point Charlie and Friedrichstrasse full of shops and restaurants. I would recommend this hotel and for sure come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: World-Traveller58
Reviews.Content: Used Tripadvisor to identify hotel. Having read the reviews, decided to book a suite for three. Despite continual glitches with an independent minded electronic room key, finally got access to the room, which while not quite what I expected worked out perfectly for us. We had a large double bedroom, and the additional bed had been put in the 'living room' (which was about half the size of the double bedroom). The staff could not have been more helpful, guiding us to a local bakery where we chose breakfast breads one morning (they then comped us butter, jam and silverware because they felt we should not eat dry bread). They also recommended terrific restaurants. And the price was definitely right. If you are looking for an affordable but good quality place to stay in Berlin Mitte, you would be hard pressed to do better than this. Easy 10 minute walk to Checkpoint Charlie; 15-20 minute walk to Unter den Linden. The front desk will call you a cab, if you prefer, which in our case turned up 3 minues later as promised.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrdChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights via their online advertised "Romance Package". It was a GREAT top floor suite with roses, wine and dessert included in the room. Breakfast for two in the restaurant on the 1st floor was also included, and all this for less than what a "standard" room without these amenities was going for. Exceptionally clean and very quiet room, great spread for breakfast and VERY FRIENDLY staff. Location is around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie and lots of shopping. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location!”
Reviews.Author: ms_ekay
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel and were really impressed with it. The rooms are nice and clean, modern. Location is a couple minutes walk from Checkpoint Charlie and close to the main sights in Berlin. It was extremely convenient. Breakfast was nice, but a bit on the expensive side (18 euro pp). We had one day with breakfast included but other 2 nights we paid. There was a nice selection for breakfast though and very satisfying. I cannot fault it and our stay was really enjoyable. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Celticjo58
Reviews.Content: I just want to add my voice to the many others congratulating the Mercure. Everything about this hotel is top notch. I have stayed in both the Ritz Carlton and Westin Grand previously but now use the Mercure out of choice. Staff are excellent. I also recelthy used it for a business meeting and everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Michal12
Reviews.Content: I've been to many places in Europe, I've stayed in many hotels of various chains, standars or whatever. Out of all 4 stars hotels I've ever stayed in, this one is absolutely no 1! Friendly atmosfere, no fake smiles from the members of the staff, everyone willing to help and being active. Fantastic breakfast, very good wine, nice room with a cosy balcony. Plus it's in the very centre of the city, plus it's located on a quiet street, so no noise at night. As for bad points about the hotel - I have none. -)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: josullivan33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the Easter weekend at The Mercure. The welcome on arrival was much appreciated and we found all the staff to be very pleasant and helpful - particularly the girls working in the bar. The area is quiet but its not far by foot to Unter Den Linden, and the Stadmitte U-Bahn is 5 minutes away. It was our first time in Berlin and we want to revisit sometime - and would definitely stay here again. The walking tour of Berlin is a must - and we enjoyed meals and beer in the Oranienburgerstrasse area and also in Prenzlaurberg. Berlin is a fascinating city with lots of interesting places to see.......but can be eerily quiet at night. Where are all the pubs??!! There is a good Bavarian type beerhall nearby serving excellent beer and good pork dishes. Its called Maximillians - on a corner of Friedrichstrasse.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTourist
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at Mercure Checkpoint Charlie Berlin. We booked through the website and got a good price for our stay including breakfast for 2 days (should have checked more carefully when booking as I presumed it was for the 3 days!). Our room was very large, comfortable and clean with a seating area and separate WC and shower room. The staff we met were all friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in a quiet street not far from Stad Mitte U Bahn station which was great for getting around the city. Breakfast was excellent with a huge selection of hot and cold buffet items. There is no way it is worth 18 euros per person. Overall I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone and would advise to check breakfast is included for your entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Service !!!!”
Reviews.Author: DutchiesNetherlands
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, and our Border Collie - Scamp stayed at the hotel for a night while sightseeing in Berlin. The service was excellent and the hotel staff were very professional, caring and welcoming. Our dog scamp was very pampered with his own hotel dog biscuits and "champagne" (water with some parsley in a nice bowl) :-). Nothing was too much trouble and we had a relaxing stay. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: loosehead1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from 20th April, the hotel is in a great location, within walking distance from all the sights in Mitte. The Stadt mitte and kochstrabe metro stops are within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. The rooms are very big and spacious. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. They kindly provided gluten free bread for my wife (she is a coeliac) at breakfast, at no extra cost!. The breakfast was included in our package, and there was a great choice available, hot and cold dishes, cereals, jams, cheeses and a wide variety of breads. We made use of the free internet in the lobby, it was handy for researching our tour of Berlin. There is a Spar shop north of the hotel on krausenstrasse, and a kaiser supermarket on leipziger strabe for essentials, water etc,. We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice big room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HerniaBay
Reviews.Content: located on a very quiet street almost on top of Checkpoint Charlie. Lovely room - lots of space and very clean. Two things could be improved - Breakfast was pricey (you can eat much more cheaply in local brasseries) but the selection of food was good. Internet access was only free for one day which always irritates me - why not just charge the rate for the room & accept that internet access is included for the entire stay? Overall, a great hotel for our purposes and we would book again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JPD74
Reviews.Content: If you want a good location, a good breakfast and a good nights sleep. Well you don't need to look any further than this hotel. It's as simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific central hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotbeare15
Reviews.Content: My partner & I have just taken my Dad here as his 80th birthday present. The hotel was spotless with huge rooms and friendly helpful staff. Nothing was too much trouble and the courtyard garden was a very nice place to sit and escape the heat (Ice coffees were wonderful!) The hotel has a great central location just yards from the Ubahn & Check Point Charlie. Whilst the breakfast looked great £18 per person is just too much. About 50 yards away is a cafe/bakery selling lots of rolls, cakes etc all made freshly and at a fraction of the price. A few doors away is an excellant Italian restaurant - great food and lots of it. There was also a noodle bar, a french style steak-frites type of restaurant within yards of the hotel. For German food try the Lowenbrau brewery restaurant which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with all of the amenities that you should want!”
Reviews.Author: ScratchBostonMA
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful stay at your hotel. Everything was first class, clean, and attractive. Our 2 room suite was spacious and confortable. We lacked for nothing. Also, the free internet service in the lobby was extremely helpful to us, not only for rebooking our flights, but to check out places of interest for us there in Berlin. The only suggestion my wife and I would like to make is to make your pillows much more firm than what they are. We felt that the pillows were much too soft with no real support for our head and neck. Again thank you for welcoming my family at your hotel and when we return to Germany, we will certainly look for a Mercure Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted....”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a four day visit to Berlin and it was great. We spent the whole day out exploring,possibly back for a quick afternoon snooze and then back for the night at 11pm. The welcome was so friendly and didn't fade during the stay.The room (suite?) was huge,clean and quiet. The buffet breakfast was excellent, expansive and set one up for the day. We had booked with breakfast included, but otherwise might have gulped at the price and eaten elsewhere. The location is perfect--U-Bahn a few minutes away,with restaurants within walking distance.. We would stay here again without bothering to look elsewhere. PLUS--location,clean/modern/big rooms,so friendly/helpful,excellent(pricey?) breakfast MINUS--it's part of a chain, so lacks character.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fleet06
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend at this hotel and would have no problem recommending it. Staff are very friendly and will help you any way they can. Rooms are large, very clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a great location just a few mintues walk from train station and many tourist attractions. The breakfast in the hotel was excellent and served until 11.30.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: smc4312
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie Hotel. The staff at the hotel were so friendly which made our staff all the more comfortable. In particular we would like to thank Steffi, Dana and Cony for their excellent service during our stay. The hotel was clean and modern, with spacious rooms. The breakfast included in the rate every morning was excellent, serving anything you might like. The Hotel itself was very central to good shopping, tourist attractions (Brandenburg gate) and Berlin's top class Train network. We would highly recommend staying at this hotel to our friends and family next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel and the staff really makes it work”
Reviews.Author: whitehairindian
Reviews.Content: I arrived a bit early but was given my room straight away. Reception asked me whether I'd like a smoking of non-smoking room. I'm not too fussy about that, but since there was a choice I asked for a non-smoking room. The room however smelled lightly of stale cigarette smoke and had an ashtray + matches on the table. Asked about that in the reception while getting directions going out. They told me that the room is indeed non-smoking and the presence of an ashtray is a mystery and they would remove it. I simply ignored the matter. The room was very nice and spacious. I worked, took a stroll downtown, did some shopping, ate a small supper at a nearby little Italian café that the reception guy recommended and gave me a discount coupon for. Food was ok and reasonably priced. I was very tired from the week behind me and still had work ahead and an early meeting which was really important for me, so I looked forward to a quiet night, took a good hot shower and went to bed ridiculously early. At first I thought somebody had the tv on a little loud, then I thought, no, there's definitely a party at a nearby room. Laughter, music - sometimes very quiet, getting louder at times. Went to inspect and sure enough, my room - or my bed corner - was literally wrapped around the wine garden in the back yard and the cute litlle jukebox they have in the bar. The jukebox was about 3 meters from my ear and the canvas roof of the wine garden started right from my window. Went to reception, told them of the irritation, asked if they would have earplugs. They didn't have any but were very responsive. There were two people behind the desk, the guy called the bar asking them to play the music softer. In a while the lady then offered to move me into another room. I packed in two minutes and called downstairs and a member of the staff was upstairs in 30 seconds. I was taken to a two-floor apartment complete with a kitchen downstairs and a bedroom + a nice bathroom with a good tub upstairs. It being in the top floor it was like I was transported above the clouds way above any human sounds. Anything can happen, but a hotel or any other business can be judged by the reaction to the unexpected. I am a light sleeper and should remember to bring my earplugs. I do not expect Berlin to sleep as early as I wanted to, but the staff seemed to genuinely care about me as their guest and they were very polite and friendly while taking care of the matter. The light smell of smoke in my initial room might be explained by the fact that the window gets all the smoke from the wine garden. Having lived in Germany before I don't think I would have noticed it then, but if you come from the strict Scandinavian non-smoking "ordnung" that I live in nowadays, you notice. The location is good. I had meetings all over central Berlin and walked everywhere. I love it when you can do that. The hotel breakfast was nothing you haven't seen before as such, but very good. I'm ready to sing a song for the coffee - hot, strong but smooth. I only stayed two nights and was too busy (or sleeping...) to really use any amenities or see a lot of sights, but the sights are right under your nose here and Unter den Linden is a short walk away. I saw a lot our tourists from all over the world coming and going and the hotel staff seems to speak at least very good English and French. These people have a good property in their hands and they make it work. It's not posh or ritzy, but it is very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kzmanfre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It is in a good location in a peaceful, broad street. It is only 10mins walking distance to the centre (Friedrichstrasse/Unter den Linden/Potsdamer Platz) and also near the U-bahn (Stadtmitte). The rooms and wc/shower facilities are wide, and everything is very new and clean. Quiet rooms with no hint of noise from outside or from other rooms. The reception staff is very friendly and helpful. Thanks to this hotel, me and my family had a nice holiday in Berlin. I would recommend this hotel to any family traveling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: NixiPlonk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. It is in a perfect location in a peaceful, broad street but within 10mins walking distance to the centre (Friedrichstrasse/Unter den Linden/Potsdamer Platz) and also near the U-bahn (Stadtmitte). Compared to other European city-centre hotels the room and wc/shower facilities are enormous, and everything is very new and clean. Many of the rooms have a balcony overlooking the quiet courtyard. Breakfast is a little expensive as it is not included in standard room rate, but if you can get an all-inclusive special deal, take it - the choice of food is great, the quality is very good and the breakfast room is very comfortable. However there lots of other cafes/restaurants nearby if you don't. There is also a good 7/11 a block away if you need to buy snacks, water etc.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GoFarAway
Reviews.Content: I was unsure if this was the right hotel for us when we booked, but it couldn't have been better. The room was spotless, the people on the desk gracious and knowledgeable and the location quiet yet just three blocks from the subway, reasonable walking distance to museums and close to many good restaurants. In fact, we were very pleased with being close to Checkpoint Charlie and near many of the city's cultural activities. We were upgraded to a junior suite, contemporary and spacious, and helped with reservations to nice eating places. When we needed a taxi, the staff would have one there within a couple of minutes. They helped us find a laundromat to clean our 10-days worth of clothes and pointed us to good places to shop for specific items for which we were looking. It offered a terrific breakfast each day and free Internet in the lobby. An excellent hotel with excellent staff!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Mercure!”
Reviews.Author: brodai
Reviews.Content: Do not hasitate to ask about anything: the stuff is ready for you at any time of the day! Great breakfast. Prices are very reasonable - rooms are very nice and cleen. Free Internet at the Loby. and also Free use of the sauna and bath towels. The manager was very helpful and recommended about great restaurants in the area. Public transportation nearby, easy to walk to major tourist attraction in mitte. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very central”
Reviews.Author: PaulKensingtonLondon
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, rooms very big and staff very helpful. Quiet room with no hint of noise from outside or from other rooms. Breakfast is geat, lots of choice and staff have coffee ready for you as soon as you ask. Note; if you want to beat the queue for the Reichstag Dome and the T.V. Tower book a tour....We waited 2 hours for the dome and that was arriving early in the morning... Also free internet at reception with a printer if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Orderly”
Reviews.Author: 67bevil
Reviews.Content: Very clean and sterile hotel. Staff was VERY helpful, especially the morning guy. Ladies are attractive and helpful. They will tell you where to go and what to see. If you are going to get sick in Europe, this is the place to stay. Very clean and the service is excellent. The internet problems were troublesome but other than that, the stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location. Very nice place. Comfortable, good beds. Large American sized rooms. Electronic key and electronic safe (no handing your key to the front desk every time you walk out). We skipped the breakfast (it was 18 euros!) and walked to the cafes & bakeries down the street for coffee & pastries. All in all a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, helpful staff and a great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: cpobyrne
Reviews.Content: Exceeded all our expectations. In such a central location I thought we would get a very small room for this price...but the room was enormous with separate shower and toilet areas. We had a balcony. The area was quiet at night despite being so central.
