My only complaint is that we ordered dinner one evening and were told that it would take an hour to prepare (we went somewhere else instead). But in fairness they were very busy at the time and they are not really geared up to do extensive evening meals. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and knowledgable about the area. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to recommend”
Reviews.Author: PKBp
Reviews.Content: This hotel made an excellent impression on us. The location is great, the atmosphere of the hotel is warm and friendly. The staff was extremely nice and helpful throughout our stay, from welcome till check out. The rooms are very quiet, and more spacious than the average. The breakfast offer is wide, and even there were a lot of guests, we always found clean table. It was a very pleasant stay and I think above all, the great advantage of this hotel is its client oriented staff.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant-the place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LondonBrook
Reviews.Content: So central and yet such a peaceful hotel. The rooms are spacious and very clean. All the staff are friendly and cannot do enough for you (in their eyes). Do not look at any other hotel in Berlin this is the one to stay at for value etc etc etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families!”
Reviews.Author: Celc
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a great hotel for a family with 2 kids, 10 and 12. The hotel room was spacious, the service friendly and helpful, and the location ideal. I would recommend this hotel to any family traveling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Ruth123
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as a result of the reviews on Tripadvisor and was again delighted that I had. It is very easy to access from the Schonfield Airport, though the local metro station has a lot of exits, some closer than others. Round the corner from Checkpoint Charlie, it is a modern business style hotel. The room service, though not extensive, is excellent value. There is a lovely Italian Restaurant locally The Lungmare Trattoria - we ate there twice in three days. There was limited availability of reasonable restaurants that suited teenagers so we were happy to find this. The junior suite had 2 good size bedrooms and was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ln9tjb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on recommendations made here at Trip Advisor and am very happy to confirm that they were true! This is a very good hotel indeed. Hotel service was very friendly, efficient and faultless. Front desk was especially good, arranging a lovely night out for us at the Berlin Philharmonic. All the staff in the hotel seemed happy and made us feel welcome. The double room was large, clean, modern with a powerful shower. Hotel was ideally located if you are interested in seeing Checkpoint Charlie and the other major central sites of Berlin. We did however think that there was not a profusion of places to eat nearby. We paid for the weekend package including the buffet breakfast - which had plenty of choice, from multiple choices of bread and rolls, cereals, cakes, bacon, eggs, jams even spring rolls and bio-yogurt drinks. The dining room was quite classy with quiet classical music playing in the background - provided a perfect start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for price”
Reviews.Author: oldpapi
Reviews.Content: This must rate as one of the best hotels I've stayed in. For a very reasonable price I had a huge room, very good breakfast and pleasant, friendly service. I wish there were more hotels like this one. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: dubally
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 2 night stay in the Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie and would definitely recommend it. We had a large double suite with separate bathroom - very large, bath plus shower, under floor heating - and separate toilet. The two double rooms were very spacious and perfect for 4 adults. The decor is basic and functional but we were really impressed by the cleaniness of the whole hotel. Staff were friendly and the food was good. The buffet breakfast is a little pricey at 18 euro but the selection was great so if you like to fill up in the mornings then it is well worth the price! They also serve breakfast until 11.30 am at weekends. The location was really good too. Just minutes from checkpoint charlie. We were able to walk to many of the sights within 30 mins (Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Jewish Memorial, Berliner Dom) and took a bus tour from outside the checkpoint charlie haus museum which covered other areas of the city. I would

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Central location”
Reviews.Author: SteveSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last week and were very pleased with the roominess and cleanliness. Well located near Checkpoint Charlie and subway stops. Also within blocks of Unter din linden which we walked to several times. Value for hotel is good. Breakfast is definitely overpriced at about 13 Euros per person with the selection of food being very limited. I'd skip that. Other than the breakfast, everything else was great. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: shazross
Reviews.Content: The room were very spacious and bathrooms had heated towel racks and heated floor. Room service food simple but vey good value. They even do a takeaway lunch pack for 3.5 Euro of roll, drink and piece of fruit. Location was excellent just on the old east/west Berlin border around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie. Recommend the Checkpoint Charlie Haus for great exhibits and information about escapes and the cold war. Don't bother though with the 18 Euro breakfast unless you are happy to pay that as there are plenty of cheap breakfast deals at coffee shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: packerbacker04
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that this hotel showed up at the top one in all of Berlin. I stayed there in January. I did find the room spacious, and the staff was fine. But I also thought that it was a little tired. Although I explicitly requested a non-smoking room, it still smelled of smoke. They charge for everything like internet (many places in Berlin now charge nothing for wireless). I also thought the breakfast was expensive for what one got. So...I would stay again if others were full, but I would not go out of my way. The location is also a bit out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfying”
Reviews.Author: miratouzo
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel 4 days. We book a regular room, and we have been upgraded to a very big room (separated toilet facilities, desk, mini-lounge). The room was simply decorated but very clean. The bathroom was also big. The hotel is very well located, at 100m from Check Point Charlie, and Freiderich Strasse. The breakfast is very impressive. We really enjoy our stay at this hotel. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: CCTinker
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic and the staff were very friendly and helpful. They helped us with all enquiries including dinner reservations. We had an amazing apartment in the Residenz part of the hotel. It was a two storey apartment for the standard rate so ask at time of booking if one available. It had a small kitchenette, living room and toilet downstairs. Upstairs a spacious bedroom and bathroom. The decor was modern and welcoming. It felt like a home away from home and nice & spacious. There is a fitness room and sauna in the hotel which was nice. The only downside was that we paid for breakfast in advance for 18Euros each which was very expensive. There was a hot buffet but the food was not to our taste (overcooked and greasy). For such a price we would have expected hot food to order. I'd advice not to have breakfast and buy your own to have in room or go to one of the many places in Checkpoint Charlie. There is no restaurant in the evening but they do snacks at the bar, same for room service and there is a nice reception/lounge area for drinks/reading books. Otherwise great value and a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Comfortable Rooms and a Lively Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: ATLJazzFan
Reviews.Content: - Accomodations: Room was spacious and comfortable, and we loved sitting on the balcony that overlooked the courtyard (where they even had a band playing one afternoon). All the basic amenities, but it was too expensive to use the wireless internet service (used to it being free most of the time in the US!). - Location: Excellent, we walked to sights such as Reichstag, Brandenburg Tor, Potsdamer Platz, etc., and there's an U-Bahn station a block away were it was easy to catch a train to anywhere else we wanted to go in the city. - Value: We found a good rate on the internet that was better than those at comparable hotels, but it didn't include breakfast. The price to add breakfast was astronomical, and extra services such as internet use was also very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay at Mercure Checkpoint Charlie”
Reviews.Author: HelianaCalmon
Reviews.Content: As we had no good tips of hotels in Berlin ,we choose this hotel by the Trip Adisor reviews and photos,and definitely it worths all compliments. We made the reservations online,and our check in at the hotel was almost ready when we arrived so we had the room key on our hands in less than 5 minutes.The reception staff is young and very kind. Our Family Room had 2 huge and separate rooms (for 2 adults and 2 teenagers)and was really big and comfortable,.The location of the hotel is amazing , and walking distance to all the best historic sites (Checkpoint Charlie,Mauermuseum and even walk to the Museum Island and Postdamer Platz is not so far!) .Gendarmenmarket area offers excellent restaurants that are kept open until late at night. Friederichstrasse is also a very nice shopping street wich is very close, with beautiful shops,including Galeries Lafayette. We also got the breakfast offer at the internet ,and it really made all the difference, first because it was very cold in the morning to search for a breakfast spot out of the hotel, and secondly because the breakfast buffet is almost a brunch! We will definitely choose Mercure Hotel&Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie on our next stay in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: TreacleMusic
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights with a package that included breakfast and what a great choice there is for breakfast! The room was spotless and spacious. Most of the sights we went to were all in walking distance and the U-bahn is not far away if you need to travel further afield. We had snow every day, but there was always a warm welcome from the staff and a warm cosy room to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice”
Reviews.Author: Darnok
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at Mercure Check Point Charlie and frankly I must say that it's almost the best choice in Berlin. Price, quality, location, staff: overall superb. The location is in Mitte neighbourhood, just in the heart of Berlin and walking distance to major sights and attractions. Perhaps the breakfast is a little expensive (EUR 18), but the variety and quality of the food they offer is excellent. I needed a pair of slippers and they brought me two pairs. The bathroom amenities are good and in the bedroom were 2 bathrooms. The seating area in the room is quite large, I would say that the room has closely 35 m2. It's one of the best choice in Berlin, a magnificent city with a lot of things to see and to do, and with really great offers, not at all and expensive city! I will definitely stay at this hotel in further trips to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: PabloAnaEduDD
Reviews.Content: Mercure Check Point Charlie is the perfect hotel; clean, rooms with good light and facilities, near (100 m)one of the main attrctions in Berlin to pick up the double deck buses to visit the city, with restaurants in the neighbourhood, 20 minutes walking to Unter den Linden, Reichstag and Branderburger Tor. The breakfast is a dream (do not forget the german sausages). Above all, the staff smile you always and you feel at home. Almost perfect hotel, but it deserves a restaurant to be perfect. Congratulations

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Travellingfriends08
Reviews.Content: Modern and confortable rooms. Very well located. Friendly staff. Family friendly. Price does not include breakfast, which is expensive. Public areas not very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, very comfy room, good price”
Reviews.Author: jwgibbons
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for the Berlinale Film Festival for work. My wife & our 11 week old baby went with me, which I was nervous about. When I called to let the hotel know about the baby, they were very accommodating. When we arrived, they very generously provided a baby cot, a large family room, and were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The entire staff also speaks fluent English for non-German speakers.The room wasn't super fancy, but is above average with all of the necessaries: comfy bed, good linens, desk, TV, wireless, large bath/shower, etc. The location is excellent for getting around; right in the center of the city, a block from the underground, and a couple of blocks from nice restaurants, shopping, etc. The city block where the hotel is is a bit desolate currently, but again, if you just walk a couple of blocks, you can find life and get anywhere. Only concern we had was that the wireless in the room was a bit spotty; one side of the room had a good signal vs. the other side had nearly no signal one night. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel: good price for the value, excellent/friendly service, and great location. And, for families, it is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel on Quiet Street”
Reviews.Author: BFamilyZurich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night while visiting Berlin for a short weekend. The hotel is located on a quiet side street, 5-10 minutes walking time to the main attractions of the city. A great location. Was also a couple blocks from restaurants and a bakery. We booked online and requested a 3rd bed for our child. We were given an extra bed free of charge, and a huge room.....the size of a suite with 2 bathrooms. The room was very modern and clean with a mini bar, TV, hairdryer, etc. The only thing missing was a coffee maker. The breakfast was 10 Euros per person so we did not partake, but upon peering in there, it looked like a nice buffet. The hotel also had a small bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Warm place in freezing Berlin”
Reviews.Author: AlmereJohn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much in this bed and breakfast hotel. Friendly staff and wonderful breakfast. We booked a deluxe room which was clean and very nice. This Mercure hotel is located near Checkpoint Charlie in Berlin Mitte. A perfect location for sightseeing. As Berlin was freezing cold during our stay, this hotel always gave us a warm welcome. So check it out and enjoy! Els and Gerard

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: gewoonvoordelol
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very good location for sightseeing. Close to museums, Ku'damm, Unter den Linden, Alexanderplatz. Very comfortable rooms !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and not expensive”
Reviews.Author: Merelda
Reviews.Content: Agree with most reviews. We booked hotel based on tripadvisor and it was as expected. Room was spacious and comfortable, staff mostly helpful,although their English wasn't always great. Only complaint with room was there was no tea and coffee making facilities. Didn't have breakfast in hotel but found a cafe quite close by. There was not a lot of cafes to choose from in the area. The location was reasonable not far from checkpoint charlie and within easy travel by U bahn

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great value - great for families”
Reviews.Author: EuroVacation
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Berlin late on a Saturday in snowy conditions and couldn't have been met with a warmer welcome. The staff are all very helpful and happy, they all seem to like working there which rubs off on the customers. We stayed with two teenagers (a family of four) and had a wonderful room with two separate bedrooms, a separate toilet and a great bathroom with an extra long bath and freestanding shower. The floor was heated in the bathroom, and the towels were always warm on the towel rack. The room service menu is basic and the breakfast was a little expensive (18 Euros each) so we ate out for breakfast most days. However, compared to our experience in Paris, this was a great way to finish off our European vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Rob_the_cloggie
Reviews.Content: Very spacious room for good price. Central and still quite location. Good breakfast but no diner facilities. That's OK because there are ample restaurants close by. Helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie”
Reviews.Author: BerlinPaddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family including 18 month old baby. Experience very good. Staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms were excellent -large well-appointed and clean. Baby had a good cot and bed linen well up to standard. Staff helpful with meals for baby. Restaurant a bit limited - good but expensive breakfast and limited snack facilities at other times but snacks were adequate, good and well priced. Location is very convenient for tourist attractions. It is also close to the U bahn. I would have no hesitation in recommending it to others for holiday or business stays. I have used other Mercure hotels in Berlin but this was the best. GL from Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Sazzar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of its location and value for money. In both instances, we were not disappointed. After navigating the airport buses, we arrived a few blocks away from the hotel. Check-in was straight forward and staff were helpful. Through the maze of corridors, we found our long room which despite its size was not terribly well laid out (desk fixed in the middle of the room). The bathroom was fantastic for a winter trip. The tiles were heated as was the towel rack, and the shaving mirror was very helpful. The bed was comfortable as well. Following advice from other Tripadvisor reviews, we opted not to eat the extortionate buffet breakfast offered by the hotel, but went daily to the Aroma Cafe down the road which had tasty and cheap European breakfast options. We were luckily located next to the sauna and fitness room which was clean and the sauna area was well-equipped. The fitness room was somewhat limited but served its purpose. We did have trouble getting an extra bed when we had a friend stay with us. We had notified the hotel via email weeks before and had told several people, including a duty manager, that our friend would need a bed. Eventually after ringing front desk late that evening, the bed finally arrived with the help of the person at the front desk who was mystified by the lack of response we had encountered. Overall, we had a good stay and would recommend this to anyone looking for an inexpensive and central place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vedev
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was just a complete pleasure, in large part due to the fantastic staff. We arrive very late one Friday night but the receptionists we bright and cheery and immediately upgraded us to an appartment when they heard that it was our first trip to Berlin. They also happily looked after our bags on Sunday after we checked out and were really helpful in ordering taxi's, etc. I know one comes to expect these sorts of things but it is so nice when the service is delivered quickly, without fuss and with a smile. The appartment was spacious and comfortable without being indulgent - probably more of a business class hotel rather than a romantic botique. It is, however, seriously well located, perhaps 5 minutes quick walk from Unter Dem Linden, the Sony centre or Potsdammer Platz. Only two negative things I would note are: 1) The hotel itself is stylish and easy to spot but there are a couple of "massage parlours" on the same road which is a little seedy (quite funny to sit and watch the men going in for a "massage" at 11 PM on a Saturday night though!!). 2) Breakfast is in buffet form, which I'm sure is fantastic but at €18 Euros is a little steep in a city where things are, for Europe, pretty cheap. As I'm not bothered by either of the above it's another 5 star review!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: devnull
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well positioned in Berlin next to Friedrichstrass. It's a few minutes walk from Checkpoint Charlie, and about five minutes walk from at one underground station, less than ten minutes from a different station on a different line. The room itself was comfortable and big. The staff in the hotel are helpful, friendly and can't do enough to help. The staff really are a credit to the hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what it is”
Reviews.Author: j777777
Reviews.Content: Large room. Clean. Modern decor. Great staff. Perfect location for sight seeing. Reasonable price. Can't ask for any more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel-Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_Sz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mercure for business and was very pleasantly surprised by my stay. My room as unusually large by European standards. The bathroom and the shower room were separate, quite convenient when sharing the room with someone. And I was pleasantly surprise in the morning to find that the towel warmer also triggered some sort of floor warmer which kept my toes nice and toasty come the morning. With this said, I would not qualify the standards as four star. I think it's an exceptiona 3-star, but as a 4 star it's merely average at best. If you are looking for value and location, look not further, but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: olekjaermansfeldt
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay - we stayed at the hotel for two nights - we being my wife, our one-and-half-year son and myself - in early November... The staff - both in reception, breakfast restaurant and cleaning - were absolutely amazing at meeting our needs, borh before, during and after our stay. Before they made our room available close to our co-travellers prior to normal check.in and had a childrens bed ready and set upon arrival. During they catered for our needs in every imaginable way - room service, breakfast, our son playing all over the lobby, etc. After we had a great service when we received our forgotten stuff through post... Everything was perfect! The location is also great - close to all the different districts of the city, and close to many good restaurants and shops in the surrounding area.. The hotel itself is perfect, newly decorated and clean and nice...!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTBSidcup
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin for the Xmas markets and decided to stay at this hotel because of the very good feedback reviews on tripadvisor. For the money, it is one of the best European hotels that we have stayed in - we were surprised at how large the rooms were. It is also ideally situated and in very quiet street. The only downside was that breakfast in the hotel was not included in the price but we found a small cafe just around the corner where we could purchase rolls, sandwiches, croissants etc at a fraction of the price that the breakfast in the hotel would have cost. Thoroughly recommended - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GalwayKilkennyDuo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, just around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie. We were a party of 8 and had 4 rooms - all of them were a great size and the beds were very comfortable. Our room rate included breakfast and it was very good - they provided gluten free bread and decaffinated coffee for a few of us who had issues with gluten. My sisters birthday was on Monday and the staff heard us singing happy birthday the previous night in the bar (after midnight). The next morning we had a reserved table for breakfast with a birthday greeting and chocolates on the table. It was much appreciated. The hotel staff were very helpful, organising taxis, giving us directions to the various key sights. We walked to many of the wonderful Christmas markets - sipping gluwhein and eating barbecued sausages seems to be a national pastime and one we enjoyed. We did a guided tour of the Rheichstag, which I pre-booked at no cost before we left. (~on the parliament website) There was no queuing and we were brought around the new parliament and saw the grafitti from the Russian soldiers who held the building during part of WWII. We found the cost of eating and drinking to be very reasonable - on average about 35 euro for a three course meal with plenty of drinks - much cheaper than Ireland. The coffee shops and choclate shops were great for stopping off after all the walking - all the burned calories were soon back on! I can't advise on public transport as we walked everywhere and took an occasional taxi at night time - they were very good value at around 5 euro. Berlin was a great city and I look forward to returning and I'll be staying in the Mercure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro_Mellado
Reviews.Content: I booked a prepaid night at this hotel through Travelocity, check in was a breeze. the room was spotless, the bed very comfortable. It is in a very good location near a subway station, Checkpoint Charlie obviously and many high end stores. the City sight seeing bus stops nearby. Staff is friendly and helpful. I will return to this hotel, that's a promise.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the right location”
Reviews.Author: FdV62
Reviews.Content: We (family with three young children) stayed in the Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie for one night during a weekend trip to Berlin. The hotel has a very good location (as the name suggests close to Checkpoint Charlie) in the center of Berlin. It is easy reachable by taxi from Tegel airport (20 Euro - 20 minutes on Saturday morning). We had some trouble while checking in as we had booked and paid for a family suite which was not available due to overbooking (blamed by the friendly staff on a system's issue). The receptionist asked for ten minutes patience and was able to sort it and provide us with two rooms with connecting doors instead. The rooms were both very large and clean with balconies on the courtyard side. The buffet breakfast has a wide choice of warm and cold dishes. The staff was very friendly and the overall experience and location justifies this hotel's position in the Tripadvisor Top 3 for Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff - perfect base to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: MaltaTeresa
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in Berlin so I was fairly uncertain about which hotel to pick. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor I picked the Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie as everyone had something good to say about this hotel. The staff was immediately helpful as I sent some emails with some questions which were promptly answered. When we arrived we were immediately impressed by the efficiency of the staff. They also always seem to have a smile on their face all the time which is something we really appreciated. The room we were allocated was really large, extremely clean and very comfortable. I liked the fact that the shower and the toilet facilities were separate to each other. The breakfast was absolutely fantastic and the spread on offer really great! Unfortunately I fell ill with a bad cold and temperature on the last day and the staff did everything they could to try help me out. We paid for a late check out as we had a late flight back and they let us keep the room as long as possible as they were completely booked up. We were lucky enough to meet the Manager of the hotel and have a chat with him. He obviously takes great pride in his hotel and his staff and is a certainly doing a great job... When I got back home I sent an email to the hotel thanking them for our great stay and was more than surprised when I got a phone call back from the hotel thanking us for our email. I have to say this is a first.. I was really impressed by this and would certainly reccomend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Berlin. Well done to all the staff... keep up the good work and keep smiling!! We will be back on our first trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivanhonottingham
Reviews.Content: Following the excellent reviews of this hotel on TripAdvisor we stayed here for four nights at the end of October. We had one of the suites on the 8th floor, which cost not much more than we'd paid for a double room in a hotel in Barcelona earlier this year. The room (actually two connected rooms, one with settee and chairs, TV, small kitchen area, entrance lobby and wc; the other with the bed area and bathroom) was spotless, with a large balcony that overlooked the courtyard, and totally noise free. Staff friendly and helpful. Bar area busy but friendly and efficient. The hotel itself is superbly located for all the sites of what was largely East Berlin. Another reviewer has mentioned the French restaurant a few doors away from the hotel: very good; but Sale a Tabacci, an Italian restaurant on Kochstrasse (4 mins walk) was even better. Busy, though, so book. Also there's a taverna type Italian diagonally opposite from the hotel which is much cheaper but also good food. Next door to this is a place for breakfast if you don't fancy paying 18 euros per person every morning for the hotel breakfast. Would definetly return here.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: ValCheshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night trip to The Mecure Check Point Charlie. As previously revewied the Hotel was Spotless and very comfortable we were given a free upgrade just because we asked for a room with a bath!. Staff really friendly and the hotel was ideally located for sights and restaraunts, try Entrecote just a few doors down French with lovely food and great service. Would highly recommend Original Berlin Walks early in your stay to get a good overview of the city. Great friendly city with lots of history ideal for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Wunderful stay in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: REdit
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days in this hotel for touristic reasons. We wanted to look around in Berlin, however we were here two yers ago, we stayed in the same hotel that time as well. We liked this place so much that we did not search for any other accomodation this time. We found an advantageous two days arrangement on the website which included breakfast, it was not a question whether to stay anywhere else. The rooms are spacoious, clean and has nice warm colours. The location is perfect for touristic and for business trips as well. The hotel is very nice, the staff is very kind, you will find even the finest details perfect here (free internet access, freshly made limonade in the lobby). Don't miss the breakfast, it is awesome. Have a nice stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: ibwales42
Reviews.Content: This is a tremendous hotel for a sightseeing or a business trip to Berlin. It is also good value. We stayed for four nights. The family suite we had was spacious, modern, comfortable, quiet and spotless. There was a separate bedroom for our teenage daughter with a shared bathroom and also a separate toilet with washbasin. The hotel staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. The hotel's bar was friendly and inviting. I can't comment on breakfast - it looked pretty good to me, but €18 each seemed an unnecessary expense. The hotel's website doesn't mention that there is a small fitness room onsite, but there is. The hotel is convenient for some of the important sights and there is also an underground station very nearby. There are a few local restaurants although the area, to be fair, is not 'buzzing' (if that's what you want). We liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Berlin base”
Reviews.Author: MeridianManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here on a first visit to Berlin. We had a family suite for 3 adults - it was huge, comfortable and clean. It's in a good position to see the sites of old East Berlin and close to public transport to go further afield. The only meal is breakfast and we tended to go out for that - cheaper! There are good coffee bars and restaurants nearby. There is a small bar and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to all Berlin attractions”
Reviews.Author: Magere1_2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in this hotel Room was huge, separate bathroom & toilet. Room always spotlessly clean. Comfortable bed (& pillows). Convenient to all Berlin attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and caring!”
Reviews.Author: franklywong
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great staff. Clean. This is all that one can expect from a European hotel at reasonable rates (less than 100 Euro). The added bonus were the spacious rooms. My husband and I stayed in one room, and our single friend stayed in another room. Both rooms were the same size. They provided maps, juice in the morning, and service with a smile for no charge! Overall, our experience with the Mercure hotel has been predictable and pleasing.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Checkpoint Charlie -Wunderbar”
Reviews.Author: LoveitalyEssex
Reviews.Content: October 7 2008. My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate our Ruby anniversary. The staff, without exception, could not have been more helpful. In particular, we would like to mention Michalina who on finding out about our special anniversary even brought us heart shaped chocolates!! We stayed on a B&B basis and the breakfast could not be faulted and there was a wide variety of dishes to choose from. Our room was large,spotless, it had a King size bed and the bathroom even had a heated floor.Great after a shower! It is 5 minutes walk from Stadtmitte U bahn station-go towards Checkpoint Charlie, then take the 2nd turning on the left. Most places are possible to walk to including the Brandenburg Gate,Tiergarten,Reichstag, Unter Den Linden. Great Italian trattoria(1st right from hotel) fantastic pasta but closed Sundays. When next in Berlin will stay here,central,and great staff. Great hotel,great location

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Rooms, buffet breakfast and Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelforadventure
Reviews.Content: I regularly travel for business and pleasure and have also worked in a top luxury hotel. The staff at the Mecure provided excellent, friendly service that is definitely top notch. Rooms and hotel are very clean and breakfast buffet great variety and staff very quick to keep it stocked and very tidy. The atmosphere was inviting in every way; have only positive things to say about my 4 day stay. Definitely recommended. Very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: thesprouts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights based on the tripadvisor reviews and the excellent price we got via the hotels website-77 Euros for one night and 87 for the other two nights. The hotel is in an excellent location-walk to the wall, Checkpoint Charlie, subway, even Brandenburg Gate. The room was clean and spacious-the colour scene didn't offend me too much and it had all that we needed. We used the free wireless in the reception with no hassles. We skipped breakfast and instead went to a cafe around the corner. We did go to a restaurant a few doors down (Entrecote) which was very good. This was recommended by a member of staff who deserves a mention for being extrememly helpful and friendly. Not sure of his name but he was a giant of a man! I did have a minor problem caused by the seeming reluctance of reception staff to work with "service staff" but the rest of the experience more than made up for one unpleasant incident. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamLilly
Reviews.Content: Conveniently situated for the underground. Polite & helpful staff. Huge bedroom. Good buffet breakfast and as an added bonus a bar that is open until 1 a.m. Would use this hotel again and would recommend also.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JodoBear
Reviews.Content: My partner and I absolutley loved our suite. It had an upstairs and everything. The location was perfect and the Staff were very friendly. I do think that the Breakfast is a little pricey for what it was. All in all we loved the Hotel and Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasing stay”
Reviews.Author: andreag27
Reviews.Content: Plus excellent location (few steps away from Friedrichstraße and close to subway stations), very large quiet and clean room, kind staff, nice view, nice restaurants and bars in the area Minus breakfast too expensive (18,00 € per person): I had breakfast in the bar round the corner

Reviews.Title: “Sheep, needle and a thread”
Reviews.Author: pticatrkacica
Reviews.Content: Dear Charlie, Sheep, needle and a thread were what I found best about your hotel: 'sheep-candies to fall alseep' because this demonstarted your sense of humor; needle and some thread because it just happened so that I needed them. The room was spacy with a nice view, the staff was kind, and the hotel is perfectly located and easily accessible. I spent only one night at your hotel, but I hope to be coming back again. IL, Croatia

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ANunesLisboa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel last week with my family and friends. We took each a two room family suite which was one of the roomiest I have ever seen. Staff was very friendly and efficient and breakfast was quite good and with an unusually long time frame (from 6.00 to 10.30 and till 11.30 on weekends) . Quite close to C. Charlie (two blocks), U bahn stop and hop on hop off bus. We also took advantage off the bike renttal ageement with a nearby rental shop which worked fine. Good Restaurants nearby though not one of the livliest zone if you are looking for entertainement at night (we weren't) I would recommend the hotel to friend

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: arfoooon
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a fantastic location right next to Checkpoint Charlie. I received a free room upgrade to a maisonette on the 5th floor with a balcony overlooking the street - very nice! Excellent, varied breakfast, extremely pleasant staff and good overall level of service. One criticism - I was visiting Berlin with work and so needed internet access in my room. Unfortunately the wireless signal was very weak and I kept loosing the connection. Other than that I have nothing but praise for this very comfortable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “probably the friendliest hotel in the world !”
Reviews.Author: Rosneath
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for 3 nights with 6 other colleagues. Our rooms were super and spacious, with a balcony to the inner courtyard. The overwhelming memory of this hotel ( and I travel a lot ) is that the staff , universally , were the friendliest, and most helpful I have ever encountered. The Manager, Paolo, is a very charming and hardworking host , and clearly in his 3 year direction , he has motivated this young and energetic staff to a high level. A highlight of the weekend was Staff member , Jennifer , singing in an unaccompanied , but beautiful way to us , as we enjoyed a drink ! I would have no hesitation in going to this hotel again , indeed I would look forward to it !

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Huge Room and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: eddy_bkk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in July and we are very happy with the value we got from this hotel. The room is very spacious and very clean. Bed is very comfortable exactly like we had from Mercure in Paris 2 weeks before and we missed it for the whole trip. Hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful. The Hotel is in a convenient location, just a short walk from subway. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as recommended by other reviewers and we found there are a lot of good places to eat near hotel. Oh! there is a small convenient store at the back of hotel so that you can get anythings like water, snack and yogurt there. We will absolutely stay here again when we come back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Berlin Checkpoint Charlie Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Kashub2008
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Checkpoint Charlie Mercure, after spending six nights at the Mercure Hevelius in Gdansk, Poland. It is clear that the two were part of the same family. Desk staff was outstanding, with a fluent command of English and friendly and helpful demeanor. The room at Checkpoint Charlie was one of the smaller ones on the floor, but was still quite large. In fact, we often missed someone knocking on the door because it was so far away! The location on Schuetzenstrasse is wonderful for its easy access to - you guessed it - Checkpoint Charlie, but also a twenty-minute walk from Unter den Linden, Brandenburg Gate, the Staatsoper, Tier Garten, etc. In other words, it is close to a lot of Berlin attractions. My complaints are two, but minor. The breakfast buffet, though extensive, is very pricey - 18 Euros. The other complaint is that there is just one computer and printer for guests' use, and it is located in the lobby. It was not unusual for someone to spend 20+ minutes checking their email, surfing the Internet, etc. Maybe if the computer were not so visable it wouldn't be used so casually. Perhaps a sign that said "please limit your online activities to 15 minutes" might be an improvement. Overall the hotel is excellent, and I have no problem recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clayre8077
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed in this hotel on a room only basis in April this year. The hotel is very central & a great location. As the name suggests it is very close to check point charlie but you can walk everywhere else. The hotel is clean & rooms are large & spacious. There is a bar downstairs & staff are very curteous & efficient. An excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sing006
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel with very helpful staff. We got almost an apartment with two bedrooms for a family of four and very quiet area but still very close to all the tourist spots. No complaint at all.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, flawless service”
Reviews.Author: martidoh
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from San Francisco, a missed connection in LHR and a long, long queue to report missing bags at Tegel we finally made it here at about 12:30 a.m.! Staff were very friendly and the picture of professionalism even at that late hour; the bar stayed open a little longer so we could have a couple of drinks to soothe ourselves. The room itself was enormous. You could have played a game of indoor soccer in it. A nice little lounge area on one side, a massive bathroom where we weren't bumping into each other trying to brush our teeth. Granted there isn't much to do in the area at night, so you do need to jump in a taxi or an U-Bahn to go get a good dinner or find a cool bar. But cabs are plentiful and reasonable in Berlin, so that's never a turnoff. We stayed 3 nights and booked through the Mercure site and got a great deal of 100 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MilanoBerlin08
Reviews.Content: If you plan to spend a week in Berlin, you should not miss the Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie! The hotel is located in a central quite place, few minutes walk from two U-Bahn line and from the bus stop. The hotel is excellent, the staff is very friendly and professional. Our room was large, well furnished, with large bathroom and very clean. The breakfast was delicious, but a little bit expensive. We highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: glpowers
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a four night stay in Berlin. We had a great experience at the hotel. Our room was much larger than we expected. It was decorated with very cool, funky modern furniture. The bathroom was also very chic and clean. We had zero complaints about the room. The hotel is in a cool area as well. Totally accessible by subway. It's fairly quiet at night but there are a few restaurants around and there's plenty of historial sites to visit during the day. It's also an easy walk to Friedrichstrasse which is very central. Our only negative experience with the hotel was partially our own fault. When we checked in we were told where breakfast was and what time it was served every morning. We should have asked how much it cost, but given that the room service prices weren't exhorbitant, we assumed that the breakfast buffet would be priced reasonably as well. We eventually asked and were shocked to find out that breakfast cost €18 per person. Although the breakfast spread was generous, that was WAY more than we would have wanted to spend on breakfast. Live and learn...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreeneUk
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for a family of three that includes a teenager as they allow three adults in a room. Better deal than booking two rooms with a "lower" class hotel in the Accor chain - especially with a summer offer that included (excellent) breakfasts. They gave us a free room upgrade too. Modern clean rooms overlooking an attractive inner courtyard; safe area; helpful, multi-lingual staff. Hotel well situated - brisk walk to many of the sites of Berlin. Easy to get to from Hauptbahnhof by S and U-bahn to Stadtmitte. Eat at Lagano in Kronenstrasse for good, unpretentious Italian food.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Melb1985
Reviews.Content: the Mercure checkpoint charlie was amazing, we booked an executive suite and the room was huge!!!! it had a dining table for 8 people which seemed a little pointless as there was no cooking facilities but then again we didnt come to berlin to sit in our room all day. we had a mezzanine level bedroom which overlooked the lounge room and the double storey height windows which was perfect. the location was also great, only 5 minutes walking to stadtmitte underground station and around 15-20 minutes to walk to the galeries lafayette, which had some good shopping in the central part of Berlin. the staff were very pleasent and friendly and would always make us feel welcome. overall the hotel was fantastic there were no faults what so ever i'll definently be back there next time i come to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “No place like Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie”
Reviews.Author: nanoe2312
Reviews.Content: in the center of all the happenings. close to the beautifull Gendarmenmarkt and Checkpoint Charlie. very helpfull and friendly staff. beautifull rooms, big and very clean. very various breakfast. buy tickets in the hotel for the hopp on hopp of tour. i'll definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: WandaFarr
Reviews.Content: For a first visit to Berlin, this hotel was the perfect choice. It is in a great location - very close to Checkpoint Charlie and walking distance to many of the main tourist sites, with underground stations just yards away. It is located on a quiet street, but not too far from the hustle and bustle of historic Berlin. We had booked two deluxe suites and they were lovely. Very spacious, clean, modern with great aircon - just as well because Berlin was very hot during our stay. The hotel bar was friendly and welcoming and the staff were extremely helpful, courteous and spoke extremely good English, Overall, a delightful stay in a great hotel in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PeerJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, great and large rooms, very quiet hotel. Very good breakfast. Staff was friendly and very helpfull with booking of an evening out. Would recommend this hotel to evrybody. Very good price/value. MAny siteseeing locations on walkingdistance

Reviews.Title: “The Friendly Mercure”
Reviews.Author: RexMax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and son stayed in what can only be described as a suite. The room was excellent in terms of facilities, size etc. We were very impressed with the staff who helped us in many ways including giving us directions to Union Berlin FC!! Overall we felt the hotel more than lived up to its 4 star status. We will be back in December. The location is convenient to many of the sights with Stadmitte Ubanhof very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vacations20
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room online, and we were pleasantly surprised upon checkin after a rough day of train travel. We checked in around 10pm and were told that we had been upgraded. Our room ended up being more suite like with separate rooms for the wash closet and shower, a large seating area, a desk, and a good sized balcony over looking the well-maintained, gardened courtyard that houses their restaurant. The room and hotel were clean and well-kept. We were given a 10% discount to the Italian place down the street for a late dinner that night as well. The location is absolutely fantastic if you like to walk. It is right down the street from the Stadmitte underground stop, so as long as you don't have 2 tons of luggage, getting there via public transport is no problem. Checkpoint Charlie is literally a stone's throw away, and every other sight like the Reichstag, Museum Island, Wall Memorials, the Brandonburg Gate, etc are all within a 20 minute or so walk from the hotel. There are plenty of good places to eat in the area as well. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: wendyNorway
Reviews.Content: Nice location and very friendly and helpfull staff!But the room was'nt more than average in my opinion-and barly that.Had expected more from a 4 star hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: roudoudou
Reviews.Content: Hard to add anything. Hotel is superbly located. Rooms are amazing. Staff helpful, a nice touch is apples at reception for anyone to take. There is a sauna on the 7th floor. Would not consider going elsewhere in Berlin (having stayed in many different accommodations and areas).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tracyinjapan06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful find! The price, location, and size of room was awesome! It is in a great location, the staff is friendly, easy access to the metro, and spacious rooms!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service, great attitude”
Reviews.Author: Taltulit
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel with our 5 months old baby. Through the online reservation as well as the check in and the entire stay, hotel staff were kind, friendly and very eager to help. We recieved a very big room - more like a suite - a room that was mentioned in the reviews - and were very comfortable. I read most of the reviews before making the reservation and I was happy to learn they were very true. I too, recommend the Italian restaurant close by "Salle E Tabacchi" and the grocery store around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put - a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: meiriko
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. New building with nice and spacious rooms, friendly staff and good location, close to the UBahn station. The garden cafe is nice for an afternoon coffee or beer. Close by (up to 3 blocks away) you can find 3 grocery stores (Spar, Kaiser) and numerous coffee shops/bakeries/restaurants. Make sure you visit the Italian restaurant Sale e Tabacchi (http://www.sale-e-tabacchi.de/ , http://tinyurl.com/57xrhq).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place and location”
Reviews.Author: QueenBeeMontreal
Reviews.Content: This was a two night, three day stay at the Hotel. The location next to Checkpoint Charlie is great. We were in walking distance to the Brandenburg Tower and many points of interest. There is a Hop on Hop Off Bus that stops at Checkpoint Charlie, so very convenient for visiting the sights. Chose the package that includes the breakfast. The buffet has everything anyone would want and more! The terrace is great for sipping wine or having a leisurely breakfast. Staff is friendly and the beds are very very comfortable. I would go back in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: WearyTravellerBR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mercure Check Point Charlie at the end of June/beginning of July 2008. It was the first time I returned to Berlin for almost 20 years. For my wife, it was a first visit. We loved the city and are planning a return trip - if possible to stay at the same hotel. The hotel is exceptionally well located. Near the newly fashionable Gerdamenmarkt/Friedrichstrasse/Unter den Linden/Museuminsel area, with easy access to public transport. Excellent restaurants within walking distance (we were blessed by magnificent weather!). Opera and concert houses nearby. We walked over to a really good ballet at the Staatsoper on UdLinden. We had a great room - spacious, comfortable, quiet in the Residenz (an annex to the Hotel), with a small kitchen. The staff was attentive, friendly, and helpful. We had considered staying at a hotel in the Ku'damm area and are very glad we didn't. The Ku'damm looks decayed and in sore need of renovation, compared with the bright and shiny renovated areas of East Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly attitude”
Reviews.Author: arnieRome
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit business looking but inside both the rooms and the personel are instead quite warm. The small fitness and sauna on the last floor are tiny but very clean and welcoming. Breakfast was excellent and plentiful and would give you the right calory input to start your visit in Berlin starting from CPC j(check Point Charlie) just outside. Nothing special to say about the architecture of the block which was desighned by Aldo Rossi, quite boring yet colorful, seems a bit of a Paris periferic block. The director of the hotel is very friendly, helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - bad location”
Reviews.Author: strawberryjellybean
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel - not great but good. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was clean and spacious. Everything was as you would expect for the price but to be honest the place lacks character and is a little sterile. The real downside is that there is nothing much in the neighbourhood but checkpoint charlie. If you want to enjoy a couple of drinks in a traditional German Bierhaus in the evenings or want to go to a club then don't stay here. Gartenmarkt is within walking distance and it is a lovely area but quite an expensive one

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a city trip.”
Reviews.Author: vicdoc
Reviews.Content: We booked the Mercure for a four day city break based on it's excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed. The hotel is in an excellent location, one block from checkpoint charlie and a five minute walk from two U-Bahn stations (Kochstrasse and Stadtmitte). The price of the hotel was very reasonable, and although not a five-star luxury pad, has an excellent standard of facilities. Don't know if we just got lucky, but we were allocated a massive room (I think it was a family sized room), with seperate en-suite toilet and bathroom. The staff were extremely attentive and helpful. We did not bother paying for any meals at the hotel based on other reviews regarding the price of breakfast. This was a good choice as there is an abundance of restarants and coffee houses a short walk away. A great place to stay if you are in Berlin to explore the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: CaryAllison
Reviews.Content: I will simply reiterate what many of the other reviewers have said: this is a wonderful hotel, and doubly wonderful given the price and location. My wife and I were there for a week--I was at a conference--and we booked a 7 night special on Bookings.com for 99 Euros a night. Our upgraded room--part of the package, I think--was absolutely HUGE, on the seventh floor with large casement windows that opened onto the street. The room and furnishings were spotless and contemporary, as was the entire facility, the bathroom large and user friendly. Another couple we were traveling with booked the same deal and their room was just as nice, with a small balcony that opened onto the interior courtyard of the hotel. By far the biggest and nicest hotel room I have stayed in in Europe, where small and over-rated is the norm, in my experience. The hotel charges for in-room wifi but has a computer--with printer, no less, for free--in the lobby, and also has free wifi in the lobby so you can just bring your laptop or other device down there and check your mail. Location is outstanding, one block from Friedrichstrasse and close (2 blocks) to both Stadtmitte and Kochstrasse U Bahn stops. (If you're there for a week, buy the 7 day U Bahn pass for zones A and B for about 27 Euros--you'll get more than your money's worth.) Easy walk to both Potsdamer Platz and the Tiergarten. If you're a runner, a great loop is Postdamer Platz/Tiergarten/Brandenburg Gate/Unter den Linden and back down to the hotel. Hotel service was excellent with the exception of the bar staff, which was average at best. (The hotel has a very nice wine garden, and seems to do lots of events there.) We did not do the 18 Euros per day breakfast, which seemed a little pricey, so I can't comment on that; there are several good coffee and pastry/muffin places nearby--one two blocks north on Friedrichstrasse and one half a block north on Charlottenstrasse--and that's all we want for breakfast. All in all, a great hotel and wonderful stay--definitely the best I've experienced on any European trip, which includes many cities over the past 15 years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LiangShanBo
Reviews.Content: Recenty stayed here to attend a conference at the ICC in Berlin. Hotel is a nice clean 4 star hotel. Very close to Checkpoint Charlie (about 3 blocks away). We booked the cheapest room available and got upgraded to a large room on arrival. Downside was that the room was on the 8th floor and the elevator only goes to the 7th floor. Not a big deal on a daily basis except for the luggage. The rooftop room was quite nice although it had some quirks (which are to be expected in older buildings). For example, the toilet and shower were located in separate bathrooms. Staff was very nice. Service was great. For example, we left the do not disturb sign on our door while out sightseeing one day and when we can back, a bag full of clean towels was left on the door knob. Free apples are available at the front desk and Tuesdays are free massage days (register at the front desk for a free 15 minute massage). Perhaps the only downside was lack of a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would definitely go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lover80
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a whole week, and can't complain at all. Location's great, close to subway station, shopping area, easy walking distance to excellent restaurants, etc. Some might consider it being away from all the "main areas" but that is NOT TRUE. It is so excellently located, there is really nothing to complain about. Great buffet in the morning, nice staff, wonderful patio out in the back...would definitely recommend it to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Drumfish
Reviews.Content: Just back from six nights at the Mercure Checkpoint Charlie, in Room 706 (same as Little Cupcakes, May 2, 2008, review). Big room, more like a suite. Hideous colour scheme, royal blue chairs and orange carpet, but that's the only criticism. Excellent bathroom, with separate toilet. Everything spotlessly clean. Helpful staff. Free internet access in the lobby. We didn't want the full buffet breakfast for 18 Euros, so they provided juice, rolls and coffee for 5 Euros. The location is excellent, about a two-minute walk from Stadtmitte subway station on Friederichstrasse, where two lines intersect. Altogether, much better than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: LauraClare
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel upon the recommendation of trip advisor. I can't say enough about how friendly the staff was. They were nice and helpful. The rooms were extra large and very clean. We had a suite for three people-a nice surprise because we were expecting a 3rd bed to be a sofa. The only surprise was the breakfast which we thought came with the room but it was 18 euros extra. That was our fault for not asking. However, the breakfast was a good value for they had a large selection of meats, cheese, pastries, again with a very friendly staff. The location which is one reason why I selected this hotel to begin with was excellent. Only a 5 min. walk to check point Charlie and the hop on hop off bus which I highly recommend. Also close to the metro station. Overall the best hotel we have ever stayed at in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Mandrew123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights and was given a very large suite with two separate rooms. One was a double, one a sitting room with sofa, chair and single bed. There was also a bathroom with a separate shower and bath with the W/C contained in a separate room (very handy). Staff were great and service was excellent. All staff spoke fluent English and were happy to help. The Hotel was located less than two minutes walk from Kockstrasse U station and from there it was easy to explore the city. Great restaurants nearby and all the city centre bars you would expect. Only downside was the cost of breakfast which was 18 euros (it was delivered to the room though and there was loads of it). All in all, this is the place to stay in Berlin as everywhere was in easy reach of the hotel and the hotel itself was a quite resting place with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: LittleCupcakes
Reviews.Content: I paid about 72 Euro per night for 5 nights, with advance purchase/no refund rate. I was aware of breakfast and the charge, but I asked upon checkin and was not charged for it (I'm a late sleeper, and almost never eat breakfast). The room I had (706) was quite large, but a bit spare in terms of furnishings. But, there was a minibar, shower (and a separate bathtub), in-room safe and a separate water closet. The bed (two twins pushed together) was firm, and one of the nicest I encountered while on my three-week trip. My room did NOT have a 32 inch LCD or heated floors (makes no difference to me anyway). I think there are two portions of the hotel, and I perhaps was in the older portion, but the room was in good repair and not at all shabby. Plenty of windows and light, and my room faced the street. I was disturbed early AM with construction noise from across the street, but closing the windows muted it enough to back to sleep. Ubahn and Sbahn are close, and in fact you can access two different lines easily (and a third line with a 10 minute walk)which is handy to avoid changing trains. Many attractions are easily walkable, and the Kultur forum and Museum Island are also walkable in 20 minutes or so. The bar, though tiny, is nice. There is a grocery store a block or so away for you to stock the minibar yourself. The internet computer in the lobby is a great touch, and I only had to wait once or twice to use it. You can even order a beer from the bar and drink as you surf!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, terrific value”
Reviews.Author: Enable
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend in late March as a single traveler. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer or more welcoming. My room was pretty large, much larger than I expected. There was plenty of room for a desk that was placed in the center, a 32 inch flat-screen tv with a large number of channels in various languages. Although my room was right next to the elevator, I heard absolutely no noise from the hallway. My room contained a balcony that overlooked a courtyard. There was a large bathroom with plenty of countertop space containing a shower and a separate toilet. The hotel offers huge and quite good breakfast buffet. However, if I had one complaint it was that I wasn't told until chekout that there was a steep charge for this. There is a free computer in the lobby. The only major tourist attraction nearby is Checkpoint Charlie. However, subway and bus routes are nearby, and taxi service is relatively inexpensive. I paid about $110 a night to stay here, which, given the quality and service, was a terrific value. This would be my first choice in a hotel should I decide to return to Berlin, and I would enthusiastically recommend it to others. .

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 45Jen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, this is a great hotel with very large rooms, comfy beds,friendly staff and near to many sights in Berlin, the best hotel we've stayed at in Europe, pity it was only for one night I would definitely recommend the Mercure.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: megginc
Reviews.Content: The Mecure Hotel and Residenz is a terrific hotel to stay at while traveling in Berlin. I stayed there for two nights with my parents and brother and couldn't have been happier. As there were four of us we stayed in the Deluxe Suite. The Deluxe Suite was well beyond our expectations. It had two full bedrooms, a half bath, and a shower room. This was an ideal set up. The hotel reception was very friendly and assited us with transportation and travel details. There were also always apples and iced tea availabe for the guests. The location of the hotel was excellent. It was located about a two minute walk from Checkpoint Charlie. Gendarenmarkt was only about a 5 minute walk away. We did not partake in the hotel breakfast as it was 18 euros a person. There were a dozen backerei near the hotel which we used for breakfast and I would definitely recommend this option.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheerful, convenient”
Reviews.Author: SimoneN
Reviews.Content: Three of us females were looking for a nice but not expensive hotel close to the city centre of Berlin and struck gold at the Hotel Mercure. It's a minute's walk to Checkpoint Charlie and the rest of the city, very convenient. There's a lot of building work going on outside, but little or no noise. The receptionists were friendly and helpful, giving tips on places to go, helping with restaurant bookings etc. Nice touches in reception like bowls of apples...and jugs of cold tea (horrible, I thought it was apple juice and got a shock). Funky decor, with lots of art on teh walls for sale. The bar is tiny, more like an alcove off of the hall. There is a marquee for smokers (there was a lot less indoor smoking in Berlin than I had hoped) but the marquee had rugs and heaters and comfortable tables and chairs so was nice. The breakfast/dining room was respectable, good selection of cereals, breads, yoghurts and juices for breakfast as well as a decent cooked breakfast. The rooms were surprisingly large, or rather, long. Mine had a separate WC from the shower room, the other girls had full shower rooms. Plenty of wardrobe space, mirrors etc., small minibar and plenty of towels and toiletries (which were pleasant and not skin stripping). We all got little packets of jellies on our pillows on the first night...but not the second. Comfortable bed and squashy pillows. We downsides were that we had booked online and the hotel had taken full payment for the rooms in advance...which, as they were only 80 euro a night, were cheap at the price but we discovered on checkout that this hadn't included breakfast. That's about it though ! We ate in restaruant Margaux on the first night, very fine dining...tiny portions so we filled up on the fantastic petits fours...but they were very helpful in perparing wheat free food for a gluten intolerant person in the group. The second night we found a restaurant under the railroad tracks so that we could have wurst and saurkraut...and it was delicious...and very cheap. Plenty of lucious chocolate consumed at the KaDeWe and the famous chocolate shop in Berlin that I can't remember the name of...but you'll find it !

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ilanitko
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and had a wonderfull time. The location is perfect and this was crucial since during our stay there was a strike at all public transpotation. But we still managed to get everywhere and hardly used a taxi. The hotel itself has lovely large rooms, very clean and fresh, the staff is polite and helpfull (but not very warm - I think that's the german nature). There are many caffes at the nearby main street (friedrichstrasse) like starbucks, balzac, kamp's, einstien- so you can skipp breakfast at the hotel since its rather expensive (18 euro per person). You'll find good restaurants for dinner not far from the hotel like "sale&tabacchi". I highly recomend this hotel and hope to visit it again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location and Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cork_Visitor54
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in the Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie at the start of March 08, having booked mainly on the recommendations of trip advisors reviews. Found this to be an excellent hotel to stay for a city break. It's location is ideal as it is close to the U-bahn, S-bahn and is within easy walking distance to the major tourist attractions. We booked a Premier Suite which had two bedrooms, a shower/bath room and a seperate WC. Both bedrooms were very spacious and clean and both had double beds, telephone and TV. There are no tea/coffee making facilites in the rooms. The hotel was very clean, rooms were spacious and the staff were incredibly friendly. Breakfast (which we paid extra for) had a very good selection of hot and cold food and it was also possible to get items made to order from the kitchen. Overall we found this hotel to be extremely good value and the staff were all very friendly and obliging, Would definetly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: zackist
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the property between 4-8 March 2008. The hotel is very well located in the city centre just a few steps from Checkpoint Charlie (wonder where the hotel got it's name from :)), walking distance to one of the most wonderful streets Untder Linden and hence the Pergamom Museum, The Berliner Dom, The Branderburg Gate etc :) The front office was excellant with smiling faces, always helpful. The breakfast was moderate but fullfilling. The rooms as all hotels in Germany were HUGE and spacious. Just go ahead and stay without a doubt I know you will enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: retreatScotland
Reviews.Content: Extremely good value Large rooms, seriously comfy beds, really appreciated fridge in room. Excellent location for sightseeing, in "business" part of city so v quiet at weekends which was great. Staff so very friendly & helpful Hotel recommended nearby restaurant for dinner which was fabulous As a city, Berlin has lots to see, much more that we could do in a long weekend, Very clean and inexpensive compared to UK - nwould go back to both the city and to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Stef_mpl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel 2 months in advance (at a cheaper rate, no cancellation policy). Brilliant value for money for a long weekend. Room was very spacious and very clean, with friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is about 20 minutes walk from most of the main sites and round the corner from the nearest tube (u-bahn). It is also about 5-10 minute walk from a busy shopping area. As with reviews I had previously read on trip advisor, I highly recommend staying here. Stef

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grainne62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 3 nights during Christmas and we were very pleased with this hotel. The staff are friendly are helpful and our room was spotless, spacious with a sitting area. Yes, the breakfast is expensive (16 euros) but most European hotels charge the same. We ate breakfast out - Cafe Adler across the road from Checkpoint Charlie is great value, despite the fact it looks like it is frozen in time! The hotel is in a great location. We loved the city and found the people to be very friendly. We're going back again in August with my family and have all booked into the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Paddy396
Reviews.Content: Am only back (27/1/08-31/01/08) and had a fantastic time. Our room was a deluxe suite and it was worth paying that little bit extra.The location of this hotel was first class. to get from the airport was fairly easy & after mastering the transport system, it was great to get around & quite cheap when you buy an 78 hr pass, ensure you validate your tickets, we were checked 3 times by the undercover inspectors.On arrival in Berlin we hit the ground running and never stopped until we were on the flight home. Would I recommend this hotel, simple answer yes, as it was clean, the staff are very helpful & the location is spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, you'll not regret it.”
Reviews.Author: Donegaltourist
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed in the Mercure from 24-27 January (3 couples) and everyone enjoyed their stay. The hotel is situated a few minutes walk away from Checkpoint Charlie and you can catch one of the hop on hop off buses there for a tour of the city. Wrap up warm as its very cold! Eat in the Italian Restaurant across the road (2 mins walk away). We enjoyed an excellent meal with complimentary garlic bread and after dinner liquers at a reasonable price. Highly recommended!! We found the hotel very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. There are apples in reception and iced tea for guests - a nice touch. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as it was too expensive, alcohol in the hotel is also very expensive. Berlin is a very nice city, plenty to see, wear comfortable shoes for all the sightseeing and shopping. Found the Germans outside of our hotel very stern and abrupt. For example we went for drinks in "Andy's Diner" in Potsdamer Place. We ordered our drinks at the bar from the most unfriendliest Bar Maid I have ever come across in all my travels. There was a mix up with my order and she shouted abuse at me in front of my friends. I calmly said that there was a language barrier. She practically threw the drinks at myself and the rest of my gang with a face like thunder. We quickly drank our drinks and left. They just don't have any idea how to treat customers. A word of advice, don't drink in "Andy's Diner" if you prefer a courteous welcome! All in all we enjoyed our trip to Berlin and would recommend the Mercure for a nice, quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: carolinetayloruk
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for this hotel and i have to say i wasn't dissapointed. On arrival there seemed to be a bit of a mix up with rooms and we ended up with an apartment rather then a double room. It was huge. The room came with a kitchenette, two bathrooms, a living area and a double bed which was very comfortable! The location was superb, right around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Blues9
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a weekend break. Excellent central location close to U bahn. Rooms were very spacious and clean and bathroom modern and large. Good italian restaurant practically across the street - breakfast was expensive though and there is a good choice of places nearby. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jf102
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I've ever stayed in. Helpful and pleasant staff, enormous rooms (we had a suite for 4) which was tastefully decorated and very quiet. Breakfast was a buffet affair with numerous types of muesli, yoghurts, cold cooked meats and fried sausages, eggs and bacon. As well as every type of fruit juice you can imagine and fresh fruit. Very impressed and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 100years
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with 4 other friends for 3 nights. The hotel is in a great location, 10 mins walk to Unter Den Linten, 20 mins to Hackesher Markt. The nearest U-Bahn stations are Kochstrasse (5 mins walk) or Stadtmitte (7-8 mins walk). It's a very safe area for walking around at night and there are plently of restaurants nearby. The other most notable thing at this hotel is the staff. very friendly and welcoming. We were three couples and had booked three double rooms. They asked us on arrival if we would do them a big favour by two of the couples sharing a suite, because they had overbooked the double rooms. It wasnt a big problem for us, because the suite had two bedrooms and was very big. They gave us complimentray breakfast and a free drink each at the bar for the inconvenience. We would definitely stay at this hotel again in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: CalgarySumo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to restaurants, berlin wall, checkpoint charlie, about a 10 minute walk to Potsdamer Platz. Friendly staff. Free internet. Large, spacious room. Very clean. Fitness room consisted of tread mill and stepper; didn't use steam room, but looked good. Very reasonably price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for our family stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: chrisGOxfordUK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the great reviews and expected to be disappointed but wasn't. My grandparents lived in West Berlin but I haven't been back since the wall came down. The hotel is just on the former Eastern side of the wall, a minute away from Checkpoint Charlie and the Ubahn. Fascinating location - a bit edgier and more stylish than the plush fleshpots of the Ku'damm. The hotel car park four floors underground (like the loos in nearby great Italian restaurant Valentino) must have been part of a former Soviet bunker complex. Rebuilding opposite of 1930s building with bullet marks. Very quiet side street: beautifully designed modern interior. Evven a small gymn and sauna ontop floor. Family suite ideal for us (2 boys 9 and 11) spanning the depth of the hotel - two very large bedrooms each with closed-in balcony, and central lobby area with loo and separate bathroom and separate shower.
