Nice designer touches - really comfortable low double beds, separate duvets. Hand shower attached to the bath to wash hair - and a separate shower room. Very quiet ventilator fan to the bathroom. In the main bedroom a dining table which enabled us to eat in one night with our own wine (dirt cheap from local supermarket) and room service - meal for four for 30 euros. There is a good bar service downstairs too. Communal area isn't large but very friendly and the bar is nice. Very good breakfast is extra but we didn't have to pay for the kids. We used a lot of things in this hotel - big laundry wash, car parking for four nights, room service, bar food, drinks, (free) internet access in the lobby - and were suprised at how little the extras cost. Booked through Venere and got a good deal even though late in the day. The staff are very helpful and friendly. I'm very fussy about cleanliness but was impressed at how clean the suite was. Will definitely return when I come back to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and quality”
Reviews.Author: purplenataliemarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a triple room. The room was very spacious, very clean and the staff were extremely well trained. Always very polite, plenty of eye contact. There is no restaurant but the snack menu for the bar has plenty of choice if you are too tired to go out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandra501
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 night break and have to say this hotel was superb. In great location, staff and hotel were above average. Toured all around Berlin and saw lots of other hotels but would not have picked any of them over this one. There are 2 restaurants very close the Entocote and cannot remember the name of the other one but does fantastic pizza and would reccomend them both. I would not recoomend the restaurant Maximiilions - very popular but some of the worst food I have ever had. If I came back to Berlin I would most stay here again. Not a museum person usually but the Check Point Charlie museum is well worth a vist, also from the hotel there are loads of inoformation boards just a few yards away which are fasinating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and good value”
Reviews.Author: svicious22
Reviews.Content: Central location convenient to the subway, very large room and no problems with the staff or service. Bed was a bit small for two and the cleanliness was only average. Room was located on a courtyard and very quiet with a small balcony that would have been great except it lacked any seating. Nice winebar on the first floor in the courtyard was a thoroughly enjoyable experience with excellent wine and service. All in all a good deal and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: santa1955
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the new center of the city. About 50 m from the famous Friedrichstrasse and 100 m from "Checkpoint Charlie". Potsdamer Platz, Alexander Platz, Gerdamen Markt, Berlin Dom, Unten Der Linden avenue, Reichstag and many other interesting places are easy to reach on foot or by using the bus or the U ban. Berlin is a very large city but the is no problem to visit any place you like as the transportation system is excellent. The hotel is absolutely a gem! We stayed in an apartment which is situated next door to the main hotel. The room was amazing.Very big, spacious, with high ceilings, extremely clean, equipped even with full kitchen facilities and a Micro wave oven. Our room had no view to the street but this was not a problem as it faces the inner court yard which is very nice. All the building is an architectural miracle. An old building which has been transformed perfectly by the Italian architecture Rossi. The people working there are very kind, always with a smile and all the time ready to help. When we arrived we received an envelope with maps, suggested places to visit and many other informations which were proved very helpful during our staying in the city. The room service is excellent with very good prices. The only thing that is missing is an English speaking channel on TV. We never had breakfast so no opinion about it. In general it is a fantastic hotel and maybe the best value for money that you can find in Berlin. We booked this hotel in May we stayed 7 nights and without breakfast the cost was only 420 Euros!!!! If we ever visit Berlin again we know where to stay! This hotel is a must!

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie
HotelInfo.Address: Schuetzenstrasse 11, 10117 Berlin, Germany
